Pro-government militias from Kutum and el-Waha localities believed to be Janjaweed are backed up by Antonov airplane flying over the streets leading to Tabit while they loot all citizens travelling from and to Tabit. They attack several civilians accusing them of being Torabora.
Farmers from Tawilah and neighbouring villages have witnessed trespassing of herders and have been the victims of random violence
Sudanese air forces bomb Jebel Kuwa village
Sudanese air forces bomb Shat Safia, Jebel Kua and Fama villages of Buram locality
Sudanese air forces bom Alaba-Maruda, Alnugra and Tablo villages of Umm Durin locality
Sudanese air forces bomb Fama and Dabkar villages

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Clash between extremist group and security forces leaves two dead and four policemen injured

column9: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Militants attack and kill merchant known as Sumeet in front of his shop
Police forces track down perpetrators of Sumeets attack. One militant is killed and 4 residents and a policeman are injured
Sudanese air forces bomb Daloka village of South Kadugli
Sudanese air forces bomb El Ganaia village

column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information; Radio Dabanga
column17: Supporters of the National Congress Party, backed by the National Intelligence and Security Services, assault Darfuri students protesting at the University of al-Zaeim al-Azhari in Khartoum
Sudanese air forces bomb Kabila of Habila area

The security services of El-Jazeera state, located south of Khartoum, are called to end the clashes between students from Darfur and others supporting the National Congress Party (NCP) at the Gezira University. About 10 students are injured and a number of Darfuri students arrested. Four Darfuri students are found dead on Friday 07/12/2012
SLM-MM denies responsibility placed by governor of Dar el Salaam and accuses pro-government militia instead of attacking two trade convoys travelling from Al- Fasher to Dar el Salaam and back
Sudanese air forces bomb Koka village of Salara
A group of armed men attack a vehicle carrying passengers travelling from Nyala to Bulbul Dalal Abu Anagarah
Sudanese air forces bomb Buram town and el Azrag village

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Security forces arrest Abdul Mula Musa Mohammed, commissioner of Kosti town over the attempted coup
Pro-Government militia attack Gereidas neighbourhoods of Saadoum, Al-Rahman east and west, and Wahaya Al-Wadi
Sudanese air forces bomb Buram
Armed forces attack the LJM rebel movements site in the area of Hillat al Sheikh at about 14 kilometres southwest of El Fasher. Two rebels are killed and three are arrested
Sudanese air forces bomb villages of Kufa, Lima and Miri Juwa, in west Kadugli
Sudanese air forces bomb villages of Fama and Shat Safia
Sudanese air forces bomb Muguf
Sudanese air forces bomb Yabus
Armed herders clash with police forces backed by the military in Mesteriha locality. One herder is killed

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Female students from Darfur enrolled at the Gezira University in El-Jazeera complain about attacks on their dormitories at night time carried out by members of the National Intelligence and Security Services (NISS)

Armed men raid the headquarters of the Nyala special court for crimes and kidnap three defendants after shooting at the courts police and severely beating the judge. The defendants are on trial for looting 450 thousand US dollars and 45 million Sudanese pounds belonging to UNAMID, approximately three months ago
Armed herders burn the village of Runja as well as two other villages. One resident is killed
Armed herders attack a truck en route from El Geneina and seize large quantities of sugar, flower and 22 thousand Sudanese pounds.

Intense and at times violent demonstrations take place as students of several universities take to the streets denouncing the killing of four Darfuri students from the University of Gezira. They are violently dispersed by police. Several students are arrested

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Displaced from Zam Zam camp are robbed at gunpoint by three Abu-Tira Reserve forces
Armed herders clash with police and army at village of Runja

Pro-government militias raid the camps of Tom Kitir, Hashaba, Tello and Hillet Shumen in the localities of Manawashy and Mershing localities. The militias leave the area on Tuesday morning in the direction of Netaiga
Sudanese forces attack SPLM-N position in Daldako, 15 km east of Kadugli. According to SPLM-N 21 government soldiers are killed
Sudanese air forces bomb Umm Serdeba

Students and NCP militias, backed by security forces burn down the rooms of Darfuri students in the dormitories. It is reported that dozens of students are missing and that about 180 students are injured as a result of the clashes.
SPLM-N claims to have shot down military plane at Um Kiraisha area of Al-Sunoot Locality while it was bombarding Um Dorain locality

UNAMID receives reports of an increasing number of civilians - from the villages of Daly, Kotto, Msaleet, Nomaira, Dawa Sharafa, Dolma and Hemaida in the wider Shangil Tobaya area - who have to flee to the Nifasha camp for internally displaced persons (IDPs) as a result of alleged attacks by armed groups in the area the previous week.
A clash between the SAF and an unidentified armed group at Tibadiyat village, located approximately 20 kilometres south-east of Shangil Tobaya, results in the death of one combatant

UNAMID receives reports of an increasing number of civilians - from the villages of Daly, Kotto, Msaleet, Nomaira, Dawa Sharafa, Dolma and Hemaida in the wider Shangil Tobaya area - who have to flee to the Nifasha camp for internally displaced persons (IDPs) as a result of alleged attacks by SAF air strikes in the area the previous week.
Pro-government militia loot village of Goz Beina
Militiamen stationed around the Abu Delek area kill Sabun Hagar Siraj, the son of a cousin of the El-Fasher commissioner

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Members of the Central Reserve Forces shoot dead a basic school student at Zam Zam camp

Pro-government militias driving seven Land Cruisers abduct three people as they traveling from El-Fasher to Goz Beina village. The passengers are brought to the militias camp in Dugum area, east of Dar-El-Salaam
Pro-government militias kidnap two herders and loot a number of their camels at Dermah locality
SRF troops kill nine Sudanese soldiers during clashes with the government troops in the area of Biir Jaber and capture three other soldiers
SAF carries out an air strike and wrongly kills 27 of its own soldiers as they are mistakenly taken for SRF troops
Agreement: The Berti and Ziyadiyah tribes of North Darfur sign a peace charter in El Fasher
Herders allegedly armed by the government kill one man, wound two others and burn 15 huts at the voluntary return village of Hujair Sambo, in Bilel locality
An alleged pro-government militia is being accused of attacking a commercial vehicle in the area of Girwiet Bershem, Dar El Salaam locality in North Darfur
Pro-government militia loot two vehicles carrying merchandise and passengers in the area of Jemmeiza near Tarma, as they are traveling from Kabkabiya to El- Fasher via Kutum
An attack by an unknown armed group on a police station in the locality of Jebel Moon in West Darfur leaves two police officers dead and another three wounded
Hundreds of Darfuri students rally in front of the Ministry of Justice. The students carry banners demanding punishment of the perpetrators who killed the four Darfuri students
More than 15 armed herders, allegedly loyal to the government, attack a group of 30 farmers while they are working on their farms.
Two women are found dead after a Sudanese antonov plane bombs Tagala village in Tiere area of Rashad County

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: The Sudan Liberation Movement led by Abdel Wahid Al Nour, announces the killing of more than 20 Sudanese soldiers in an attack on an army base in Jebel Moon.

Students from the University of Kordofan in El Obeid protest against the murder of four Darfuri students enrolled at Gezira University and the use of excessive violence during student protests at several universities in Khartoum during recent protests.
Displaced from different villages in Tawila areas, arrive to Tawila camps in North Darfur following attacks by the Sudanese army.
Sudanese air forces bomb villages of Umm Serdeba, Al Latmore and Al Nugra
Displaced from different villages in Tawila areas, arrive to Tawila camps in North Darfur following attacks by armed groups.
A group of militants attack displaced who work in the gold mines in the area of Hashaba, Kutum locality
The village of Almanzalah is set on fire during an offensive in the Nuba Mountains by the Sudanese Armed Forces against a rebel group
SAF bomb area between Tess village and Buram town and village of Shat Damam
Reports claim that two Sudanese military planes drop 28 bombs at town of Kawdah
An air strike in Buram County of South Kordofan kills one
Sudanese air forces bomb Kumu and Mendi villages

column9: JEM: Justice and Equality Movement; Students (Sudan)
column17: Security and police forces as well as supporters of the National Congress Party, attack student supporters of the Justice and Equality Movement (JEM) and student organizations during a commemoration event for former JEM leader, Dr. Khalil Ibrahim
Recruitment: A former Janjaweed commander indicted for war crimes in Darfur, starts to mobilize new people in the locality of Taham and Umm Nunu at the border of West and South Darfur
Sudanese air forces bomb Um Serdeba and Al Negra
Sudanese air forces bomb villages of Umm Serdeba and Al Negro

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLM/AW fighters attack Abu Tira base at Thur, a location on the Nyala Zalengei road near Nertiti. SRF claims that at least seven soldiers are killed. The SRF acknowledges that three of its own soldiers are also killed during the fighting
Sudanese air forces bomb Kumo village of Heiban locality

In the nearby market village on the road to Zalingei in the direction of Golo in the Wissi Mountains, gunmen kill two citizens, two women are raped and the gunmen loot the village. The gunmen escape to a base of the Central Police Forces (Abu Tira) in the village of Tur on the road from Nyala to Zalingei near Niertete

Citizens in Adila, hold a demonstration to protest the presence of the governor of North Kordofan during the opening ceremony of a new oil well at the border of the East Darfur state and North Kordofan
Sudanese air forces bomb Kawdah valley and neighbouring villages of Eiri and Kalkutta. In Eiri, the bomb hit a small compound, killing four children and the mother of two of them.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: The SRF of Abdel Wahid claims it has captured the major SAF base in a central town Golo of Central Darfur. According to the SRF the SAF loses over 90 people, while the SRF suffers at least 7 dead casualties and 10 wounded combatants
Sudanese air forces bomb villages of Mendi and Kalkutta
Four policemen are injured when a government-armed militia attacks and loots a police station in the village Numu some kilometres east of Wadi Bare South of Kabkebia in North Darfur
A displaced man from Gereida camp in South Darfur is allegedly killed by pro-government militiamen
Sudanese air forces bomb village of Barasani some kilometres west of the central town of Golo. Two civilians die
Sudanese air forces bomb Adar village of Buram county
Residents from Manawashy locality in South Darfur complain about attacks by pro-government militants stationed on the roads around the locality

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: A clash between the army and the government border guards kills two soldiers and injures four in Al Misserya neighbourhood in Kutum town
Sudanese air forces bomb Kawdah town
A demonstration takes place inside Ronga Tas camp against the governments decision to transfer the camp to a a model village

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLM/A Wahid claim to have captured Jildu which lies between Golo and Niertete in West Jebel Marra

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: The Sudan Revolutionary Front (SRF) led by Abdel Wahid (AW) captures Jumeza near Kas

Local herders kill an elder from the nearby Ardeba camp for internally displaced people in Garsila of Central Darfur. The local sheikh is reportedly killed because he refused the men to enter his plot of cultivated land in Wadi Bera, just two kilometres outside the official camp.
Militants attack Kulla village in Saraf Umra leading to the death of three civilians and one gunman

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudanese forces carry out air strikes in West Jebel Marra where Jildu has recently been captured by rebels. Two civilians are killed
Pro-government militia attack displaced from Ardiba camp
Military forces throw people out of Kanartenka, Kashny and Kanjara villages and establish a military base
Three gunmen believed to belong to a pro-government militia reportedly shoot and kill a sheikh from camp Silo, in Mershing locality

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: The Sudanese army reports that it has retaken the control of Golo after its seizure by the fighters of Sudan Liberation Movement

Sudanese air forces bomb Buram
JEM rebels rob civilians in Al Tawisha market

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Abu Tira forces and government troops begin firing shots in the air and using sticks, whips and tear gas to disperse Ronga Tas camp demonstrators who protest against the arrest of the sheikh of the Ronga Tas camp, along with a displaced man, and against the governments decision to transfer the camp to a a model village. The camps deputy leader is killed

JEM claims to have taken control of the areas of Jerhaman, Tom Bashara, Al Zarankh, Dardoug, Faqr, Andharab and Obeid, in a widespread campaign in Kordofan, while forcing the government troops to withdraw to Al Nuhud, Jerbian, Babanusa and Al Tabun
Sudanese authorities arrest twenty activists- members of the Unionist Movement- after holding a protest in the capital to celebrate the Independence Day
JEM rebels loot areas of Kano and Al Tashween
Militants loot Jaira village 40km north of Kutum

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Central Reserve Forces attack three citizens in the Atallah area, Central Darfur

Pro government militias loot the following villages: Arkotulah, Kartoum Djedib and Karaduz Mortal
South Sudanese army attacks Balila area of Samaha in disputed East darfur and clashes with Al-Rizaygat tribe
SAF bombs small village just outside Buram

Pro-government militiamen reportedly rape and shave the heads of three women in the village of Karados in East Jebel Marra, North Darfur, part of a widespread campaign carried out by government forces and its militias against the people of East Jebel Marra
SAF shell the regions of Sabi, Keira and Katour
SAF bomb areas of Bernjo, Jebel Nazir and Dobo

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SAF drop bombs north of Jildu garrison controlled by rebels
Pro-government militia kill displaced from Kalma camp

Soldiers traveling on a government convoy composed of about 240 Land Cruisers commit widespread abuses against civilians in East Jebel Marra, while closing off all roads leading to El-Fasher and Tabila.

Pro- government militia, allegedly sent by North Darfur security, loot El-Ayet locality

Fierce clashes take place between three clans of the Arab Misseriya tribe; Awlad Serur, Awlad Metanin and Heiban

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)

Pro- government militia, allegedly sent by North Darfur security, loot El-Ayet locality for second consecutive day

Change to armed group: Al-Qaeda in Sudan announces the birth of its student wing in the University of Khartoum

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Tensions continue for fith consecutive day at Jabal Amer with more villages burnt including Um-Jadwa, Qisah, Ashim and Rajil al-Zari. The Border Force [government militia] camp under the command of Al-Duma al-Jadi is destroyed. Abbala members close down all vital roads leading to the localities capital

Security services reportedly fire tear gas and beat students from the Khartoum University who have taken the streets to protest against policies of the National Congress Party (NCP). The crowd is joined by student unions from the Nuba Mountains and from El-Manasir
Pro government militia loot Naga Doli village of Zalingei locality
Seven secondary schools are burned during a violent protest staged by students from Zalingei, Central Darfur, against the murder of their colleague stabbed on the day before over a quarrel about food
Sudans army claims to have killed more than 50 rebels in clashes in two areas, namely, Al-Hamrah and Al-Ahhaymir, some 15 kilometres from Kadugli
At least 10 civilians are killed after a government Antonov airplane shells the area of Dresa, north-east of East Jebel Marra

Four Chinese drivers along with eleven Sudanese workers who were transporting building materials at a construction site on the road between El Fasher and Um Keddada are kidnapped by militants.

LJM reports the killing of 25 army soldiers and their militiamen during an attack at Abu Adjura of South Darfur. Two rebels and two civilians are also killed, while the governor of South Darfur claims the army captured the rebels commander
Sudanese air forces bomb Tess village
Pro-government militia loot Marghouba village of voluntary, 14km west Kabkabiya locality

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Arrests: The Chairperson of the Central Council of the National Sudanese Alliance Party is arrested. The arrest is believed to connect to the political negotiations under the New Dawn Charter signed in Kampala

Militia loot a trade vehicle at Arimba area, 7km from Kabkabiya
A pro-government militiaman kills two after requested to pay for purchased good
SAF bomb Tabanya village
Pro-government miliia attack a school for Koran at Katool locality
Renewed clashes take place in Adjiher , 9 km west from al-Sref Beni Hussein city
Fighting between the ethnic militia takes place at Seleleh area, 13km north of Umm Dukhum locality, near the border with West Darfur and Chad
Agreement: Administrative leaders of the Arab tribes of Abbala and Beni Hussein sign a cease-fire treaty in the presence of the governor of North Darfur
Members of Abbala attack village Karkara

column17: Abu-Tira forces and pro-government militia raid market of Tur city, Zallingi locality
A group of Abbala members attack the market of camp El-Salam, in South Darfur

SPLM-N claims to have been attacked by Sudanese army and their militias at Al-Shirif village of Al Sonut locality
Abbala militia loot Seleleh market and hospital

column17: Arrests: Security police arrests 25 Darfurian students coming form Amman
Pro government militia attack and loot Abu Denga, Jalab and Hashaba villages of Sirba locality

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Looting: Security services break into the house of a local official of the Sudanese Communist Party in Omdurman and seize a number of documents and ectronic devices.
SAF bomb Abu Zayd village in east Jebel Marra, reportedly the site of an agricultural project set out by the Sudanese government
Three civilians (teachers) are killed and another injured by SPLM-N in Al-Kalang area, Abu Karshola rural in Al-Rashad Locality
SAF bombs Tamadango and Tess villages in Reika of Buram county
Militia from the Bedouin group attack an army base in Fata Bamo displaced camp.
Al Rashiydah militia attack Shagarab camp and abduct four refugee women
A group of armed men attack and loot a commercial vehicle at Ammar, 1 km south of Garseila
Goz Bena, Hillat Faki Ali and Arab Bashir farm areas of Al-Fasher locality suffer severe attacks from herders reportedly armed by the government

A group of armed militia attack El-Shaheed town in Kabkabiya locality
SPLM-N ambushes a Sudanese army convoy on road linking Dilling to Um Haitan
Armed militia loot and kill a herder at Ibada area of Wadi Saleh
Agreement: 11 Sudanese engineers and road builders are also freed after the earlier release of their four Chinese co-workers
A Beni Halba tribesman kills a member of the Misseriya group at Umm Nunu. Allegedly the matter is solved amicably via offering money and cattle to the Misseriya.

Pro-government militia, reportedly led by Osman Mohamed Ibrahim who signed an internal peace agreement with the government of North Darfur last year, loot a group of eighteen passengers at the Les Kineh area in Tawila locality
SAF bomb Dolma, Sharafah, Jenq and Dar Bosh areas in the region of East Jebel Marra, North Darfur
SAF bomb Rekia, Masakin and Buram villages of Buram county
Pro-government militia loot civilians travelling from Al Fasher to Tabit
Abala ethnic militia kill a farmer and injure his brother by the Mirsu valley in Bindisi locality
SAF bomb Oram, Mukok, Jodan and Ajentio villages of South Kumuk
Pro-government militia open fire against a mechanic asking for money for repairing their motorcycle

Militia led by Yousef al Saer, attack commercial vehicle travelling from Nertiti to Nuala
Militia kill student to steal his motorcycle
Pro-government militias still cattle from Sirba locality
Beni Halba and Misseriya tribe groups clash at Umm Nunu
An unidentified group of armed men attack and kill a displaced man from Kassab camp in Kutum locality
Police clash with pro-government militia at Sirba locality. A militiaman is killed
A convoy of 100 pro-government militia loot and beat anyone who crosses their way while travelling from Nertiti to Juldo and Golo areas
JEM claim to repulse attack by Chadian forces killing dozens of soldiers

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Sudanese security services storm the building of the Khartoum University beating students and firing gunshots and tear gas in the air after students locked its doors trying to prevent the second vice-president from attending a graduation ceremony

An eyewitness told Radio Dabanga the security services beat students and fired gunshots and tear gas in the air, leading to the injury of two victims, Muamar and Wifak, a female student
Three displaced persons were seriously injured in Gereida locality, South Darfur, after being shot by government militiamen in revenge of a dispute the day before
The United Nations has said that the fighting over a gold mine in North Darfur State [western Sudan] has forced 100,000 people to flee.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: The rebel group Sudan Liberation Movement-Abdel Wahid (SLM-AW) is claiming that government forces fired six missiles on the city of Golo, Central Darfur, killing one girl and injuring two others.

The Sudanese army accused South Sudan forces (SPLA) of not fulfilling prompt and unconditional withdrawal of its troops from five disputed areas stressing that such position negatively affects security and stability of the border between the two states

SLM-Minni Minnawi spokesman Adam Saleh announced the group ambushed a government convoy around Wadi Umm Kitra, east Tabit, North Darfur on Tuesday afternoon. He claims the movement killed 11 government troops and wounded a few others, besides capturing three soldiers and seizing three Land Cruisers.

Displaced living in Zam Zam near El-Fasher in North Darfur are complaining the camp has been closed for one week due to constant attacks by pro-government militias and Central Reserve Forces (known as Abu Tira).
Looting: Unidentified gunmen attacked a truck carrying salaries of workers of the Ministry of Animal Resources in South Darfur State hours before it was to be paid.

Movement of forces: The Sudanese Revolutionary Front (SRF) has claimed that fighters of a Malian Islamist group have arrived in North Darfur state as they fled northern Mali after attacks by the French and Malian armies

Security services arrested three civilians on Wednesday who were demanding compensation for damages caused by the establishment of an oilfield in their home area. The arrests led ""thousands"" to stage a protest in the states capital, Ed Daein, demanding the immediate release of the prisoners, sources told Radio Dabanga
One woman was killed and at least 10 others were wounded as a result of ""government bombings"" in East Jebel Marra, North Darfur, on Wednesday.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Two days of battles between rebels and the Sudanese army near Golo in Central Darfur left 'over 100 killed and dozens wounded' on both sides, the Sudan Liberation Movement- Abdel Wahid (SLM-AW) claims

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Two days of battles between rebels and the Sudanese army near Golo in Central Darfur left 'over 100 killed and dozens wounded' on both sides, the Sudan Liberation Movement- Abdel Wahid (SLM-AW) claims

""One UN staff member, a security guard supervisor, was found stabbed to death. The perpetrators and the motive are unknown.""

The Sudanese air force dropped four bombs inside a secondary school building and two on a church last Saturday, 9 February, in South Kordofan, the Sudans People Liberation Movement-North (SPLM-N) claims

The executive director of Nitega locality in South Darfur was shot dead along with his bodyguard on Monday morning while travelling between Kass and Nyala

The three victims, who include two police officers, were killed in Umm Shalaya locality while several others were wounded.

In the Bau locality, SPLA-N and SAF fought on Sunday in the areas between Derang and Salbel as well as Shamshur and Goldamu. SPLA-N claims the SAF lost 10 soldiers and they have one casualty.
West of Buram town, clashes broke out after Abala herdsmen released their cattle onto the farmland of the Habbaniyah. 10 people were killed.
""Government backed militiamen"" killed a man while he was collecting firewood south of Gereida camp.
A woman farmer was killed by a herder over a land dispute. The event took place in Dubo in East Jebel Marra.
Militiamen attacked Tartura village, south of Kass.
""Government backed militiamen"" killed a man while he was collecting firewood south of Gereida camp. They also attacked a lorry in the area, beating several of the passengers.
Militiamen shot a club owner who refused to let them enter. It took place in Hashaba, east of Kass.
Four ""Government backed militiamen"" raped three women from Bir Dageeg camp in Goz Segeit. Segeit is west of Bir Dageeg and in the locality of Sirba.
""Government backed militiamen abducted ten families"" from Sanga, near Gereida.
SAF bombed Tanasa village in Boram county.
West of Buram Town, renewed clashes from violence between the two groups which erupted on 8/12/13.
SRF bombed SAF military targets. 1 civilian killed
SAF bombed the areas of: Kauda, Mandi and Komo.
SAF bombed Nimra in East Jebel Marra. A family of 4 was killed.
Clashes broke out between unidentified herdsmen and Faya Community after herdsmen stole 150 cattle.
Government backed militiamen attacked a woman from silo camp in the Mershing locality.
SRF and SAF fought in the area of Abata, near Zalingi. 9 killed and 10 wounded.
SAF ground troops looted and burned the villages of Kega-Alkhail in Jigeba, Torlet, and Kuldang. Dozens killed.

column16: South Sudan News Agency; Radio Dabanga
column17: SRF and SAF bombed Kadulgi to attack each other
SAF retook Dilling and Jabal areas after the SRF fled the area due to bombing.
SAF bombed Kadulgi area. Three people injured.
SAF bombed the areas of: Kanga and Lima. Dozens killed.
Government backed militiamen attacked people from Kereinik camp while they were collecting straw.
Movement of forces: Report that fighters from CAR are crossing the CAR-Sudan border with weapons and equipment.
SAF and SRF fought in Korongo by shelling each other.
Government backed militiamen attacked a merchant and his wife in Kuteiri, east of Abata in Central Darfur.
SAF and SRF fought in Korongo by shelling each other.
8 people were killed by SAF bombs dropped on the area of Tirmo in South Kordofan.
The areas of Katcha and Farw, south of Korongo, and Korongo itself, were bombed by the SAF.
SAF dropped bombs on Kauda, killing 1 person.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Change to armed group: 42 members of the SAF defected to the SLM/A-Wahid in the Nuba mountains.
SAF says it re-took the area of Abu Al-Hassan. Several soldiers were killed. SAF seized ammunition and weapons.
SLM/A announced they destroyed an SAF military base in Duma. Munitions and vehicles were seized. 27 government soldiers were killed.
Government backed militia attacked a lorry in Tor, north of Kass.
In Nyala, gunmen shot at and robbed shop owners while they were riding in a rickshaw.
Armed herders attacked Kassab camp. Civilians were beaten and 3 women assaulted while collecting firewood.
Militia killed a 7 year old boy in the market.
Residents of Zamzam camp protested the release of 4 troops who were accused of killing three camp residents.
SAF dropped bombs on Jebel Khor Mali El Kabir in East Jebel Marra
Two women from Sibag El Kheil camp for the displaced in Kabkabiya were raped by militiamen.

Government backed militia assaulted, robbed, and pillaged the area of Kharasan, Keilak locality in West Kordofan. The local government requested that the SAF kick out the pro-government militias. Between 30-35 people were killed.
CAR fighters entered um Dukhun in land cruisers filled with weapons and settled in the area of Um Nunu.
LMJ-Karbino, SLM-Wahid, and SLM Minnawi overtook a military garrison in Katayla. 20 people were killed.
Armed herdsmen attacked farmers in Kereinek locality, West Darfur.
In Bowrgo, 30km south of Damazin, the SPLA-N attacked SAF. 1 SPLA-N member was killed.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: 2 UNAMID peacekeepers killed. Peacekeepers were from Jordan and Senegal.
Aerial bombardment inUm Haraz, west of Jebel Marra.
Lorries attacked in the area of Magta in Sheiria locality in East Darfur.
Government recaptured Ardibah in South Kordofan.
""Two UN-contracted individuals (driver and assistant) were abducted by an unknown armed group. The driver, his assistant, and the truck were released 20 days later.""
Strike:At an oil company in Adila, workers went on strike for 3 days (1 Jan- 3 Jan) over contracts.
""Militiamen ... injured two displaced residents of camp Khamsa Degaig in Zalingei locality in Central Darfur""
Government backed militiamen attacked the area of Lafat Kasara, near Tor in Central Darfur.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Battle between SLM/A-W and government in area of Jebel Marra and around Gulu and Wrokrow areas including Tiboon, Sibna, Dooli, Jadeed, Burri, Tiro, Kleen, Kurmuk, and Dana
Lorries attacked by gunmen in Shattai locality in South Darfur.
Four bombs dropped in Nuba mountains by SAF.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Battle between SLM-W and government at base of Beesa near the town of Kabkaia
Aerial bombardments targetting Jebel Marra and areas of: Burgo, Rufta, Dibba Nayra, Kaura, and Si Yamo
Non-violent activity: Militiamen went to El Salam camp and fired bullets in the air between 8pm-11pm
""Three residents of Hai El Mawashi camp for the displaced in Kabkabiya, North Darfur were seriously injured on Thursday in an attack by government-backed gunmen east of Kabkabiya city. ""
Strike:At an oil company in Adila, workers went on strike for 3 days (1 Jan- 3 Jan) over contracts.
Sudanese nationals fleeing violence from Malakal entered Jauda. They were arrested and tortured in Jauda by security forces.
SPLA-N says it re-took Abu-al-Hasan and Al-Adiba areas in Abu Karshula locality of South Kurdufan.

SRF and SAF fought in Wadi Eweiji, north of Kutum, North Darfur. 41 government troops died and 2 SRF died. ""Two Sukhoi fighter jets bombed the area, killing a number of cattle and camels, and torching large areas of grasslands and farms.""
Strike:At an oil company in Adila, workers went on strike for 3 days (1 Jan- 3 Jan) over contracts.
""Last week gunmen of the Sudan Liberation Army/Minni Minnawi faction reportedly attacked Katela area in South Darfur.""

""Sudan Revolutionary Front (SRF) announced that they destroyed and dispersed eight Sudanese military convoys in the area of Trogi in South Kordofan"". Military reported overtaking areas in: Toroji, Angolo and Dabakaiya.
Two women from Erli camp were raped by government backed militiamen.
Gunman opened fired on a doctor at Deleig hospital, in Wadi Salih locality, Central Darfur.
Aerial bombs dropped on Adam Kambal village, located 15km south of El Salam camp in Nyala locality. 2 children injured and 9 sheep killed.
Fighting reported in Abyei but the actors were not identified. 8 people killed.
Battle in Dalami. Both sides claim the other looted after the battle.
Three women were raped by government backed militiamen.
Military and SRF fought in near Nierteti in Central Darfur. 9 government troops were killed.
SAF and SPLA-N fought in Malkan at Angasana Mountains, Blue Nile state. Both claim victory.
Fighting between the groups displaced 1000 people in the area.
SLA targetted a commercial vehicle in Central Darfur.
Reports that: ""SPLM-N artillery shelled the military garrison of Um Burambita in Rashad locality in South Kordofan.""
Clashes between Misseriya and Khazam left 9 dead - 2 Misseriya and 7 Khazam.
Herders entered Garsila and beat up butchers. The herders said a camel was stolen and killed.
Battle in Fayo, near Dalami. 7 soldiers killed.
Unidentified gunmen in Land Cruizers attacked the town of Khor Abeche. Civilians were injured and houses burnt to the ground.
SAF reported that it fought an unidentified armed group 45 km east of Zallingi. The SAF ""seized with guns and small arms , while more than 150 people of the group were killed and 8 were captured. ""
""Minni Minawi (SLM-MM) announced the killing of a militia commander and 11 of his men on Thursday evening in the area of Khor Abeche""

column6: Mutiny of Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Agreement: Soldiers who supported Machar surrendered to the governor of West Kordofan.
Agreement: 54 members of a Nuer battalion disarmed in Heglig and were provided refugee status. Those who did not disarm were told to return to South Sudan.
Aerial bombarments over Dady and Tabit in East Jebel Marra, South Kordofan, Nuba Mountains. 1 man killed.

The marketplace at Al Salam camp was attacked by an armed group from Um Qoja who were government backed militia. 6 people were killed according to Radio Dabanga. 2. Militias also assaulted 4 people while collecting firewood.
""Gereida locality, South Darfur, two people were killed and four others were wounded by militiamen in two separate incidents on Saturday""
Report states: ""Sudan Liberation Movement led by Minni Minnawi (SLM-MM) also attacked an IDPs camp in Baleel locality and killed 5 people including 4 police officers""

In Dan Kouj: 1. Government backed militiamen attacked farmers on 11 Jan. 1 gunman killed. 2. Militiamen retaliated by torching the farms on 12 Jan and attacking a police station whereby they took ammunition and weapons, then torched the station.

AT El-Salam camp, militiamen harassed residents while the residents were collecting firewood. The residents were detained and beaten for not providing money to the militiamen. In addition, ""armed group killed 3 police officers, 2 IDPs, and injured 7 others, stressing that perpetrators mainly intended to loot citizens and commercial shops.""
""A shop owner was assaulted and a woman seriously injured on Saturday in Gurnei village, Nierteti locality in Central Darfur""

In Dan Kouj: 1. Government backed militiamen attacked farmers on 11 Jan. 1 gunman killed. 2. Militiamen retaliated by torching the farms on 12 Jan and attacking a police station whereby they took ammunition and weapons, then torched the station.
""Five militiamen in military uniforms in a Land Cruiser mounted with a Duchka machine gun, opened fire""
SLM led by Karbino attacked the Sunta military garrison. 13 soldier killed.
Two men on Kassub camp were killed by government backed militia.
Aerial bombardments south of Nyala - three villages most affected are El Fula, Halit Masaliit, and Halit Abu Asha.
Sudanese army attacked El-Salam camp, beating up several people. Army declared the camp was to have limited movement.
Pro-government militiamen attacked a commercial vehicle in Bamba, injuring two men.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Residents of Kalma camp were intercepted by Abu Tira militia while collecting firewood. Two people were killed.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Director and other members for the Nuba Mountains Observatory for Human Rights were detained in Khartoum in January 2014 and tortured until released in August 2014. The workers were accused of collaborating with the ICC to investigate crimes committed in Darfur.
Reports of attacks on farms by herders and pro-government militia in the areas of: (Gorne, Maleh, Saga Dur, Danga and Ranaga in) Niertiti and (Dankouj, Abta, and Arwa in) Zalingei.
Unknown gunmen fired on lorries, killing 2 people in the area of Ajjoura in Abu Karinka
Arrests: Two days (16-17 Jan) of raids, arrests, and harassment by Sudanese forces on the Murnei refugee camp.
Fighting between the SPLA-N and SAF in Malkan.
SAF and SRF/SPLA-N fought in Maklan, Blue Nile State. 74 Sudanese army were killed.
Movement of forces: Sudanese and Chadian forces entered Kabkabiya locality, putting the residents in fear and hindering their ability to go about daily life.
Sudanese army looted and beat up a store owner on El-Salam camp.
Man was attacked by pro-government militia while on his way back from collecting firewood.
Villagers in Martouna, near Kass, were beaten by militia while collecting firewood.
Aerial bombardments in Tabit area: areas of Kadareik and Um Laouta, located 3km north of Tabit
Sudanese forces entered Kenjara. They beat villagers and looted the areas.
A woman was raped by militiamen in two separate incidents in Nierteti locality, Central Darfur
Protests over bread shortage and price hikes in Khartoum neighbourhoods of Burri and Manshiya, and Kalakla in south Khartoum
Aerial combarments over Tabit.
SPLA-N and SAF fought in Blue Nile State. SPLA-N stated they killed dozens of soldiers.
Security forces took ""Emad Ahmed who is the head of the RNP youth sector in the East Nile"", arrested and tortured him.
3 Janjaweed militia attached two men in two separate incidents on 20/1/2014 in Mershing locality.
Aerial bombardments over Tabit
Militiamen killed a man for his mobile phone.
Protests over bread shortage and price hikes in Khartoum neighbourhoods of Burri and Manshiya, and Kalakla in south Khartoum
Reprts that: ""Kalma camp reported to Radio Dabanga that ""Janjaweed"" opened fire on a group of 15 displaced. They were collecting firewood in Wadi Taisha on Monday.""
Three gunmen attacked shoolboy Abakar Osman, of the Northern Nierteti
""Protesting students at the University of Zalingei in Central Darfur on Tuesday were subjected to beating by the security forces. ""

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: SRF and SLM-MM attacked the Abu Tira and police station.
Aerial combardments over Tabit, including nearby villages of: seven bombs on the area north of Dubo El Omda, one on Mashrou Abu Zeid, and seven on Hafir Kutur. 1 peson was killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Reports that: ""from Garsila, a source said that two gunmen in uniforms of the Central Reserve forces (Abu Tira) on Wednesday at about 11pm attacked two farmers.""

""A UN contracted truck driver and his assistant were kidnapped off the road between Nyala and Gereida while driving a truck filled with provisions. The truck was also taken. At the time of this writing, the two national contracted staff members are still missing.""

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Battle in Kalaimendo, near El-Fasher, killed 15-20 government troops and two civilians. Police station was also attacked.
Aerial combardments over Jebel Marra, in particular around Funga village.
Aerial bombardments of Tindemin.
Maalia and Rizeigat tribesmen on Friday fought in Khomsat area in Adila locality, East Darfur over stolen sheep. 6 Rizeigat were killed

column9: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: ""Sudan Liberation Movement led by Abdel Wahid El Nur (SLM-AW), reported to Radio Dabanga that their troops, under the banner of the SRF, attacked at about 5pm on Saturday a military convoy in the area of Safia Um Ga."" 9 government troops killed. SRF also attacked a police station.

Reports states: """"government-backed Janjaweed"" opened fire on a group of four youngsters at about 10am on Saturday morning. The group, from the Um Zukhrat camp for the displaced in Gireida locality, were collecting straw in the area of Rijil Shanga, south of the camp.""
Misseriya Arabs clashed with Ngok Dinka at Loki, resulting in the death of eight cattle.
Aerial combardments of Kauda.
""from East Jebel Marra confirmed that the areas of Dirbat, Jawa and Suny, west of Jebel Marra, and of Fanga, east of Jebel Marra, witnessed heavy aerial bombardments""
Two militiamen raped a 12 year old girl in Kabkabiya.
Bomb/explosion killed two children
""A Russian diplomat and his wife were stabbed in Sudans capital yesterday by a man enraged by the death of his brother in strife-torn Central African Republic""
Aerial bombardments over Tabaldiya Dolma and Geinak.

Militiamen attacked the Rwanda camp in Tawila, North Darfur on 30/1/2014 and 1/2/2014. ""Government backed forces"" fought the militiamen and killed one person. As a result, the militiamen told the people in Rwanda camp that they will return for compensation.
Armed nomads attacked an area in the Dinka Ngok area of the disputed Abyei region. Over 18 people were killed.
Janjaweed militia were harassing women Friday night. When civilians intervened, the Janjaweed opened fired, killing one person.

Militiamen attacked the Rwanda camp in Tawila, North Darfur on 30/1/2014 and 1/2/2014. ""Government backed forces"" fought the militiamen and killed one person. As a result, the militiamen told the people in Rwanda camp that they will return for compensation.
From report: ""area of Birkat Seira in Saraf Omra locality, North Darfur, during the past few days witnessed a series of assaults and raids by militiamen""
A shopkeeper in Um Girein was killed in front of his shop.
Militia raped two girls.
""A UN contracted truck driver and his truck was hijacked off of a convoy by an unknown armed group while en-route from Ed Daien to Nyala. The whereabouts of the driver are unknown.""
Government backed militiamen robbed and shot a man along the Gireida - Nyala road. As a result, the road was closed on 1/2/2014
Protests over the killing of a man by the Janjaweed as well as the government training of Janjaweed fighters.
Displaced residents of Fata Borno Camp were assaulted by militiamen.
Unidentified armed group opened fire on the police in Kass, killing 4 police officers.
Non-violent activity: Reports that the government was training Oromo fighters in El Gezira and El Gedaref, east Nuba mountains to attack the SPLA-N.
UNSC cited an attack in northern Abyei by the SPLA and SSNPS (military and police). However, it was not stated who the attack was against or with.
Protests in Murnei Camp over the arrest of Sheik Khamis Ishag Abdel Moula, demanding his release.
Militia members beat children in Fata Borno camp. Afterwards, they harassed farmers and said the land ws for nomads.
Arab Spring forces attacked a commercial vehicle in Badi, injuring 2 people.
In response to vehicle theft, Arab Spring Forces and Sudan military fought at Abu Karinka. 1 army soldier was killed.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Soth African UNAMID peacekeepers were ambushed and robbed of equipment in Millet, North Darfur.
Sudanese Air Force dropped six bombs in Abri, near Dalami city on Saturday.
Armed group opened fire on a commercial vehicle traveling from Saraf Omra to Birkat Seira, North Darfur. 2 men died.
Militiamen shot at and injured civilians.
Sudanese Air Force dropped six bombs on Heiban city on Sunday.
Government backed armed men opened fire on a commercial vehicle between Tito and Giredia. 1 person died.
Sudan government dropped nine bombs on the village of El Dar and three on Damadogo in Buram locality. One person killed.

From text: ""bandits from Tullus locality allegedly stole cows from the Annadif area. When a local rescue team tracked-down the culprits, the bandits opened fire on them killing three members of the team."" The tension created insecurity in the Buram whereby both sides feared entering the market.
Text of report: ""Sudanese Air Force dropped eight bombs on the areas of Kara and Khor in Darfurs East Jebel Marra on Monday morning.""
Janjaweed came from North Kordofan where they were expelled and settled in Bileil. Nyala residents expressed fear of the miliamen.
A landmine killed 5 people in the South Kordofan area.
Civilians in Karida, South Kordofan, attacked by militiamen.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
column17: Five people killed and 19 wounded, including a red crescent worker, by a land mine in Gadir / Ghadeer, about 25km west of Abu Jubeiha, in South Kordofan.
In Kassab Camp, Kutum locality, two females were raped by pro government militia.
Police beat a lawyer who was following up on a case.
Strike:At El Fasher Teaching Hospital, doctors entered an open ended strike over non-payment of monthly allowances.
Air raids on Tabinya, causing the death of 13 cows.
Air raids on Um Dullu in Um Doreen County. 11 civilians killed
Students were assaulted while collecting firewood.
Government backed militiamen shot at a vehicle and stole money.
Janjaweed shot at a man in his legs and attacked a lorry, stealing peoples items.
Police beat a young Koranic scholar while he was attending a youth event.

column9: Aid Workers (Sudan); ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Health Workers (Sudan)
column17: ""A Sudanese Red Crescent Society volunteer died in a landmine explosion, when he was on his way to respond to an emergency.""
Female lawyers protested the beating of a female lawyer by police.

Police shot and killed two protesters. ""The protesters objected to a conference organised by the Darfur Regional Authority (DRA) that brought together various groups in an effort to end tribal conflicts and promote peace in the region.""

From text: ""Fierce clashes broke out after the assassination of Misseriya omda Musa El Tahir. In response, Misseriya killed El Haj Zein Abdel Shakour, a trader and deputy omda of the Salamat in Um Dukhun.""

From text: ""The protesters objected to a conference organised by the Darfur Regional Authority (DRA) that brought together various groups in an effort to end tribal conflicts and promote peace in the region.""
Man was shot dead in his home by an armed group.
Camp residents protested against authorities decision to move a grain silo from the camp to the localities main office site. Police intervened and fired tear gas.
Clashes between Misseriya and Salamat in Um Dukhum. Civilians fled to Kalma camp. 5 people killed.
SPLA-N bombed the area of Kadugli.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Clashes between RSF and SLM/A-Minnawi faction in Ganah (Gunya). Two schools as well as an INGO clinic were looted and burned during the clashes.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Clashes between RSF and SLM/A-Minnawi faction.
Looting: Looting of shops by Misseriya.

Non-violent activity: The security services and pro-government militia elements caused panic among the displaced people living in Hamidiya camp in Zalingei locality, Central Darfur, when they fired dense gunshots into the air on Wednesday night.

Students, mainly from the Salamat tribe, ""from Umm Dukun locality in Central Darfur staged a demonstration in front of the Presidential Palace in Khartoum on Thursday. They demanded that the Sudanese government intervene to stop the inter-tribal clashes across Darfur. ""
From text: ""Militia members killed a farmer and wounded four others in the area of Bakhit in Abu Karinka, East Darfur on Thursday. ""
""Prisoners demonstrated in protest of the prisons administration around midday. Prison guards confronted the demonstration by firing live ammunition at the inmates."" 1 person died.
On Murnei Camp, Janjaweed attacked 2 women and raped 1 while they were collecting straw.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Abu Tira fired at a Sheik in Otash camp, injured 5 civilians and looted the camp for two days (22-23 Feb).

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Abu Tira fired at a Sheik in Otash camp, injured 5 civilians and looted the camp for two days (22-23 Feb).
At Khartoum University, students from the NCP and RNP (Reform Now Party), rioted at an event held by the RNP. NCP threw molotov cocktails at the event.
At El Salam camp, militiamen and police exchanged gunfire. 1 police was killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Aerial raid on Trawa, Rashad Locality in South Kordofan. 6 people killed.
In Derieg near Nyala, a man was robbed and woman shot at by government backed militiamen.
Militiamen threw a grenade at civilians in Dambar. 6 people were killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Rapid Support Forces raped a girl from Kalma camp in Wadi Birli, near Nyala.

7 people died in fighting in Abyei. Those involved in the fighting are unclear (Small Arms Survey). Sudan government is accusing the South Sudan government of attacking Sudan civilians along the 1956 borderline.
A restaurant owner was beaten to death on Wednesday by unidentified men in Abu Jabra town in East Darfur for ""dissemenating information to the other party to the tribal conflict.""
A group of armed men attacked El Fursan, near Bakhit, killing one man and looting over 100 cattle.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Unidentified armed group attacked the Abu Tira and stole their vehicles.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: SLM-MM stated they fought and killed 20 RSF between Ed Daein and Nyala.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Rapid Support Forces attacked Hijer Tunjo, southeast of Nyala. 53 killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked and raped civilians in Ganah (Gunya).

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF and soldiers attacked and raped civilians in Marla. At least 8 killed on Feb 27.
""About 100 Sudanese journalists and activists staged a silent vigil on Thursday in support of a global campaign to support Al-Jazeera television journalists detained in Egypt.""
Military bombed wells outside of Marla, which provide water for the entire village.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked and raped civilians in Afona (Afouna).
Military bombed Um Daraba near Hijer Tunjo.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked and raped civilians in Hamada (Himeda).

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked and raped civilians in Ganah (Gunya) for second day.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack and kill unknown number of civilians in Um Bargartain.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked and raped civilians in Birkatuli (Barkatulie). Unknown number of civilians killed on Feb. 28.
Military bombed Hijer Tunjo on Feb 28.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Abu Tira were attacked by troops led by Musa Hilal/Janjaweed in the area of Tirma. ""Hilals gunmen have warned the population in the area not to stay away from the roads between Kutum, Saraf Omra, Kabkabiya, and El Fasher"". 34 died.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked and raped civilians in Donkey Dereis. Unknown number killed.

On 28 February 2014, protesters demonstrated at Baleela oilfield (West Kordofan state), demanding employment in the fields. Security forces (coded as police) intervened, firing teargas and live rounds, killing three or four (3 fatalities coded), and wounding sixteen. [size=large]

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Second day Rapid Support Forces attacked Hijer Tunjo.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked and raped civilians in Sani Deleibiya and Thani Deleibiya. At least one person killed in Sani Deleibiya.
Two women from Nierteti camp were raped by militiamen in Kebe, north of the camp.
Militiamen attacked the market, wounding two men. Government forces intervened and chased them out of the market.

Two incidents of violence against civilians in Al Fasher: 1. After stopping a vehicle, Border Guards shot a civilian dead when he refused to give up his vehicle. 2. Border Guards shot at 3 men for refusing to hand over their mobile phones.

70-100 people died in fighting in Maker Awet/Makir, 17 km north of Abei. Fighting was between the forces of Sudan Government, militia of Thomas Thiel, Misseriya AND the forces of Dinka Ngok. Sudan government is accusing the South Sudan government of attacking Sudan civilians along the 1956 borderline.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked Tani Effendo.

Joint rebel forces of: Sudan Liberation Movement under the command of Mini Minnawi (SLM-MM), and the Liberation Movement for Justice, attacked the military garrisons of Laeet Jarelnabi and Haskanita. 83 military were killed.
Clashes between the Misseriya and Dinka Ngok in Abyei in Laki Al-Abiad. Reports estimated deaths between 21 and 363.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Areas of Tabaldiyat and Jabarona ""are .. Besieged by"" RSF and civilians are subjected to assualts, beating and torture.
In Zalingei, militiamen attacked a lorry, then beat and robbed the passengers. 1 woman was abducted.
SPLA, supported by the Dinka Ngok, attacked Loke camp. 13 people were killed. The Misseriya accused UN peacekeepers of taking the side of the Dinka.
Protesters demonstrated against on-going assaults by Border Guards and militiamen.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: El Salam Camp was surrounded by the RSF. ""Men under 35 are captured when they leave the camp.""
Sudan military attacked area of Danqub.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked and raped civilians in Ganah (Gunya) in the first week of March 2014.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Three people were shot and 10 went missing from Um Gounja in South Darfur during an attack by the RSF.
Clashes between the Musa Hilal Militia and Tama in Saraf Omra, Wadi District, after the Militia entered the Nasirs home. 4 guards of the Nasir were killed. 16 people died.
Clashes between the Misseriya and Dinka Ngok in Makir / Maker and Dungop / Dunqop over two days of fighting. Small Arms Survey stated the actors in the incidents are still unclear.

Police were ambushed twice on the road while attempting to respond to the burning of a police station in Menawashei. They were ambused: 1. Between Kabkabiyah to Jabal Amir and 2. Between Kabkabiyah and Kutum.
Darfur Joint Resistance Forces announced that they took control of a military garrison in Taweisha.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: ""RSF attacks on the areas of Fula Talata, Fula Nwara, and Dahiya last week. At least 200 people were killed, and 60 to 70 went missing. ""

Militamen attacked a police station, injuring many police. The station was attacked in retaliation for a police officer arresting a militiaman the previous day. When the militiaman attempted to escape, he stabbed the officer who in turn shot him.
Fighting between Darfur movement and government troops in Alleit Jar-Elnaby, and Haskanita. 1 rebel killed.
Two Italians were ambushed by militia while traveling between Nyala to El Geneina. The travellers were travelling from Sudan to Chad.
Clashes between the Misseriya and Dinka Ngok in Makir / Maker and Dungop / Dunqop over two days of fighting. Small Arms Survey stated the actors in the incidents are still unclear.

Darfur Joint Resistance force claims it has control Al Tawaishei as of 4/3/14, including the locality of Karoya and Laban, after fighting with government troops. The governor of the area disagrees with the take over
Militiamen attacked security forces office in hopes to steal their vehicles. The police repeled the militia.

The Darfur Joint movement and SRF claimed to be in control of Alliet, El Taweisha, and Klaimendo in North Darfur. They said when the entered Klaimendo, government forces left without a fight. However, civilians from the areas are citing violence against them.
Pro government militia hijacked a commissioners car in Hamra. They abducted a driver and 2 guards.
Pro government militia attacked a vehicle carrying members of the farmers association in Khor Ardaba, Kabkabiya locality.
Clashes between Salamat and Tama tribes in Bindisi. Schools and government buildings closed. Police intervened by firing shots in the air.

The Darfur Joint movement and SRF claimed to be in control of Alliet, El Taweisha, and Klaimendo in North Darfur. They said when the entered Klaimendo, government forces left without a fight. However, civilians from the areas are citing violence against them.
Bombs were dropped on Alliet Jarelnabi and Um Ridim Shatta. 1 person died.
A peaceful demonstration was held by South Kordofan residents calling for an end to the war in South Kordofan and Blue Nile

Both the government and SLA-Minnawi/JEM have blamed each other for attacks on Um Guja and Jijair Tonu, as well as dozens of other villages south east of Nyala. 21 people were killed. UNAMID has not been allowed access to the area to confirm what is happening.

""Saraf Umra in North Darfur state, the Saraf Umra market completely stolen [ransacked], four districts were burned by Hilals militias. On March 6, 2014 when people were doing Friday prayers militias attacked them, about 350 cars loaded heavy weapons; they burned districts and killed innocent citizens. "" 17 people were killed.
Protesters ""called for Jihad to support the Muslim minority in CAR"". They demonstrated against French troops in CAR.
Citizens from ""Kalamindo, El Taweisha, and Alliet localities in North Darfur have protested in El Fasher against the attacks on their villages by the joint rebel forces of Darfur.""

""In North Darfur, residents of Saraf Omra town and the surrounding villages were attacked by Musa Hilals militias on 7 and 8 March, also causing thousands of civilians to seek refuge in the camps for the displaced or in other places.""

People across 24 villages in Kabkabiya locality fled the Militias of Musa Hilal. The militia burned down houses. Many civilians were injured. Villages affected were: Hileila, Hileilat, Morlouz, Shilein, Moz Loz, Tanabeeg, Jemeiza, Jeldama, Um Laouta , Um Delo, Dade, Arba Buyout, Khartoum Bahri, Beni Mansour, Soba Beni Mansour East, Soba Beni Mansour West, El Hasira, Tamanga, Margouba, Arda Shouf, Um Hijara, Taran, Matawi and Hilat Sheikh Neel.

""In North Darfur, residents of Saraf Omra town and the surrounding villages were attacked by Musa Hilals militias on 7 and 8 March, also causing thousands of civilians to seek refuge in the camps for the displaced or in other places.""
""The Sudanese Air Force dropped 15 bombs on the area east of Mashrou Abu Zaid and west of Dalma in East Jebel Marra.

From report: ""On Saturday militias led by the well-know Janjaweed leader Musa Hilal attacked Saraf Omra and the villages in the vicinity. They plundered the market, shops and houses in Saraf Omra, as well as dozens of villages west of the town. An entire neighbourhood in the western part of Saraf Omra, and seven villages west of the town were pillaged and burned. ""
Butchers protested the increase of fees on killed animals.
Looting: Reports of widespread looting in Taweisha, El Lait / Alliet, Um Gunya, and Hajeer.
Darfur Joint Forces captured Um Saauna / Um Saouna, on the border of North and East Darfur.
Looting: Reports of widespread looting in Saraf Omra.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Armed men abducted an international contractor working at UNAMID, in El Fasher. He was freed on June 12 2014 after 94 days in captivity.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Intra clashes between the SLM-AW lasted for three days: 11-13 March. ""people fled their houses in the areas of Bargo, Kakerguwa, and Simo. The markets of Bargo and Kakergowa were entirely plundered before they burned to ashes."" 5 civilians died.
Students carrying light weapons for protesting, demonstrated on Darfur. Police intervened, shooting bullets. 1 person was killed.

""Sudanese police fired tear gas Wednesday when mourners called for ""revolution"" following the funeral of a student allegedly gunned down by security forces at a protest against violence in Darfur.""

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)

From report: ""Gunmen killed two people and wounded several others after they looted 100 cows in Gara area, north of Murnei, in Zalingei locality on Wednesday""
Aerial bombardment by the SAF on El Nagara in the Nuba Mountains. 3 children killed.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)

Hawazma militia attacked the Um Shoran area in South Kordofan, near the Jamasa cattle camp. 3 children were killed.

Students at El Jazeera University in Wad Madani demonstrated against on-going assults in Darfur and in solidarity with the students who demonstrated in Khartoum. Police halted some of the protesters while allowing others to proceed to parliament.
Pro government militia killed a 20 year man they had taken for hostage from a cattle market the previous month.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: In Mellit, SLM/A-Wahid clash with RSF. 10 civilians killed. 78 government forces killed. 9 rebels killed.

Protesters were commenorating the death of a student killed earlier in the week by police. Police intervened by firing teargas and beating protesters. 110 Darfuri students were arrested during the protest.
Soldiers were assaulting IDP in Nierteti camp. From report: ""soldiers beat a group of displaced from the camp and robbed them of their belongings. Some of the victims were seriously injured.""
7 people were killed after attacks by Darfur forces on Maleet.

Suspected PDF militiamen attacked Adouna village in Delami County, opening fire on civilians and launching rocket propelled grenades (RPGs). Three children were killed while seeking shelter in a foxhole, while another two were injured.
From report: ""Islamist protesters in Sudan burned the French flag on Friday during their second weekly protest against Frances intervention in the Central African Republic.""

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: The areas of Tarny, Khartoum Belleil, and Konjara in East Jebel Marra were attacked by the RSF. Villages were set on fire and looted. People fled to Tawila areas.
Soldiers were assaulting IDP in Nierteti camp. From report: ""soldiers beat a group of displaced from the camp and robbed them of their belongings. Some of the victims were seriously injured.""

Non-violent activity: In March 2014, Sudanese Court handed the capital punishment to 19 SPLM-N officials, including Chairman Malik Agar and Secretary-General Yasser Aman, and sentenced 47 other SPLM-N members to life in prison in connection with the outbreak of conflict in Blue Nile state in September 2011. Sudanese President Omer al-Bashir issued a decree dropping charges against 24 of them on 26 October 2016, releasing them from Al Huda prison in Omdurman.
In El Kuma, 80km northeast of El-Fasher, an armed group attacked the Governor of North Darfur state. His driver and a police officer were killed.

From report: ""Sudanese police tear-gassed a demonstration by members of the political opposition. ... The opposition members demonstrated after meeting at Sudanese Congress Party headquarters to discuss the situation in the country ravaged by armed insurrection, poverty and political turmoil."" Police also entered opposition HQ and arrested the President of the SCP.

In Kukul, ""83 Sudanese army and militia troops were killed, and dozens of others injured during an attack by the ""Darfur joint resistance forces"". After the fight, the SAF dropped bombs on the area.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Tawila and rape women in March 2014.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: From report: ""RSF militias had attacked the areas of Nimra, Dalma, and Yara. They had looted the villages and seized livestock.""

column17: RSF attack Krekir.

column17: RSF attack Shangil Tobay.

column17: RSF attack Hillet Sharif Hano.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Sany Haya.

column17: Over 30,000 were displaced as the RSF attacked 25 villages including Hashaba El Donkey, Hillat Kurkib, Hillat Bagar, Hillat Abdel Majid, Hillat Amur, Hillat Malawi, Hillat Shamouta, and Hillat Mastour from March 16-17. The RSF set villages on fire as well as raped and abducted women.
A lorry was ambushed travelling between Gireida-Jughana road in South Darfur. 3 people were killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack El Salam.
Looting: From report: ""10150 heads of cattle looted by Peoples Army (SPLA) in South Kordofan.""
Darfur forces attacked a military convoy travelling between El Ashara and Finga in East Jebel Marra. 44 government troops killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Umm Sidra.

From report: ""The Sudanese Air Force continued to bomb areas in East Jebel Marra for the third day in a row. The villages of Korofala, Tukumari, Goz Dor, Konjara, Khartoum Belleil, and Gargoz were bombed ""

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Hillet Deba.

From report: ""Elements from the security agency have closed Khartoum International Airport and prevented travellers to get into the airport for several hours in protest of the Khartoum Airport authorities decision to contract Al-Hadaf Security Company for the security and surveillance of the Khartoum Airport. ""

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Darfur Forces and RSF fought in East Jebel Marra.
SAF bombed the areas of Nimra, Dali, Jebel Dango, and West Forofala in East Jebel Marra. People and livestock were killed.

column17: RSF attacked the villages of Malawi and Foda, West of Mellit. Attacks lasted two days from: 17-18 March. Homes were set on fire.
From report: ""The price of a gallon of diesel at the black market has risen to SDG60 ($10.50). Vegetable farmers staged a protest in front of the South Darfur Governors office. ""
In Um Guli, Dalami locality, 3 civilians were killed during a raid on a cattle camp by unidentified armed actors.
IDPs at El Salam protested against the slow pace of registration.

column17: From report: """"Darfur joint resistance forces"" killed nine RSF troops and destroyed a number of vehicles in a battle in the area north of Fanga on Monday evening.""
Militia looted cattle from the village of Tina, west of Tawila. The militia shot at a woman.

From report: ""The Sudanese Air Force continued to bomb areas in East Jebel Marra for the third day in a row. The villages of Korofala, Tukumari, Goz Dor, Konjara, Khartoum Belleil, and Gargoz were bombed ""

Clashes between police and border guards/militia. Militia were attempted to steal from UNAMID and police intervened. As police chased the militia, fighting broke out. 1 police officer and 1 militia died.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked the villages of Malawi and Foda, West of Mellit. Attacks lasted two days from: 17-18 March. Homes were set on fire.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked Sani Deleiba in Bielel, South Darfur. 2 men were killed.
Pro government militia killed one man while opening fire on a brick factory in Kass.
SAF bombed areas in East Jebel Marra over two days: 19-20 March.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked the areas of: Rubkona, Faki Idriss, Doba El Omda, and Hillet Bani Hussein, Hila Baja, Mando, Payara, and Sosa in East Jebel Marra. They killed at least 1 person and many cattle.
In Khamsat, Abu Jabra locality, Rizeigat and Maalia herders fought. 5 people died.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Kobei village. At least 2 killed, and several women raped.
SAF bombed areas in East Jebel Marra over two days: 19-20 March.
In El Sahab, 40 km northwest of Abu Karinka, in a 2nd day of clashes, 13 Rizeigat were killed and 4 Maaliya were killed.
Unidentified armed group set fire to the University. An ICRC worker was hit by a stray bullet and killed

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF has kidnapped over 20 males and females from Kalma Camp.

Aerial bombardments lasted two days in the Mellit locality: 19-20 March. On the 19, Dara Kharif and Nagat in the area of Malawi were targeted. 3 people killed. And on the 20, Um Sidir and Goz Tuga were targeted. 2 people killed.
In Mukshasha, Saraf Umra locality, 9 militia opened fire on a man while he was herding cattle.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked the areas of: Sharafa, Arasho, Um Beji, and Tangarara in East Jebel Marra

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: In Hijer and Um Gunja, southeast of Nyala, RSF raped and kidnapped 4 women.
Militia abducted two men in Araw village, south of Murnei.

Aerial bombardments lasted two days in the Mellit locality: 19-20 March. On the 19, Dara Kharif and Nagat in the area of Malawi were targeted. 3 people killed. And on the 20, Um Sidir and Goz Tuga were targeted. 2 people killed.
In Kobe and surrounding villages, properties were attacked, looted, and burned. 1 person died.
Forces fight over control of Taweisha and surrounding areas.
Misseriya attacked the area of Nyinichor, 15 m from Abyei town. Two people were killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: 300 men attacked Khor Abeche and seized the city- stealing livestock and setting fire to shelters. The1 person killed. IDPs sought refuge at a UNAMID base nearby. People fear being killed if they leave the base. The RSF has requested ransom for people kidnapped during the siege.
Government retook Al Tawaisha and surrounding areas from the Darfur Resistance movement.
Militia attacked Sarafaya, adjacent to El Fasher. They set houses on fire and looted the area.
In Um Haraz oilfield, militia and soldiers clashed. 1 soldier was killed.
In Ab Sakeen of Kutum locality, Kutum civilians created a rescue team to respond to increasing violence. When gunmen entered Al Sakeen, the rescue team retaliated. 1 person was killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked Umm Sidra.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: The RSF attacked the areas of Hashaba + burned 25 villages. The looting committed by the RSF caused the El-Fasher-Kutum road to shut down.
Gunmen entered El Salam camp. They beat and whipped 13 IDPs then stole their vehicle. 1 resident was abducted and tortured for 2 days.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked Baashim.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: From report: ""Rapid Support Forces (RSF) claim to have destroyed a camp of the Sudan Liberation Movement, led by Minni Minawi (SLM-MM), in the area of Donki Baashim, Kutum locality in North Darfur"". 60 RSF troops died and 151 Darfur joint resistance.

column17: RSF clashed with SLM/A-Wahid in Baashim.
SAF began combing operations in Jabel Marra to chase out Dafuri Joint resistance forces. 75 rebel soldiers killed.
SAF pushed the Darfur faction out of Haskanita. Then, began combing operations in Jabel Marra.
Militia raided a cattle market and kidnapped a man.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Looting: RSF looted and set fire to a health centre in Khor Abeche camp.
Aerial bombs were dropped on Khazan Tunjur, East Jebel Marra and Argo Telo. 3 people died.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces

After looting, report stated that the RSF were re-grouping in Baashim.
Air force bombed Shangil Tobaya. Some of the bombs fell on Shadad camp.
Three days of bombing by the SAF, 29-31 March. Bombing accompanied looting by the RSF.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked the areas of: Baashim, Amarai, Khashum Wadi, Wadi Buwa, Silu, Shurgilei, Dabba Nayra, Tima, and Garbu Salat. Number killed unknown.
Three days of bombing by the SAF, 29-31 March. No fatalities reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Three days, 29-31 March, of looting in North Darfur by RSF forces in: Hashaba El Donki, Bir Subyan Kujo, Hamarei, Hillet Salem, Hillet Nugara, Bawa, Hillet Mandi, Nagu Jara, Baashim, Amarjadeed, Tirbo Suri, Hillet Adam Khater, Hillet Abu Bakar, Hillet Nakari, and Hillet Haroun, Anka, and Anka El Gadima. After looting, report stated that the RSF were re-grouping in Baashim.

column17: Looting: Over three days, RSF looted villages south west of Nyala. On 31/3 and 1/4, the RSF burned down 127 villages, including: burned Allah Karim West, Allah Karim East, Kui Tai, Hashaba Hillet Borno, Afona, Um Laota, Foula Um Nawara, Foula Ab, Kalkaf, Bathga, Hajer, and Hillet Tabra.
