Three days of bombing by the SAF, 29-31 March. Bombing accompanied looting by the RSF.
120 civilians from the El Salam camp were robbed and beaten along the Nyala -El Salam road.
SAF bomb Hashaba for second day.
SAF bomb Hashaba for third day.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Over three days, RSF looted villages south west of Nyala. On 31/3 and 1/4, the RSF burned down 127 villages, including: burned Allah Karim West, Allah Karim East, Kui Tai, Hashaba Hillet Borno, Afona, Um Laota, Foula Um Nawara, Foula Ab, Kalkaf, Bathga, Hajer, and Hillet Tabra.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Over three days, RSF looted villages south west of Nyala. On 31/3 and 1/4, the RSF burned down 127 villages, including: burned Allah Karim West, Allah Karim East, Kui Tai, Hashaba Hillet Borno, Afona, Um Laota, Foula Um Nawara, Foula Ab, Kalkaf, Bathga, Hajer, and Hillet Tabra.
SAF dropped 10 bombs on Buram County, north of Lake Bied. Bombing was also reported in Hai-Al Jarad. One child and a pregnant woman were killed, while three other children were injured.
In Um Jak, citizens rioted the moving of examinations from Um Jak to El Udayya. Rioters set two schools on fire in El Udayya. Police intervened and clashed with the rioters - injuring a student.
Police fought with an armed group in Nyala. 1 police was killed.
In Zalingei, camp Hamidiya, an 11 year was shot in the chest by a group of militias stationed outside the camp.
Students demonstrated against weapons in the school. The previous day, a gunman shot a student and then killed himself.
Students at the University of Khartoum began a sit-in to demand an investigation into the killing of a Darfuri student during March protests.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Clashes between Border Guards and SAF left three people killed.
Students at University of Nyala protested against the arrest of 4 students earlier in the week. Police responded with tear gas and beat over 100 demonstrators. 7 people were arrested.
Students at University of Nyala protested against the arrest of 4 students earlier in the week. Police responded with tear gas and beat over 100 demonstrators. 7 people were arrested.
Fighting between two militia groups in the Nierteti market left three people dead. The market was closed.
Two people were killed by pro government militia persons while travelling between Abu Hamra and Mirsheng / Mershing camp.
Pro-government militias beat and robbed 2 people at Mershing camp.
SAF bombed the area of Muzbat in the northern part of Um Baru for 4 days (4-7 April).

Two days of fighting between Maaliya and Hamar Militias. On 4/4, fighting was in Shag Hiraf, 58 kmnortheast of Adila. Villages were burned down. 7 killed. On 5/4, fighting took place in Um Deibun in West Kordofan. 39 Hamar were killed, 7 Ma-aliya.
A lorry was ambushed on the Tawila-El Fasher road on Saturday
SAF bombed the area of Muzbat in the northern part of Um Baru for 4 days (4-7 April).
Movement of forces: Chad forces arrived in Darfur to with armoured vehicles and heavy artillery. SRF called for the Chadian soldiers to leave Sudan and to stop supporting Bashir.
In Khamsat, fighting between Hamar and Ma-aliya took place. 18 people were killed.

Two days of fighting between Maaliya and Hamar Militias. On 4/4, fighting was in Shag Hiraf, 58 kmnortheast of Adila. Villages were burned down. 7 killed. On 5/4, fighting took place in Um Deibun in West Kordofan. 39 Hamar were killed, 7 Ma-aliya.
The North Darfur government stated that the SAF fought the SLM-Minnawi in Bir Maza and Bir Deek and won.
SAF bombed the area of Muzbat in the northern part of Um Baru for 4 days (4-7 April).

After Bashir declared that political parties could hold meetings, the security forces interrupted a meeting of the RNP and disallowed them from meeting at Al Ahlia University. One party member wa assaulted by the security forces.

Governor of North Darfur stated that rebel elements were removed from Biz Mazza and Birdik in Kutum locality. It is assumed he means the rebel group of Darfur Joint Forces.

Military bomb Birdik. At least 1 killed.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: Protesters demonstrated against long periods of water interruption. Police broke up the protesters using batons and tear gas.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: 11 villages attacked during a two days attack. RSF attacked villages east of Tawila: Janjona A and B, Hillet Kursi, Aradei, and Haskanita on 8/4/2014. 1 person was killed and another abducted.

Protest in Al Jiraif East against the government selling the land. Police intervened using tear gas and batons.

From 16 April - 20 April, artillery attacks and aerial bombardments on Rashad locality in the villages of: Tommy, Tangalu, Almansour, Kaluba, Kilora, Tarawa, Tindimin, Tajilbo, and Zalataya.

column17: On 19 Aprial 2014, 8 people working on the Kanar oilfield near Baleela (West Kordofan state) were kidnapped by the United Popular Front.

column16: Radio Dabanga; Pak Banker; Sudan Tribune
column17: On 19 April 2014, a gunfight broke out between the United Popular Front and private guards at the Kanar oil field near Baleela (West Kordofan state). 3 civilians were kidnapped. 3 of the armed group were killed.

The Kalma camp for the displaced in Nyala locality, South Darfur, has witnessed 19 rape cases within a period of 12 days. Saleh Eisa, the secretary-general of the Kalma camp for the displaced reported to Radio Dabanga on Wednesday, that in the period between 16 and 27 April, 19 displaced women aged 17-40 years have been raped by ""government-backed militiamen"", and eight men were beaten up.
Aerial attack on Al Abassiya.
From 16 April - 20 April, artillery attacks and aerial bombardments on Rashad locality in the villages of: Tommy, Tangalu, Almansour, Kaluba, Kilora, Tarawa, Tindimin, Tajilbo, and Zalataya.
Fighting between the Abbala and Bani Hussein militias over two days (19-20 April) in the area of Um Jarwa, Beni Hussein locality, near Saraf Umra. 5 people died.

column17: Sudanese security beat and arrested youth political leaders: Ahmed Azaz, Dr. Mohey Al-Din Eissa Mousa, Mohamed Gouda Ali and Al-Fadel Hemdan.
Two men who worked at a school were killed in the village of Dar Ba, Kutum locality, by Janjaweed.
Fighting in Blue Nile State between the SPLA-N and SAF, causing mass displacement.
Fighting in South Kordofan between the SPLA-N and SAF, causing mass displacement.

Fighting in Rashad locality between the SPLA-N and SAF.
SAF dropped bombs on Khazan Orshi in Um Baru locality.
Government troops attacked the town of Mardis in Habila locality on Sunday, attempting to retake the town. The SPLM-N reported to have killed 22 soldiers in repelling their attack.
Two days of protesting (28-29 April) by Baath party members calling for regime change of the government. Police intervened and arrested 11 protesters who were then beaten.

Protests in Gereida Camp over insecurity.
Fur students at University of Dongola staged a peaceful demonstration against the imposition of tuition fees.
Militiamen referred to as Janjaweed attacked students sitting for their school exams in Kutum town.
In Zanara, near Kutum, militiamen raped a school girl.
SAF bombed the area of Hashaba in Darfur. No fatalities reported.
Attacks by pro-government militiamen on camp residents along the road between Zalingei and Hamidiya camp for the displaced.
Government bombed the area of Tabit, killing 3 people.
A woman from Sibak Al Khel camp was shot at by militiamen.
Two days of protesting (28-29 April) by Baath party members calling for regime change of the government. Police intervened and arrested 11 protesters who were then beaten.

SAF dropped bombs on Ruh Fatah, west of Jebel Marra. 1 person killed.

SLM-AW reporting that following their attack on a military base in Turo, the army and militia troops fled from the base, and on their flight attacked villages at the area of Golo. The villages of Noni, Ahya Elsawra, and El Sadaga were set on fire. The troops raped eight young women; six of them are students of the Golo secondary school

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: The Sudan Liberation Movement, led by Abdel Wahid El Nur (SLM-AW) has announced that it destroyed the military base of Turo, near Golo, west of Jebel Marra on Wednesday.

The rebel Sudan Peoples Liberation Movement-North (SPLM-N) said Friday they shot down a small spy unmanned aircraft in South Kordofan state. SPLM-N spokesperson Arnu Loddi said in a statement extended to Sudan Tribune that the drone crashed near Abri, Dalami town in the far east of Dilling district.

Armed Arab herders killed 2 people from Nuba tribes in Habila locality

A sheikh of the Hai El Matar camp in Kabkabiya town, North Darfur, was critically injured when militiamen shot him inside his house
Militiamen raped two women of El Salam camp for the displaced in Bielel locality, South Darfur, on Saturday and Sunday

A policeman on his way home was killed by government-backed militia
Security forces arrested two Sudanese Baath Party members who were protesting against government policies
Pro-government university students clashed with opposition students in Khartoum. Police intervened & fired tear gas.
Chairman of Al-Sahwa Revolutionary Council & chief of Al-Mahadi tribes, Musa Hilal, announced that Al-Waha, Kutum, Al-Sirif & Saraf-Umra localities are under his control

A 9-year-old boy was abducted in El Fasher. Kidnappers demanded a ransom of SDG250,000 ($43,450).

A member of the former LJM attacked & injured 3 people in Zamzam camp for the displaced near El Fasher
SPLM-N announced that it destroyed a military convoy in Sabat, near Dalami town in Habila locality, in South Kordofan during fighting. A military commander was reportedly killed.
Four citizens were killed & 11 others injured after a land mine planted by SPLM-N rebels exploded at the entrance of Murinj in South Kurdufan
2 civilians were killed & more than a dozen wounded in a clash between government forces & armed men at Ideina market, Bahr El Arab locality, East Darfur
An army troop killed the host of a wedding party in Jebel camp, Saraf Umra locality, North Darfur
Militiamen opened fire at a group of residents of Sese camp for the displaced in the area of Hajar Teiman in Kereinek locality in West Darfur. 1 resident was killed

Militiamen killed a herdsman and his son near Malam in East Jebel Marra

Militiamen captured a woman & 2 children in Birket Seira & tied them to a tree.
Army forces confronted Janjaweed attempting to rob the Tawila market
Militiamen raped 3 women of the Shadad camp for the displaced in Shangil Tobaya, 60km south of El Fasher

Militia beat & robbed a sheikh of the Kalma camp for the displaced, beating 1 & abducting another

SPLM-N claimed to have repulsed SAF attacks on Tomna village, Dalami county
Militiamen shot & killed a woman during an attack on a home in Manzoula, Sirba locality, West Darfur
Agreement: Sudan Revolutionary Front (SRF) & the Unionist Movement (UM) signed an agreement to work together to unite the opposition in Sudan

Militiamen attacked 5 villages (Sualba, Kunjara, Um Burma, Tandal & Haskanita) in Tawila locality. Villagers repelled the militia & drove them back to their base in Um Jilbakh. At least 1 man was killed.

2 people were injured during clashes between militiamen & army troops in Kutum

Militiamen attacked 5 villages (Sualba, Kunjara, Um Burma, Tandal & Haskanita) in Tawila locality. Villagers repelled the militia & drove them back to their base in Um Jilbakh. At least 1 man was killed.

3 civilians died during aerial bombardments by Sudan's air force, in Fanga market in East Jebel Marra

Fighting continued between SPLM-N & government forces in Werne & Kau-nyaro. 11 SPLM-N fighters were reported killed in the two areas.
Fighting continued between SPLM-N & government forces in Werne & Kau-nyaro. 11 SPLM-N fighters were reported killed in the two areas.

The army reported to have liberated Miri Bara, west of Kadugli, from SPLM-N rebels, inflicting 'heavy losses in lives', , though SAF & SPLM-N both claimed victory following clashes in the area
Sudanese Air Forces dropped 3 bombs a health center in Kaguro, north west of Fanga, in East Jebel Marra
A militia man assaulted 6 women & raped one in the area of Gargour in Kereinik locality

This followed criminal complaints filed by the National Intelligence and Security Services (NISS) on May 13.

Demonstrators in Port Sudan protested the selling of 4 schools for business use by Red Sea State Government, throwing bottles, cutting off major roads & burning tires. Police intervened & dispersed protesters with tear gas. A number of demonstrators were injured.

Angry citizens disrupted a rally for the governor of Red Sea state in Haya locality. They shouted slogans and some tried to demolish the podium

Members of Awlad Omran and Faleita, of the Misseriya tribe, clashed in Um Baroun, El Dabkar, Yama, and Kilo 50, Dibad locality, resulting from land ownership disputes. 43 tribesmen were killed and 37 wounded over 2 days of fighting.

Continued clashes between members of Awlad Omran and Faleita, of the Misseriya tribe, in Um Baroun, El Dabkar, Yama, and Kilo 50, Dibad locality, resulting from land ownership disputes. 43 tribesmen were killed and 37 wounded over 2 days of fighting.
Pro-government militia attacked Nurain village, 60km north of Kutum. 2 people were killed, others injured, and more than 10 missing. Money, cattle and property were also looted.

Pro-government militiamen stormed the headquarters of a court in Nyala with the purpose of forcibly releasing a person accused of murder in trial. They exchanged fire with police before 2 attackers were arrested.
Arrests: SRF and SPLM/N factions launched a broad arrest campaign in Kauda, accusing citizens of spying and guiding government troops in the city.
Government-backed militia attacked a police station west of Kass town. 2 policemen were killed and 3 injured.
The Sudanese Air Force dropped 14 bombs on Kauda, destroying buildings
A protest was held by the Sudanese Committee of Solidarity with the victims of the September 2013, regarding arrests of students and arrest and detention of Umma Party leader El Sadig El Mahdi
Pro-government militia opened fire on a caravan, killing 2 people and injuring another in Dabanaira, north of Mershing in Niteaga locality
People gathered at the mosques in Rebak, White Nile state after Friday prayers, protesting the detention of National Umma Party leader El Sadig El Mahdi
People gathered at the mosques in Wadi Nubawi, Omdurman city, after Friday prayers, protesting the detention of National Umma Party leader El Sadig El Mahdi
Soldiers shot and killed a sheikh of the Abu Suruj camp for the displaced in Sirba locality
Government-backed militiamen abducted 10 residents of El Salam camp in Beilel near Nyala
Abbala tribesmen abducted two women in the area of Um Jarwa in El Sareif Beni Hussein locality, holding them hostage over stolen camels
Militiamen ambushed 4 commercial vehicles in the area of Iweiji, Kutum locality, beating and robbing passengers
3 boys were severely injured when a grenade they found detonated in the area of Baashim, Kutum locality, in North Darfur
Employees of the National Laboratory for Public Health protested against the closure of almost all departments

A group of militants from El Bazaa tribe ambushed herders from El Shanabla tribe searching for a missing herder in White Nile in 2014, killing seven and injuring another three. The Khartoum North Criminal Court sentenced 18 members of the El Bzaa tribe to death two years later, on 25 September 2016.

Zurug and Awlad Amran clans of the Misseriya tribe clashed in in Mujlad and Dabab localities in West Kordofan over claims to a plot of land where drilling for oil is underway. At least 41 people were killed & 13 seriously wounded.

Zurug and Awlad Amran clans of the Misseriya tribe clashed in in Mujlad and Dabab localities in West Kordofan over claims to a plot of land where drilling for oil is underway. At least 41 people were killed & 13 seriously wounded.
Government-backed militiamen ambushed, beat and robbed passengers of 2 commercial vehicles en route from Saraf Jidad to El Geneina
Militiamen opened fire at a vehicle belonging to the Ministry of Health in Digeis area, en route from Nyala to Kubum. 1 assailant was killed & 3 passengers wounded.

Residents of Rumaila district in southern Khartoum protested against the sale of plots of public land and lack of water services. Protesters set fire to tyres and blocked roads. Police used tear gas to disperse the demonstrations.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Gunmen wearing military uniforms opened fire on a Central Reserve Police (Abu Tira) vehicle in Zalingei. The driver was killed & an Abu Tira member wounded.
Abbala tribesmen raided homes in Birkat Seira and seized 4 people on charges of harbouring members of the Beni Hussein tribe
Militiamen attacked the commander of the joint Sudan-Chad-Central African Republic forces and his guards while they were entering the Um Dafug hospital, and seized their vehicle
Employees of the Civil Aviation Authority demonstrated against their dismissal in front of the court in Khartoum.

Residents of Alamab district in southern Khartoum protested against the sale of plots of public land and lack of water services. Protesters set fire to tyres and blocked roads. Police used tear gas to disperse the demonstrations.
Government-backed militiamen raped a woman of Um Shalaya camp for Chadian refugees in Azum locality
Government-backed militia attacked the village of Awlad Amin in Mershing locality, South Darfur, robbing villagers and burning homes
Cattle raiders ambushed members of an Ambororo clan at a grazing site west of Khartoum Bile, Blue Nile Statel. 1 herder was killed and a number of cattle raided.
Pro-government militiamen ambushed and tortured a number of displaced people from Kassab camp in North Darfurs Kutum locality
Pro-government militia killed 10 citizens during attacks on Yalma and Sidou villages in Korma area in El Fasher locality.
Three children were killed when an unexploded bomb exploded in Korofala area, East Jebel Marra
Pro-government militia killed a citizen and looted cattled during an attack between Amarjadeed and Mugabil in Korma area in El Fasher locality.
Riot police broke up a protest by youth supporters of jailed Sudanese opposition leader Sadiq al-Mahdi. Protesters were beaten by police.
Military forces liberated El Atmor area near Kadugli from SPLM-N rebels and seized arms and ammunition. SPLM-N called in a 'tactical withdrawal'
""One INGO national staff member was shot and wounded by an armed man, who proceeded to steal his motorbike.""
Pro-government militia opened fire on a group of people sleeping in Kuru area (20km SW of Tawila). 1 person was killed and one injured.
Pro-government militia attacked Alaiba market, El Radoom locality. They fired into the air and robbed citizens.
12 pro-government militia attacked and seriously injured two displaced farmers from Gereida camp, in Abdos area, north of Gireida.
Armed herders beat farmers from Kalu, Morotoga, Kajo Meder, Toranga and Aradeba villages, near Kass town, and expelled them from their lands. The attacks took place over 2 days.
Pro-government militia attacked Dereig market, west of Zalingei. They fired into the air and beat people. 5 people were seriously injured. Police did not intervene to stop the attacks.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Police and Abu Tira forces clashed with pro-government militiamen who hijacked a commercial lorry in Kailik area. 4 militia, 1 police and 1 Abu Tira were killed.
Four students of Bahri University in Khartoum North were seriously injured after being beaten by student supporters of the ruling National Congress Party
Armed herders beat farmers from Kalu, Morotoga, Kajo Meder, Toranga and Aradeba villages, near Kass town, and expelled them from their lands. The attacks took place over 2 days.

Pro-government militia opened fire on civilians preparing a grave for a person killed by pro-government militia the preceding day. 3 people were killed & 4 injured. More than 100 people fled and were reported missing.
Armed herders beat farmers from Kalu, Morotoga, Kajo Meder, Toranga and Aradeba villages, near Kass town, and expelled them from their lands. The attacks took place over 2 days.
Soldiers randomly opened fire near Damazin airport, Blue Nile state, reportedly after a delay in payment of salaries. No civilian injuries/casualties were reported.

Strike: Doctors and nurses of Nyala Hospital began an open-ended strike, protesting the attack on a doctor by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF), calling for better security measures and payment of dues.
Pro-government militia beat and robbed 3 displaced men in Deleig camp, Wadi Salih locality
Militiamen shot and killed a displaced man living in Khor Ramla camp in Nierteti locality and injured another.
Armed herders beat farmers from Kalu, Morotoga, Kajo Meder, Toranga and Aradeba villages, near Kass town, and expelled them from their lands. The attacks took place over 2 days.
Police fired tear gas and sticks to disperse protesters who were demonstrating against ongoing water cuts. 1 boy died after choking on tear gas. Several protesters were arrested.
Government forces and SPLM-N clashed in Al Atmur, Kadugli area, when rebels attacked government positions. Government reported 110 rebels & 4 soldiers killed over 2 days.

Arrests: Police arrested Sudanese Congress Party chief Ibrahim al-Sheikh in Nuhud, accusing him of undermining the constitutional regime, spreading lies & threatening peace. Al-Sheikh is the 2nd opposition leader arrested for criticising RSF actions.
Hundreds of supporters of the Umma party held a demonstration in Dongola to demand the release of party leader El Sadig El Mahdi, as well as all detainees in Sudan

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS prevented a demonstration demanding the release of all detainees in Sudan. 3 members of the organising Committee for Solidarity were arrested.
Clashes continued between government forces and SPLM-N in Al Atmur, Kadugli area.Government reported 110 rebels & 4 soldiers killed over 2 days.
Militiamen in military uniforms raped and killed a woman from Kalma camp near Nyala
Police forces arrested and tortured a journalist from El Jareeda newspaper in En Nahud
Agreement: The National Umma Party (NUP) and SPLM-N rebels signed an agreement to work together to form a new alliance to help overthrow President Hassan Omar al-Bashirs government.

Hundreds of people demonstrated in En Nahud in protest against the detention of the head of the SCP, Ibrahim El Sheikh. Police and security forces used tear gas and batons to disperse the demonstrators. An SCP youth department official was severely beaten and in a critical condition.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF elements fired into the air in Kass. 2 civilians were injured.

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Police violently dispersed protesters who gathered to demand the release of political prisoners. Several members of the opposition National Umma Party (NUP) were arrested, as well as 4 daughters of NUP leader al-Sadiq al-Mahdi.
Security forces severely beat a trader in Tawila when he refused to pay for their meals.
3 boys were severely injured when a grenade they found detonated, in Jebel Karo area (~20km south of Tawila town).
Security forces opened fire on a civilian in Mershing town when he refused to obey their orders to stop. The civilian was injured.
Government-backed militiamen seized and gang-raped 4 women in Konjar area, 2km west of Tawila
'Janjaweed' militia beat and robbed a number of displaced residents of Murnei camp, in Wadi Tor area. Several residents were severely injured.
4 children were killed when a grenade that they had found detonated in Mukjar locality
Government-backed militiamen abducted 2 displaced persons from Kalma camp, in Um Gedeita area.

4 people were killed and 66 cattle stolen during a cattle raid in Abyei town. A local leader blamed the attack on Sudanese Misseriya and military forces, reporting that the raiders were wearing SAF uniforms.

A Misseriya group and the Sudanese army reportedly attacked Ngok Dinka in Abyei area. 4 people were killed and 66 cattle stolen. A Misseriya chief denied involvement in the attacks, and suggested that the clashes took place between Ngok Dinka and Nuer tribes.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: The family of a detained Sudanese youth activist, held for 50 days without charge, alleged he has been tortured in detention.
Government-backed militiamen attacked the army garrison of Deleig. 2 militiamen were injured.
Citizens gathered in front of security forces offices in Gereida, demanding the release of an outspoken imam who was detained for criticizing the Zakat Chamber of South Darfur during a sermon

column9: Health Workers (Sudan); MSF: Doctors Without Borders
column16: UNSG CAAC; Sudan Consortium; Radio Dabanga
column17: The Sudanese Air Force partially destroyed an MSF hospital when it bombed Farandallah village. 5 civilians and 1 MSF staff were injured - 2 later died of their injuries. Sudanese military denied the attack.
""One INGO worker was injured when Sudan's air force bombed and partially destroyed the INGO hospital.""
2 women were killed they a missile they had found detonated in East Jebel Marra, beside Shangil Tobaya

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Armed men raided the Central Reserve Police (Abu Tira) site in Sanya Dabi area (80km NE of El Geneina). 2 Abu Tira troops were killed and 3 wounded. The armed men took weapons, ammunition, and vehicles.

On 17 June 2014, citizens from El Goura area formed a local rescue team when a number of goats were stolen. They followed the thieves and clashed with them. 1 rescue team member and 2 thieves were killed.
Sudanese air forces bombed Umsirdiba in Umdarain county, Nuba Mountains. 2 men were injured.
Maaliya and Rizeigat tribes clashed near Abu Jabra town following the killing of a Rizeigat Sheikh by Ma'alyia tribesmen. At least 6 Rizeigat tribesmen were killed.

""Four INGO local personnel and one local contractor were abducted by unknown gunmen. Fourteen staff members were initially abducted, but nine were released after negotiations. UPDATE: Two more INGO staff were released on 2 July 2014.""
Pro-government militiamen beat, stabbed and robbed students from a Koranic school south of Nierteti. 3 students were severely injured.

""Two INGO national staff members and one local UN consultant were abducted while traveling to Kutum. A third INGO staffer, the driver, was also abducted but later released. The vehicle was later abandoned. UPDATE: The two INGO staff and the UN consultant were released on 19 July 2014.""
Rizeigat tribesmen assassinated Maaliya Sheikh Mousa inside his house at Abu Jabra El Mahata

Militiamen and police exchanged fire in Kabkabiya town when police attempted to arrest gunmen who had killed a civilian the day before. 2 civilians were killed and 9 others injured. 2 gunmen were also reported killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Looting: Armed men wearing Abu Tira uniforms seized 4 lorries in Um Sidir area and robbed passengers.

Security forces beat Darfuri students at Shambat university who had gathered to discuss a university decision to deny permission to students unable to pay tuition fees to sit for exams. Several students were injured.

Security forces beat Darfuri students at El Nilein university who had gathered to discuss a university decision to deny permission to students unable to pay tuition fees to sit for exams. Several students were injured.

Misseriya and Salamat tribes clashed in Salayle (north of Um Dukhun town). Fighting stemmed from disputes over stolen cattle. 5 people were killed, including 4 Salamat and 1 Misseriya tribesman. 4 others were wounded.
Government-backed militiamen opened fire on two commercial vehicles in Um El Khairat area, east of Gereida town. 7 passengers were seriously injured.
SPLM-N reported having destroyed an army convoy at Jebel Kaleed, near Bau locality, Blue Nile state. 5 soldiers were reported killed, along with 1 SPLM-N fighter.

Misseriya and Salamat tribes clashed in Mukjar. Fighting stemmed from disputes over stolen cattle. 4 people were killed, including 3 Salamat and 1 Misseriya tribesman. 4 others were wounded. Military forces later intervened.
Unidentified gunmen abducted three Sudanese aid workers working with GOAL, an Irish humanitarian group, near Kutum town

Riot police used tear gas to disperse protests against the government's decision to sell public lands in Al-Hamadab neighbourhood, south of Khartoum. Youth set tires on fire in the street to prevent riot police from entering the neighbourhood.
Gunmen shot a guard and seriously injured of the West Darfur state governor when they stole a vehicle belonging to the West Darfur state government near El Geneina.
5 children were killed during an attack by Abbala on 2 Beni Hussein villages in Khideira area
Strike:Doctors at Sennar Hospital went on strike, protesting poor health conditions at the hospital
Government-backed militiamen stormed Habila Kanari village (4km east of El Geneina). They robbed villagers and shot and killed 3 civilians.

column16: Africa Review; Sudan Tribune; Radio Dabanga
column17: Salamat and Misseriya tribes (backed by Ta'aisha tribesmen) clashed in al-Mirdiff (Muradaf), Um Dukhun. 130 people were reported killed between June 21-22.
Government-backed militiamen abducted 5 residents of Abu Rumayl village, Kolbus locality, and pillaged 6 villages in Kolbus area
Government-backed gunmen raided a home in Garsila, Wadi Salih locality, and abducted a secondary school student whose father that had accused of stealing their cows.
A Beni Hussein armed group mistakenly attacked Rizeigat west of Saraf Omra while they were chasing cattle raiders leading to fire exchange between the two groups. 4 tribesmen were killed.
Fighting between Salamat and Misseriya tribes continued for the 2nd day in Muradaf, Um Dukhun locality. 130 people were reported killed between June 21-22.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Armed men in military forces driving a vehicle with RSF plates abducted a hotel owner in Nyala
Abbala and Beni Hussein tribes clashed in Khideira area
Fighting between Salamat and Misseriya tribes continued for the 3rd day in Um Dukhun locality. Fatalities unknown.

Hundreds of people took part in a peaceful march to the UN security force base in Abyei Town, condemning a June 14 cattle raid in which 4 people were killed and calling for better protection of civilians by UN peacekeepers.
Militiamen opened fire on a commercial vehicle near Tawila market. 2 passengers were injured.
Herders shot and killed 2 farmers in Wadi Zor, north of Wadi Azum (Zalingei locality), when the farmers protested when the herders released livestock and cut mango trees on their farmlands.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF elements abducted a village sheikh and a policeman in Girnei village, Nierteti locality.
Gunmen fired at an Omda's vehicle in Farigta area (~20km from El Geneina). 3 passengers were killed and 4 passengers and guards were injured.

Army and police forces detained and reportedly tortured 10 villagers from Lagori village (~27km NE of Kadugli). The arrests were allegedly linked to government forces' defeat in a battle in Daldako in May 2014.
Change to armed group: The formation of new rebel movement in Darfur, the Sudan Liberation Movement-Second Revolution (SLM-SR), was officially announced
Market vendors in Nyala protested the construction of temporary stalls in front of their shops
The Sudanese Journalists' Network (SJN) organised a sit-in, demanding the release of a journalist detained by security forces in En Nahud

column9: Bani Hussein Ethnic Group (Sudan); Social Fabric Committee
column17: Abbala gunmen attacked Beni Hussein civilians (incl. members of the Social Fabric Committee) in Jiheir village, west of El Sareif town, El Sareif Beni Hussein locality, reportedly after an attempted cattle theft. 10 Beni Hussein were killed and 29 injure
Janjaweed militia attacked a commercial vehicle between Zalingei and Nierteti, beating and lashing passengers before robbing them.
Government-backed militiamen abducted a trader in Kass town
Abbala gunmen attacked Hileila village, Kabkabiya locality, after finding one of the members dead in a neighbouring area. They kidnapped a man and beat other Hileila residents.
Militiamen attacked Bindisi market, firing into the air. They withdrew when police convinced them to leave.
Pro-government militiamen attacked 3 displaced men on their way to a farm in Amar Jadid, west of Mila, Kass locality.

Military forces clashed with SLM-Minnawi fighters in Ed al-Zalat and al-Managim areas (NE of Kutum). The military reported inflicting 'heavy casualties' on rebels, and seized 22 armed vehicles, rocket launches, cannons and small arms.
Gunmen assaulted 4 displaced women in Mergum area, Kass locality. They attempted to rape the women and beat them with sticks and whips. 1 was seriously wounded.

Awlad Imran and El Ziyoud clans (of the Misseriya Humur) clashed in Fisheig and El Baraka areas in Babanusa locality, over a dispute about pastures. 93 people (70 Awlad Imran and 23 El Ziyoud) were killed.

Militiamen wearing military uniforms opened fire on a commercial vehicle in Donki Hadub locality, 10km from Gireida town. 1 woman was killed and other passengers beat with stones, whips and rifles. Militiamen chased after passengers who escaped; it is not known if they were killed.

Awlad Imran and El Ziyoud clans (of the Misseriya Humur) clashed in Fisheig and El Baraka areas in Babanusa locality, over a dispute about pastures. 93 people (70 Awlad Imran and 23 El Ziyoud) were killed.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column8: SLMJ: Sudan Liberation Movement for Justice
column17: Sudan Liberation Movement for Justice (SLMJ) leader Ali Karbino Ali Karbino was killed, along with 12 other rebels (incl SLM-Minnawi), following clashes with the government forces (supported by Border Guards militia and Arab pastoralists) in Alquba (El Guba) area, north of Kutum. 2 Minnawi commanders and 10 pastoralist fighters were also killed. 15 rebels and 30 armed vehicles were captured by military forces.

Ethiopian gunmen clashed with PDF fighters when they attacked Basonda area, Gedaref state, near the Sudanese-Ethiopian border. 10 PDF members were killed & 13 wounded. The gunmen were attempting to control agricultural projects in Basonda, which are owned by the PDF.
SPLM-N forces shelled military positions in Kadugli town
SPLM-N forces attacked government forces in Alatmor (~45 km E of Kadugli). They reported killing 15 soldiers. A military spokesman reported that 50 rebels were killed.
10 Sudanese soldiers were killed on 28/06 by Ethiopian gunmen who attacked farmlands in Basonda area, Gedaref state
SPLM-N forces shelled military positions in Alhamra and Daldoko (positions recently captured by the army)
Janjaweed militia fired into the air and kidnapped a farmer in Gimeiza Kamra area, north of Kass town.
SPLM-N forces reported they shot down a government helicopter in the Dilling area. The military denied this.
SPLM-N forces shelled military positions in Alhamra and Daldoko (positions recently captured by the army)

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Arrests: Security and police forces shut down the SCP office in En Nahud, dispersed an SCP symposium, and detained 3 party leaders.
Clashes between Sudanese soldiers and Ethiopian gunmen continued in in Basonda area, Gedaref state

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Paramilitary Border Guards abducted 35 people from the Zaghawa tribe in Mellit and took them to their site in Kutum
SPLM-N and government forces engaged in heavy fighting in the Al-Atmur area. Military forces reported that they defeated the rebel advance and continued to hold the area.
A group of about 150 government-backed militiamen attacked Malwi village, Gireida locality. 1 civilian was killed, 8 injured, and 49 went missing.
Government-backed militiamen opened fire and killed a civilian collecting firewood east of Garsila town.

A group of Beni Hussein tribesmen demonstrated in from the National Assembly in Omdurman, in protest against the increasing number of attacks and killings by the Abbala in al-Siraif locality. They called on the government to put an end to the security breakdown.
Government-backed militiamen opened fire on a commercial vehicle at Jebel Kunjo, east of Zalingei. 3 people were seriously injured.

Maaliya and Hamar tribesmen clashed in Um Shaalouba area, East Darfur over a conflict about farmland and stolen cattle. At least 22 people were killed and dozens wounded in fighting on 30/06 and 01/07 in East Darfur and West Kordofan.
Pro-government militia attacked a commercial vehicle in Anka area, north of Kutum town. They beat and looted passengers.
Pro-government militiamen abducted a boy in Nierteti locality, 1km east of Nierteti town.
Pro-government militia shot and killed 4 students on the road between El Sareif Beni Hussein and Kabkabiya
Clashes between Maaliya and Hamar tribesmen spilled into West Kordofan. At least 22 people were killed and dozens wounded in fighting on 30/06 and 01/07 in East Darfur and West Kordofan.
Looting: Pro-government militia looted Kutum market

Clashes continued between Maaliya and Hamar tribesmen in Um Shaalouba area, East Darfur over a conflict about farmland and stolen cattle. At least 22 people were killed and dozens wounded in fighting on 30/06 and 01/07 in East Darfur and West Kordofan.
'Janjaweed' militia assaulted a number of boys from Murnei camp for the displaced, who were grazing goats west of the camp. They also stole 52 goats belonging to camp residents.
Militiamen wearing military uniforms opened fire on displaced civilians in Mila, Kunyumadil, and Kumba villages west of Kass. 5 people were injured and goats and materials were stolen.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Pro-government militia, believed to be RSF, shot and killed a secondary school student in Nyala, and stole his mobile phone.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Looting: RSF elements robbed 7 pilgrims in Ronga area, Central Darfur (on the road from East Jebel Marra to Zalingei), taking their money and mobile phones.
Police clashed with nomads who were protesting the non-supply of electricity in Um El Tuyor area, west of Atbara, River Nile state. At least 3 police were injured.
At least 10 Sudanese farmers were killed in a raid by Ethiopian gunmen in Basonda area in Gedaref state. They opened fire on the farmers following a dispute over agricultural land.
SPLM-N rebels shelled government positions in Al-Atmur area.

Awlad Omran and al-Zyoud clans of the Misseriya group clashed in Al Dibab area, West Kordofan, reportedly over disputes over land where oil drilling is underway. 150 people were reported killed, although a preliminary count showed that 80 people had been killed on 28/06.
Janjaweed militia abducted 2 displaced men in Amar area, 6km W of Kass town.
Renewed clashes broke out between Maaliya and Rizeigat tribes in El Sahib area, Abu Karinka locality, linked to theft of livestock. 27 men from both tribes were killed and 17 wounded.
18 people were killed in clashes between Maaliya and Rezeigat in Al Faddu area, after a member of the Maaliya tribe killed a member of the Rezeigat tribe
A member of the Maaliya tribe killed a member of the Rezeigat tribe in Al Faddu area outside Ed Daein
Abbala tribesmen kidnapped 5 women in El Marra area, SE of El Sareif town, El Sareif Beni Hussein locality, after 48 Abbala cows went missing
'Janjaweed' militiamen attached Jukhana market, south of Gireida town, and shot into the air. 1 displaced man was killed and 3 other people injured.
Government-backed militiamen shot and killed a resident of Zamzam camp, in Baldo, west of Tabit.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF militiamen shot and killed a secondary school student near Otash camp, Nyala locality, when he refused to hand over his mobile phone. Another woman was hit by a bullet and injured.
Government-backed militiamen shot and killed a secondary school student at Deleig market. Another student was critically injured and later died.
A staffer from the International Organisation for Migration was abducted in South Darfur. No other details were provided.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Border Guards attacked Anka area, Kutum locality. They beat people, pillaged shops and houses, seized livestock, and abducted 14 civilians. Aircraft supporting Border Guards fighters also dropped 2 bombs on the area.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Fighter jets supporting Border Guards fighters dropped 4 bombs on Birdik area, Kutum locality. 1 person was reported killed. Border Guards also attacked the area, and pillaged shops and houses and seized livestock.
""One UN international staff member was abducted by gunmen on a Land Cruiser. UPDATE: he was released on 25 July 2014.""

Armed men opened fire on the vehicle of the Commissioner of Katila locality, in Tuwal Um Balal area between Nyala and Katila town, who was killed immediately. PDF members were later reported to have been involved in the killing, and 9 members were charged.
Government-backed militia raided Abu Dinga village, Sirba locality. They opened fire and critically injured 2 civilians.
'Janjaweed' militia attacked a bus that had broken down in Beroma aeae, en route from Nylaa. They robbed passengers and raped 3 women.
Rezeigat fighters attacked Maaliya in El Sahab area, Abu Karinka locality. 3 Maaliya were killed in the clashes. 3 Rizeigat and 2 Maaliya were wounded.
Government-backed militiamen attacked and pillaged Sandeigo village, about 1pm from the army base at Korma. 1 man was killed and ~200 cows taken.

2 members of the paramilitary Popular Defence Forces (PDF) were killed in a gunfight with a joint army-police patrol in El Fasher. Clashes erupted after the PDF troops violated an order banning the wearing of a kadmol, a turban-veil covering the head and the face.
Military police severely beat and tortured 2 civilians in Kutum town

column6: SLMJ: Sudan Liberation Movement for Justice
column17: SLMJ, in cooperation with SLM-Minawi, attacked 2 military convoys in Jebel Hireiz, between Shangil Tobaya and Abu Zireiga (Abu Zurayqah). SLMJ reported that 17 government soldiers were killed and 7 military vehicles destroyed.
Militiamen abducted 2 passengers from a lorry in Omu El Madrasa area, north of Kutum.

Agreement: SPLM-N and the Sudanese Awakening Revolutionary Council (SARC) (led by the former Janjaweed leader Musa Hilal) signed a memorandum of understanding to jointly work towards overthrowing the totalitarian regime and establishing the democratic regime.
Agreement: Hamar and Maalia tribes signed an agreement in Omdurman aimed at ending fighting which has been continuing for two years in East Darfur and West Kordofan

Citizens, incl. relatives of a man killed by armed robbers on July 10, demonstrated in front of the Kass police station, calling upon the authorities to provide security, and protect the citizens the assaults by militiamen

The Sudanese Air Force bombed the areas of Khor Mali (3 bombs) and Saby (9 bombs) in East Jebel Marra. The bombing did not result in human or material losses, but caused cause panic among the population.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Arrests: Security forces again raided SCP headquarters in En Nahud and detained 6 party leaders, including the Secretary General who had been released the day before.
Looting: Gunmen hijacked a vehicle belonging to the Deputy Governor and Minister of Health of North Darfur State, in Huwara district in El Fasher.

Unidentified gunmen killed the Telass area coordinator of the Popular Defence Forces, along with his bodyguard. 3 attackers were also killed during a heavy exchange of gunfire in Selea area, East Darfur, between Ed Daein and Nyala.
Pro-government militia attacked 20 women working on farms in Atabra area, 15km W of Tawila, and raped 3 girls.
Gunmen shot and killed a Koran sheikh and his brother from El Salam camp in Bielel locality, South Darfur, as they were on their way to Nyala market

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Army troops and RSF elements reportedly raped 11 women, robbed civilians and torched Dar El Salam and Degeina villages during their withdrawal from Golo, after their defeat by SLM-Wahid.
Unknown gunmen attacked gold miners at the disputed El Laffa area between Liri and Talodi localities, South Kordofan.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: SLM-Wahid reported that it repulsed a government incursion attempt (supported by RSF) in Golo area, Central Darfur. 31 army troops were killed.
'Janjaweed' militiamen shot and killed a farmer when they attempted to steal his horse and donkey, in Khoran area, 1km NW of Birkat Seira town.
Abbala tribesmen raided an area east of Midesees, El Sareif Beni Hussein locality. They fired at herders in the area, killing 1 and injuring 2 before seizing cows, sheep, and goats.

column7: SLMJ: Sudan Liberation Movement for Justice; SLM/A-Unity: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Unity Faction); SLM/A-SR: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army-Second Revolution
column17: Change to armed group: Three SLM factions SLMJ, SLM-Unity, and SLM-Second Revolution merged to form the Sudan Liberation Forces, aiming to ""dismantle the ruling National Congress Party regime, and re-build the Sudanese state on the basis of a new social contract"".
'Janjaweed' militiamen shot and killed a man and stole 300 sheep in Tibra area, 15km W of Tawila town.

Non-violent activity: Minawi forces in Darfur reportedly received military supplies from the South Sudanese government, including 21 land cruisers pickups, four quad cannons, 300 Kalashnikov and 120 fuel barrels, 200 torches, 400 Kalashnikov bullets and food supplies.
SPLM-N attacked an army position in Bau locality, Blue Nile state. An SPLM-N spokesman reported that 2 fighters and 4 soldiers were killed.
Property destruction: PDF elements torched 2 houses in the Um Mareh settlement for the displaced

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Looting: Militia elements intercepted and stole a UNAMID vehicle in Jebel Sigaira, 8m NE of Nyala.
Misseriya militia attacked Gokmou cattle camp, south of Abyei town. 5 people were killed.
The Women's Secretariat of the SCP organised a demonstration in En Nahud, protesting against the continued detention of SCP leaders and calling for their release.
Pro-government militiamen abducted a school teacher and stole a large amount of money near Kass town, at Lufa Kasara area en route from Nyala to Zalingei.
An armed group attacked a Falata group in El Fademia village, Bau locality. 5 Falata were wounded. A tribal leader accused SPLM-N of responsibility.
Pro-government militiamen opened fire on motorcycles on El Matar road in Nyala city, killing a 12-year-old boy.
Non-violent activity: SLM-Minnawi and Karbino forces reportedly attacked a commercial convoy in Amar area, between El Fashir and Kabkabiya.
Security forces beat students and used tear gas to disperse a peaceful student protest against tribal conflict in East Darfur in front of the National Assembly. 5 students were arrested.
Non-violent activity: Military intelligence troops raided Um Mareh settlement for the displaced and detained 4 men, accusing them of affilitation with SPLM-N.

column6: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
column17: Attackers who had attacked a Dinka Ngok cattle camp at Gong e Mou area were ambushed by a UNIFSA patrol at Wun e Ruok. Some sources reported that the attackers were SAF, others blamed the attacks on Misseriya nomads and pro-Khartoum South Sudan United Movement.

Armed men attacked a Dinka Ngok cattle camp at Gong e Mou area near Abyei town, killing 5 people and injuring 3. Some sources reported that the attackers were SAF, others blamed the attacks on Misseriya nomads and pro-Khartoum South Sudan United Movement.
Government-backed militiamen attacked, beat, and robbed farmers in Kalu and Amarjadeed area, Kass locality.

Militiamen attacked a health centre at Fata Borno camp run by Irish NGO GOAL. They beat 2 guards on duty and took the contents of the centre, including medicines, vaccines, refrigerators, furniture, solar-powered generators, computers, and record books
Government-backed militiamen attacked, beat, and robbed farmers in Kalu and Amarjadeed area, Kass locality.
About 200 people demonstrated outside the Grand Mosque after Friday prayers, calling for a 'jihad' in Gaza, protesting against Israeli assaults on Hamas.
Militiamen beat and abducted 2 farmers and seized their tractor in Dankoj area, Central Darfur. The farmers were released 2 days later.
Government-allied militiamen opened fire on 2 commercial lorries and a vehicle in Uzban area, on the road between El Fasher and Kabkabiya. At least 13 people were killed.

column6: Hamza Combat Group Against Atheism and Heresy
column17: Masked gunmen raided the offices of Al-Tayyar daily newspaper and severely beat its chief editor, reportedly over his calls for normalisation of ties with Israel. A group calling itself 'Hamza Combat Group Against Atheism and Heresy' claimed responsibility for the attack and threatened to hunt down anyone ""openly hostile to the Palestinian resistance"". The editor later claimed that the Hamza group does not exist and is hiding the real attackers.
Hundreds of journalists demonstrated in protest against the assault of the editor in chief of Al-Tayyar newspaper on 19/07.
Militiamen seized and raped 3 women from Kalma camp in Ba'ashum area, and severely beat and robbed 9 other displaced persons.
Government-backed militiamen attacked Jebel Afara nomadic village, east of Malam, South Darfur. 4 herders were killed.

Looting: Sudanese military elements are accused of grabbing land belonging to the Rufa_a al Hawa nomadic tribe in Sennar state. A group of soldiers reportedly settled in Kokari village without permission, attempting to annex pastoralists territory to the army.
Militiamen shot and beat people in Armankul camp for the displaced, Sirba locality, before stealing 75 goats.
Government-backed militiamen attacked and beat a family on their farmland in Um Asal area near Gireida and gang raped the 3 daughters
A citizen was found dead in a police cell in Port Sudan, reportedly as a result of torture.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF elements attacked, beat and robbed a group of young people in Shambat district, Khartoum.
Gunmen in military uniform opened fired on and severely injured 2 displaced men in Dankoj area, Zalingei.

Relatives of 2 Kass residents killed by gunmen on 20/07 demonstrated in front of the Kass police station, protesting against the deteriorating security situation in the town. Police fired into the air, frightening the demonstrators.
A woman was killed in Mashrou Abu Zeid area, East Jebel Marra, when a grenade detonated as she was ploughing her farmland.
Strike: Junior doctors from El Geneina hospital began an open-ended strike, protesting against the hospital working environment and delayed payment of incentives.
Pro-government militiamen opened fire on a foreign currency dealer and his son at El Geneina market, as they attempted to rob them.
About 300 government-backed militia troops entered Central Darfur and stationed themselves along the Tululu mountains, south of Zalingei.
Labour union members in Adila and Abu Karinka, East Darfur, protested against large deductions from staff salaries by state and local authorities.
About 1,250 government-backed militia troops entered Central Darfur and stationed themselves in Ifoun and Jebel Kargo areas, around Abata
More than 200 government-backed militia troops entered Central Darfur and stationed themselves in Beida area, east of Zalingei.
Labour union members in Adila and Abu Karinka, East Darfur, protested against large deductions from staff salaries by state and local authorities.
About 300 government-backed militia troops entered Central Darfur and stationed themselves in Jebel Konsho area, NW of Zalingei
The Sudanese Air Force dropped several bombs on East Jebel Marra. No human casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Residents reported that the RSF has spread around Tangara town (15-20 km south of Tabit)

column6: JEM-Sudan: Justice and Equality Movement (Sudan Faction)
column17: A breakaway faction of JEM-Sudan attacked a military post in Karnoi. 2 soldiers were killed and a civilian injured.
SPLM-N reported attacks by government forces and allied militia in Khor El Doleib, Rashad, South Kordofan
SPLM-N reported that it repulsed an attack by government forces and allied militia in Nyakama area, Heiban, South Kordofan, and that 4 soldiers were killed.
SPLM-N reported attacks by government forces and allied militia in Um Berembita, Rashad, South Kordofan
Pro-government militiamen attacked and robbed Arola village in Wadi Salih locality.
Abbala gunmen killed a UNAMID translator between Saraf Umra and El Sareif Beni Hussein, abducted another man, and wounded a man who tried to intervene.
Militiamen abducted a resident of El Salam and stole 6 cows.
Pro-government militiamen attacked Hashaba in Katila locality, South Darfur, and wounded 4 displaced people and stole horses and carts.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF elements abducted 2 shepherds near Tinkarara area, El Fasher locality.

Demobilised Beja Congress fighters occupied the National Congress Party office in Port Sudan, protesting against the non-implementation of the 2006 Eastern Sudan Peace Agreement (ESPA). Mediators intervened.
Militiamen severely beat 5 residents of El Salam camp in Amar Jedid area.
Janjaweed gunmen killed the driver of the vehicle belonging to West Darfur State's Minister of Finance, in El Geneina, then pillaged the vehicle.
Gunmen raided and destroyed the SCP office in Omdurman and assaulted 7 people.
Government-backed militiamen raided Saraf Umra market and abducted a displaced man.
An unidentified gunman shot and seriously wounded a man and his 2 sons on their way home from Abu Karinka town.
A herder from El Sheikh Janna village was killed when a grenade detonated in Kutum locality.
Militiamen shot and killed a mobile phone credit vendor and injured his 2 friends when they tried to rob him in Jertobak area, east of Gireida town.
Soldiers stormed El Salam camp for the displaced in South Darfur and beat 2 residents.
Fellata tribesmen stole a number of cows from the Beni Halba tribe, and attacked a Beni Halba rescue team that was tracking them, around Ed El Fursan in South Darfur.
Government-backed militiamen shot and killed a herder in Um Jarwa, El Sareif Beni Hussein locality.
Non-violent activity: Pro-government militia fired into the air in Nierteti camp for the displaced, terrorising the population, though no injuries were reported.
Government and SPLM-N forces clashed at Salbal (~30km S of Damazin). 2 soldiers were killed.
Government and SPLM-N forces clashed around Masfa, in Bau.
Government-backed militiamen attacked and seriously injured 4 farmers from Mukjar camp for the displaced, Central Darfur.
Non-violent activity: Gunmen entered El Salam camp for the displaced and opened fire, terrorising the population, though no injuries were reported.
Herders beat 2 South Sudanese female refugees near Jori camp, White Nile state.

column6: Former Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Agreement: Over 500 deserters from the South Sudanese military crossed to Hadida area in East Darfur and surrendered their arms.

column6: Former Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Agreement: 114 deserting South Sudanese soldiers from Bahr el Ghazal region surrendered their arms to Sudanese authorities in Al Mayrem, seeking refuge from economic hardship in South Sudan
Janjaweed militia shot and killed a resident of Gireida camp for the displaced.

Militiamen stormed Shoba camp in El Fasher locality, firing into the air and killing 1 displaced man and injuring 4 other residents, and raped several women and attacked several nomads around the camp and stole 400 sheep.
Government-backed militiamen raped a displaced young woman and beat and seriously injured 3 others near Kassab camp, Kutum locality.
Sudanese Air Force dropped bombs on Dolma, East Jebel Marra, killing 2 children.
Government-backed militiamen severely beat a young woman and her mother in Karkar village, Sirba locality, West Darfur
Government forces clashed with SPLM-N rebels who attacked Agadi market (~36km W of El-Damazin). 2 rebels and 1 soldier were killed.
SPLM-N rebels attacked Agadi market (~36km W of El-Damazin), killing one civilian.
2 men died after being detained and flogged at a police station in Port Sudan

Citizens blocked the Khartoum-Kassala-Port Sudan road with burning tires in El Hafa'ir area (~30km W of Kassala), protesting against rising prices of basic commodities. 38 protesters were arrested and imprisoned.
Unidentified militiamen shot and killed a civilian and wounded another in Adam El Doma El Safu, Bielel locality.
Unidentified militiamen shot, killed, and burned a motorcycle mechanic in Kabar market, Um Dukhun locality.
Unidentified militants killed a civilian and wounded two others in El Sareif Beni Hussein.
A retired police lieutenant was shot and killed by unknown assailants in El Fasher.

Sudanese opposition parties participating in a national dialogue formed a new alliance, the National Forces Alliance. The NFA involves 18 political parties, including the Reform Now Party. The Popular Congress Part rejected the new alliance.

Military forces in more than 150 vehicles stormed El Salam camp for the displaced in Bielel locality. 75 residents were arrested and taken to a military court and 23 people were injured from beatings and whippings. The raid was reportedly part of new emergency measures in the state, though others believed it was intended to terrorise the camp.
Pro-government militia beat, wounded, and robbed 21 people in villages in Sirba locality.

SPLM-N forces reportedly ambushed military troops between Weilang and Magenza areas, ~50km S of Damazin town, Blue Nile state, killing 2 soldiers, capturing another, and destroying for trucks loaded with military equipment.
Pro-government militiamen shot and killed a displaced man as he was working on his farm north of a camp in Nyala
A Sudanese warplane dropped a bomb near a medical facility run by Doctors Without Borders (MSF) in the southern Nuba Mountains. No injuries were reported.
One person was beaten to death by a group of men in Kabar market, Um Dukhun county, reportedly due to conflict between Salamat and Ta'aisha tribes.
Pro-government militiamen shot and injured 2 men in Amarjadeed when they attempted to rob in home.

A nomad herder shot and killed a farmer and injured 2 women in Bielel locality. The farmer had gathered cattle that the herder was grazing on his farm to bring them to a stable for abandoned livestock.
Pro-government militiamen kidnapped a man from Korma camp for the displaced in El Fasher, and beat a number of other residents as well as taking more than 1000 cattle from the camp.

Non-violent activity: Military forces with more than 60 vehicles stormed Dereig camp for the displaced in Nyala locality, and detained a number of residents, reportedly as part of new security measures.
Movement of forces: About 200 pro-government militia elements surrounded Amarjadeed village for 2 days, before being chased away by military forces. No clashes were reported.
Militiamen shot and killed a bus passenger and wounded 2 others at a militia toll fate in Dar el Salam locality.

More than 50 citizens, including the leader of the Angasana tribe, have been detained in Blue Nile state since the beginning of August, after SPLM-N forces attacked Agadi area. It is reported that detainees have been tortured.

column7: NUP: National Umma Party; JEM: Justice and Equality Movement; SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column16: Radio Dabanga; Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune
column17: The Sudan Revolutionary Front committed to a unilateral cessation of hostilities after 3 days of meetings with Umma Party, JEM, and SLA-Wahid leaders in Paris. The Paris Declaration also unites Sudan's opposition forces, including the National Umma Party, in a democratic transformation in Sudan. The Sudanese government rejected the SRF agreement, calling for a more comprehensive ceasefire agreement.
Residents of El Hamadab in southern Khartoum demonstrated against the sale of residential plots in the district to members of the armed forces. Police dispersed demonstrators with tear gas.
Non-violent activity: Militiamen stormed the market in Girnei village, Nierteti locality, and imposed fees on merchants
Militiamen in military uniforms shot and killed a resident and injured his son in Kondobe camp in Sirba locality

A group of youth abducted 9 Chinese oil workers at Zarga Um Hadid and Jid El Sayed oil fields in El Mazarob, Adila locality, reportedly in response to the lack of compensation for farmlands by the oil companies. The workers were released the next day following negotations the the local commissioner.
Government-backed militiamen gang-raped 3 sisters in Wadi Taya, East Jebel Marra.

Residents of El Hamadab in southern Khartoum demonstrated against the sale of residential plots in the district to members of the armed forces. The demonstrators burned tires and blocked some main streets

Change to armed group: A new rebel group calling itself the Marginalised Combat Movement, composed of dissident paramilitary Border Guards and government soldiers, announced that it will target the East Darfur state government. The spokesman said the group is already in control of areas at the western Sudanese-South Sudanese border, as well as parts of East Darfur in Sudan, and Northern Bahr El Ghazal in South Sudan.
Government-backed militiamen raided homes in Mawashi camp for the displaced, Kabkabiya locality, beating, stabbing, and seriously injuring 3 residents
Government-backed militiamen shot and killed a resident of Kutum town
Janjaweed gunmen ambushed 5 lorries between Kutum town and Dor village, in Abdel Shakur area, beating passengers, raping women, and seizing goods.
Unidentified gunmen attacked a student boarding house in El Taghyeer district, Kutum, beating and robbing students

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Arrests: Security agents arrested Mariam al-Mahdi, deputy leader of the opposition Umma Party, at the Khartoum airport after the party reached a deal with rebels, including the Sudan Revolutionary Front, in Paris.

Arrests: 83 people were detained in Kass locality in a campaign targeting criminal elements in the area, part of emergency measures announced by the South Darfur State governor to combat regional insecurity.
A woman died after being gang-raped by unidentified men in Bau, suspected to be herders from the Fallata tribe.
Non-violent activity: Government forces raided Otash camp for the displaced in Nyala, reportedly as part of new security measures.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLM-Wahid reported that it had attacked a military base in Oo, Jebel Marra, killing 17 government troops and seizing weapons and ammunition.

1 student was killed at the University of Delling, at least 10 were injured, and at least 30 arrested when police and security forces supported by militant students of the National Congress Party attacked studenst who were peacefully protesting, calling for the provision of water and electricity to their dormitories
Pro-government militiamen shot and killed a shepherd in East Jebel Marra and stole his cattle
Militiamen abducted a man from his house in Kafi village, near Kutum town
Non-violent activity: Government forces in 17 armoured vehicles raided Kalma camp for the displaced in Nyala, reportedly as part of new security measures. 1 resident was detained.
Arrests: Over 50 civilians were arrested by security agents in Agadi (~36km W of El-Damazin), accused of spying for the SPLM-N, following clashes between military and SPLM-N forces in early August
Military intelligence agents are accused of killing 4 people detained on charges of spying for the SPLM-N, in Kurgul, Habila locality, South Kordofan
7 SCP members were detained in En Nahud, following a protest calling for the release of party leader Ibrahim El Sheikh and other detained party cadres
Government-backed militiamen shot a woman in her home in El Salam camp
Armed men shot and killed a resident of Kondobe camp, Sirba locality, while he was working on his farm.
Pro-government militiamen raped and severely injured two women from Shangil Tobaya camp for the displaced who were fetching firewood outside the camp
Reizaigat and Maalia tribes clashed in Um Rakubah area, Abu Karinka, following the theft of livestock. At least 41 people were reported killed.
Militiamen beat and abducted 4 people, and beat 3 others, from Abdel Shakur village, north of Kutum town, reportedly linked to stolen camels

Members of the National Consensus Forces (a coalition of opposition parties) and relatives of political detainees organised a sit-in in front the National Human Rights Commission in Khartoum, in protest against the widespread detentions of political activists. Police officers barred them from submitting a memorandum to the Commission.
The Students Union of the University of Khartoum organised a sit-in in from the university gate, demanding the resumption of the suspended studies, and the removal of weapons stored inside the campus

Dozens of Ma'aliya young people gathered in front of the Omdurman parliament building, accusing elements of the Border Guards, the Rapid Support Forces, the Popular Defence Forces, the Central Reserve Police (Abu Tira), and the regular police of participating in attacks on Ma'aliya in Abu Karinka locality on Aug 16.
Maalia fighters clashed with government troops when the Maalia fighters accused soldiers of belonging to the Rizeigat tribe. 4 soldiers and 5 Maalia fighters were killed.
A large group of NUP members protested in from the NUP headquarters in Wad Nubawi, Omdurman, demanding the immediate release of the parties Co-Vice President, who was detained on Aug 11
PDF elements killed a university student in Soda village near Hashaba. The PDF troops shot the student after accusing him of cattle theft as he was herding cows outside the village.

A demobilised Beja Congress combatant threw a hand grenade into a veterinary clinic in Sawakin, near Port Sudan, during protests over the Red Sea state governments negligence of their living conditions

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Arrests: Security forces raided the homes of seniors SCP members in En Nahud and detained 2 senior members.
Students at Sennar University in Sinja protested over flooding and poor sanitation in dormitories
Residents of the Kondobe camp for the displaced in Sirba locality demonstrated against the release of militiamen who killed a displaced farmer

At least 137 people were killed during clashes between the Ma'aliya and Rizeigat in the area of Um Rakuba in Abu Karinka. Rizeigat militiamen reportedly attacked the Maaliya, reportedly stemming from a dispute over ownership of a land.
Armed herders assaulted farmers in Torgoli, Ragoli, Kaya, and Hillet Dabanga areas, East Jebel Marra, after releasing their cattle into farming areas.
Movement of forces: A large number of government forces have been deployed to Abu Karinka locality to prevent renewed clashes between Rizeigat and Maaliya groups.
Government-backed militiamen opened fire on 2 people tending their farmlands west of Goz Mur in Nierteti locality. 1 man was killed.

Dozens of Ma'alia tribesmen demonstrated in front of the presidential palace in Khartoum and handed a memo to the office of the president in protest against participation of government troops alongside the Rizeigat in the tribal clashes
'Skirmishes' were reported between Rizeigat and Maaliya groups in El Musaba'at area, south of __Abu Jabra
Gunmen raped 8 women and girls who were tending farmland in Buram locality
A woman was killed in an air raid by the Sudanese air force on Goz Dor village, East Jebel Marra
Government-backed militiamen robbed and beat a group of displaced people at Khor Kuol, as they were returning to Korji from Nierteti market
The SPLM-N launched attacks on government positions in Khor Fatah Einak village in Kurmuk locality and at Salbel and Derang areas in Bau. Several soldiers and civilians were wounded in the clashes.

Dozens of women demonstrated in front of the buildings of the National Intelligence and Security Service (NISS) in Khartoum, calling for the release of the National Umma Party co-vice-president, detained since Aug 11. Protesters handed a memo to security officers.
Camel thieves attacked and killed 7 herders and stole 300 camels in Tigi area, between El Sareif Beni Hussein and Kabkabiya localities.
The SPLM-N launched attacks on government positions in Khor Fatah Einak village in Kurmuk locality and at Salbel and Derang areas in Bau. Several soldiers and civilians were wounded in the clashes.
Looting: Government-backed militiamen ambushed and robbed 5 displaced people between Tado and Nierteti areas.
The SPLM-N launched attacks on government positions in Khor Fatah Einak village in Kurmuk locality and at Salbel and Derang areas in Bau. Several soldiers and civilians were wounded in the clashes.
Agreement: The integration of about 1.350 former JEM combatants into Sudanese military and police forces (a main provision of the Doha Document for Peace in Darfur) was launched in El Fasher.
Pro-government militiamen raped and beat two displaced girls at a farm in Mershing locality.

1 man was killed and 5 injured during a clash between camel thieves and a local rescue team from Tigi in Goz el Naeem, in norther El Sareif, following the killing of 7 herders in Tigi by camel thieves on Aug 24.
Abbala militia attacked Beni Hussein farmersin Hijeir Tigeiteeg, east of El Sareif town, killing 9.
Militiamen detained 13 displaced people, holding them as ransom after abducting them from Gumba area, near Mershing
1 child was killed and another wounded when a grenade they found exploded in Drankola, Sirba locality.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Recruitment: The SPLM-N reported that over the past few days, RSF (in coordination with NISS) has recruited more than 3,000 boys in the Nuba mountains and transferred them to military training camps.
Abbala tribesmen attacked and killed at least 5 Beni Hussein farmers in Hijeir Tigeiteeg area in El Sareif Beni Hussein locality.
Militiamen gang raped 5 displaced women working on farmland in Mulwaga area, west of Nierteti town.
Looting: Pro-government militiamen robbed 5 displaced people on their farmland in Mershing.
Abbala and Beni Hussein tribes clashed in Hijer Tigeiteeg and Um Madsees areas, El Sareif Beni Hussein locality, following the killing of Beni Hussein farmers by Abbala fighters
3 children were killed when a grenade they found exploded in Majura, Jebel Moon
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed 3 herders and stole 7 camels in East Jebel Marra, in El Dara, Kaja area
Janjaweed gunmen shot and injured a man in Nyala

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS arrested 16 women who were part of demonstration in front of Omdurman women's prison, demanding the release of the deputy chairman of the National Umma Party. Police dispersed the protest using tear gas.

Abbala and Beni Hussein tribes clashed for the second day in Hijer Tigeiteeg, Um Madsees and Jebel Dink Dinkat areas, El Sareif Beni Hussein locality. 34 people were killed and 20 others were wounded.
Militiamen attacked Labdo Yassin locality, killing 1 woman and injuring 3 others.
A local rescue team tracked down and clashed with armed men who had stolen 150 sheep from Labdo area (near Muhajiriya town). The clashes occurred in Sani Reel area.
Government-backed militiamen kidnapped and gang raped a secondary school student from her home in Kout area, Sirba locality
A rescue team that had clashed with armed men who had stolen 150 sheep from Labdo area were ambushed by government backed militiamen in Wadi Mirafura. 1 man was killed and 3 injured.
Abbala militiamen stormed Mileisa village, south of Wadi Bari in El Sareif Beni Hussein. Thye beat residents with whips, injuring 13, pillaged shops, burned homes, and stole 250 sheep and goats.
Looting: Abbala militiamen stole 50 horses and donkeys and robbed farmers in Markuba area and surrounding villages in El Sareif Beni Hussein
""Two guards on duty at an INGO health center were abducted by two armed men who broke in and also stole some property. The two guards were released the next day.""

Maaliya demonstrators took to the street in Abu Karinka, Adila, Sharef, and El Mazrob, protesting against the formation of the new East Darfur State government and demanding the abolition of East Darfur and calling for areas inhabited by the Maaliya to be incorporated into North Darfur

Maaliya demonstrators took to the street in Abu Karinka, Adila, Sharef, and El Mazrob, protesting against the formation of the new East Darfur State government and demanding the abolition of East Darfur and calling for areas inhabited by the Maaliya to be incorporated into North Darfur

column7: Sudanese Coalition of Women Politicians; Women (Sudan)
column17: Members of the Sudanese Coalition of Women Politicians went to the National Human Rights Commission in Khartoum to deliver a memorandum calling for the immediate release of detainees Samia Kiir and Maryam El Sadig El Mahdi, and demanded the right to visit them in the prisons of El Nahud, West Kordofan, and Omdurman
Two demobilised Beja Congress combatants attempted to commit suicide inside the Red Sea States government premises in Port Sudan, in protest over the governments negligence of their living conditions

Maaliya demonstrators took to the street in Abu Karinka, Adila, Sharef, and El Mazrob, protesting against the formation of the new East Darfur State government and demanding the abolition of East Darfur and calling for areas inhabited by the Maaliya to be incorporated into North Darfur
A group of gunmen raped 3 women who were tending farmland south of Danobo el Omda in East Jebel Marra.
Government-backed militiamen shot, killed, and decapitated a schoolteacher in Kutum, near Beri village.

Maaliya demonstrators took to the street in Abu Karinka, Adila, Sharef, and El Mazrob, protesting against the formation of the new East Darfur State government and demanding the abolition of East Darfur and calling for areas inhabited by the Maaliya to be incorporated into North Darfur
Abbala militiamen shot and killed a civilian in Amarjadeed area in El Sareif Beni Hussein
Militiamen shot and killed a resident of Hamidiya camp for the displaced at a home in Jawiri village, 30km east of Zalingei
Militiamen raped 2 displaced women from El Salam camp, between Kabkabiya town and Shuba village
Janjaweed shot and injured a civilian in Ama Kasara area, north of Nyala

Maaliya demonstrators took to the street in Abu Karinka, Adila, Sharef, and El Mazrob for the second day, protesting against the formation of the new East Darfur State government and demanding the abolition of East Darfur and calling for areas inhabited by the Maaliya to be incorporated into North Darfur.

Maaliya demonstrators took to the street in Abu Karinka, Adila, Sharef, and El Mazrob for the second day, protesting against the formation of the new East Darfur State government and demanding the abolition of East Darfur and calling for areas inhabited by the Maaliya to be incorporated into North Darfur
Government-backed militia intercepted and detained 3 traders and killed their donkeys on the road between Souni village and Talba, north of Deribat

Maaliya demonstrators took to the street in Abu Karinka, Adila, Sharef, and El Mazrob for the second day, protesting against the formation of the new East Darfur State government and demanding the abolition of East Darfur and calling for areas inhabited by the Maaliya to be incorporated into North Darfur

Maaliya demonstrators took to the street in Abu Karinka, Adila, Sharef, and El Mazrob for the second day, protesting against the formation of the new East Darfur State government and demanding the abolition of East Darfur and calling for areas inhabited by the Maaliya to be incorporated into North Darfur
Janjaweed shot and injured a civilian in Girein area, Sirba locality, and stole 150 goats

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Recruitment: Justice and Equality Movement (JEM) rebels accused the Sudanese military of recruiting over 300 underage boys in the Nuba Mountains, in Dilling, Abu Kershola, and Abassiya, to serve in the RSF.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Movement of forces: The government deployed RSF militiamen to River Nile state to protect gold mines following an increase in insecurity in the area

Strike:Members of the Teachers' Union in East Darfur state in Ed Daein began an open-ended strike in protest over unpaid salaries, promotion raises, bonuses, transport and clothing allowances, and retirement dues

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Recruitment: Justice and Equality Movement (JEM) rebels accused the Sudanese military of recruiting over 300 underage boys in the Nuba Mountains, in Dilling, Abu Kershola, and Abassiya, to serve in the RSF.

Residents in Adila protested against the appointment of a new commissioner, and submitted a memorandum to representatives of the national security service, the police, and the army in Adila, demanding the return of the former commissioner
