Secondary students in Sennar state demonstrated against soaring prices of consumer goods and the lack of bread in the area. Police used tear gas and batons to disperse protests, and at least 3 protesters were taken to the hospital.
Militiamen raped a 14 year old girl in Sangar area, west of Kutum
A woman was killed when Sudanese Air Forces dropped 3 bombs on a nomad camp southwest of Kaja, East Jebel Marra.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: SLM-Wahid troops killed 7 soldiers and Abu Tira forces in Kakor area, Rokoro locality, and seized weapons and ammunition
Government forces raided Kalma camp for the displaced. 4 people, including 3 children, were wounded during the raid
Thousands of displaced demonstrated in Kalma camp, protesting over repeated camp raids by government forces

column7: NUP: National Umma Party; Ansar Movement
column17: A group of National Umma Party and Islamic Ansar movement leaders demonstrated in Kosti, While Nile state, and handed a memorandum to the NISS, calling for the release of detained politicians

2 to 4 people were killed and many more injured when government forces opened fire on residents of Kalma camp for the displaced. 4 others later died of injuries. Some reports state that the attack took place during a military raid (the government accused SLM-Wahid forces responsibility), while other sources reported that the military opened fire on protesters demonstrating for the second day over repeated camp raids by government forces.
Following the killing of residents during a government raid on Kalma camp, camp residents rioted and destroyed headlamps at the UNAMID police building

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Displaced residents gathered near Bielel market in protest over government attacks. Government forces attacked the protesters following demonstrations in Kalma camp for the displaced, using tear gas and bullets to disperse market visitors. Some casualties were reported. 8 Kalma camp residents were taken during the market attack.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Abu Tira elements raped 4 women in Hillet El Doma, near Shangil Tobaya
Tens of thousands of residents of Kalma camp protested for the third day over repeated raids by government forces and detention of camp leaders and activists
Militiamen opened fire on military forces who were deployed following the rape of 4 women in Kubri Mesko area near Shangil Tobaya. 5 soldiers were injured.
Janjaweed elements shot and killed a teacher in Gireida locality, near Hashaba village
Militiamen raped 4 women in Kubri Mesko area near Shangil Tobaya.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLM-Wahid claimed to have killed 17 soldiers during an attack on a military base in Tibra, Waila locality. They also claimed to have seized the base. Residents of Tibra reported that the fighting took place between SLM-Wahid forces.

column7: SJN: Sudanese Journalists' Network; JAHR: Journalists' Association for Human Rights
column17: The Sudanese Journalists Network (SJN) and the Journalists Association for Human Rights (JAHR) boycotted the general elections of the General Federation of Sudanese Journalists in protest over fraud and corruption.
At least 2 people were killed and 2 wounded in El Radom locality, South Darfur, in a fight over cattle theft between residents and raiders
Janjaweed gunmen killed 3 people in their homes and wounded 2 others during an attack on El Himraya village in El Salam locality, South Darfur.
Government-backed militiamen attacked and robbed civilians in the area west of Kondobe, Sirba locality, West Darfur, beating people inside their homes.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Non-violent activity: NISS raided the Centre for Civil Society Development in Khartoum, confiscated all property, and closed the centre, the latest in a series of closures of pro-democracy civil society organisations.
Janjaweed militiamen intercepted a passenger lorry between El Fasher and Kabkabiya, in Abu Nabag area North Darfur. They seized the lorry and abducted the driver and a passenger.

column6: SLMJ-TH: Sudan Liberation Movement for Justice (Taher Hajar Faction)
column17: LMJ-Taher Hajar and SLM-Minawi attacked a military convoy in Jebel Hireiz area near Shangil Tobaya. Rebels reportedly killed 23 soldiers and captured 5 vehicles loaded with weapons and 3 fuel tankers.
Unidentified rebels attacked a police contingent escorting a convoy of South Darfuri pilgrims, in Um-Ziraiga area )on the way to El Fasher), North Darfur. 1 police officer was killed and 4 injured.
The imam of Ardamata New Site camp for the displaced in Sirba locality was killed by Janjaweed gunmen. The gunmen also stole livestock from the camp.
Government-backed militiamen beat and severely injured a displaced woman near Garsila camp when she resisted a rape attempt.
Militiamen abducted and raped a woman from Kondobe camp, Sirba locality.
Non-violent activity: Security forces surrounded Kalma camp in South Darfur. They detained 1 camp resident, the 10th resident detained since protests in the camp in early September.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Arrests: Security forces detained a leader of the National Consensus Forces, upon his return from Addis Ababa after a meeting with the Sudan Revolutionary Front.

Militiamen attacked Dobo El Jadida village in East Jebel Marra. They burned homes, raped young women and girls, and threw 4 children into burning homes. The 4 children burned to death. 3 elderly people were also killed.
Secondary school students demonstrated in El Fasher, in solidarity with their teachers who began a strike on Sept 7. Police fired into the air and used teargas to disperse protesters.

Militiamen attacked the villages of Landa, Abu Hamra, Seira Kandarawa in Jebel Tara area and in Tagali area and Magali hills, north of Shangil Tobaya. They assaulted and robbed residents and stole livestock.

Militiamen attacked the villages of Landa, Abu Hamra, Seira Kandarawa in Jebel Tara area and in Tagali area and Magali hills, north of Shangil Tobaya. They assaulted and robbed residents and stole livestock.

Police used tear gas and whips to disperse hundreds of people protesting against power cuts and water outages in al-Daim neighborhood in Khartoum. Protesters blocked the main street with burning tires and threw stones at police.

Militiamen attacked the villages of Landa, Abu Hamra, Seira Kandarawa in Jebel Tara area and in Tagali area and Magali hills, north of Shangil Tobaya. They assaulted and robbed residents and stole livestock.

In mid-September 2014, police detained 118 people of the Hausa tribe in Wad El Helew in response to a protest against the detention of one Hausa member. 91 were sentenced to jail terms and reportedly beaten and tortured by police before being released in February 2015.
In September 2014, police detained two men after a trader hit a Hausa man; when the trader was released and the Hausa man was kept in custody, Hausa people protested.
Suspected Abbala tribesmen hijacked 2 commercial vehicles in Saraf Umra locality, and beat and robbed passengers.

Hundreds of the demobilized soldiers of the Beja Conference [Congress] protested in front of their party headquarters in Port Sudan, demanding that their demobilisation and integration into armed forces be expedited, and demanding to be employed in the civil service or given alternative income generating means
Militiamen raped a displaced woman from El Batari-B camp in Kass locality.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Movement of forces: A large number of South Sudanese troops reportedly moved to the northern part of Blue Nile State, around Roseiris, heading towards Sennar State.

1 Fallata herder was killed and another wounded by unknown gunmen during a livestock raid in Jebel Garet, Wulu area, Blue Nile state. A Fallata tribal leader accused armed Nuer from South Sudan's SPLA-IO of responsibility for the attack. The SPLA-IO accused SPLA-North and Sudan Revolutionary Forces of responsibility.

Agreement: Farmers and nomads from El Fasher, Kutum, and Tawila, and the area of El Waha in North Darfur signed a ""Peaceful Coexistence and Restoration of the Social Fabric"" agreement, to end attacks on villages and caravans
Looting: Government-backed militiamen pillaged shops in Nierteti market and fired into the air.
Agreement: 1,900 SPLM-N fighters have returned from South Sudan and surrendered to South Kordofan state authorities.
Pro-government militiamen attacked and injured a displaced man in Girni area, Nierteti.
Pro-government militiamen raped 2 displaced women in Wadi Ora, north of Kabkabiya
Militiamen raped 3 displaced women near __Fula, north of Shangil Tobaya
Army personnel burned a commercial market in Beer Yassin (60km W of El Daein), in protest over the killing of a soldier by an unknown gunman.

Unidentified militiamen abducted a nurse and his family members in Birkat Seira, Saraf Umra, claiming that a militia member died after the nurse gave him an injection and demanding 'blood money' from the nurse.
3 unidentified rebels were killed when Sudanese Air Force bombed the area near Keira

A gunman stormed a club in Bir Yassin (60km W of El Daein) where people had gathered to watch a football match. He fired at an army soldier, and killed him instantly. Gunmen also torched shops and other buildings in Bir Yassin market.
1 boy was killed when Sudanese Air Force bombed Dadi area
Pro-government militiamen abducted 3 displaced men in Kijunga area, north of Kabkabiya
3 farmers were killed by a rocket-propelled grenade fired by government forces near Deribat, East Jebel Marra. Government forces likely thought the farmers were rebel forces.
Traders at Aniet market in Abyei closed their shops early to protest an increase in taxes.
5 armed Janjaweed wearing military uniforms stormed farmlands around Kaja on camelback, seized 2 women and raped them.
A displaced woman from Sibak El Kheil camp in Kebkabiya was attacked and raped by 2 gunmen in Wadi Weloul.

A group of 30 NCP members travelling to Nyala was ambushed by 14 unknown gunmen on horseback who fired on them, killing one NCP member riding in a vehicle. 2 guards shot back and the vehicles managed to escape.

Maaliya tribesmen have decided to boycott East Darfur state institutions to protest against continuous attacks by Rizeigat militants they say the state and national governments have done nothing to stop. This includes eight government officials and twelve members of the state legislative assembly resigning from their posts.
A civilian was killed by militiamen in an attack on the village of Gulnageisa in the Sirba locality. Ten cows and horses were also stolen.
An Antonov was seen bombing the areas around Torbua and Dibba Naira in East Jebbel Marra, killing about 75 camels and cows.
Gunmen raided a market in Burma in South Darfur, whipping a sheikh when he tried to defend the women shopping there.
7 women were raped by Janjaweed in East Jebbel Marra, 4 near Kuku and 3 on their farmlands near Shangil Tobaya.
An Antonov was seen bombing the area around Landa village near Shangil Tobaya. The bombing killed an unknown number of livestock.
Hundreds of Khartoum hospital workers demonstrated to demand payment of salaries and other financial entitlements. They also blocked the main street of the capital for half an hour.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Arrests: The NISS has engaged in mass arrests of at least 50 political activists in order to prevent commemoration of the Sept.2013 democracy protests.
5 pro-government militia elements attacked 2 men in Tawila, killing 1, wounding the other and stealing 100 cows.
At least 2 herders from the Fellata tribe were killed and about 7,000 sheep stolen after a raid by SPLA-N soldiers on a cattle camp near the Agedi and Jigo areas of Blue Nile state.

column9: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Police and security services broke up several small protests around Khartoum. In one case protesters burned tires on the main road in the neighbourhood of Aburof.
Agreement: The Hamar and Maalia tribes have signed a reconciliation agreement in the state capital of al-Foula following two years of bloody clashes after the discovery of oil in the region.
The Sudanese air force bombed the area east of Mashrou Abu Zeid in East Jebel Marra, destroying large amounts of crops. No casualties were reported.
5 Janjaweed and 1 herder were killed and 3 people wounded in a clash between a group of Janjaweed cattle thieves and a local rescue team after the Janjaweed raided a pasture near Shangil Tobayi.
An Antonov aircraft dropped 4 bombs on Aura and 2 bombs on Bangaro villages in Yabus, destroying crops and farmland.
A Sudanese journalist was allegedly tortured and beaten for two days of his detention between Sept.25 and Oct.1 after being picked up during protests ahead of the anniversary of the 2013 movement.
A Spanish diplomat was found stabbed to death in his home in Khartoum.
5 militiamen wearing military uniforms assaulted 2 young girls attending their farms. 1 man was killed when he tried to defend the women.

14 Rizeigat and Fellata tribesmen were wounded after a fight broke out as a Fellata tribe tried to cross Rizeigat land. 8 Fellata and 6 Rizeigat were seriously wounded after the fighting involving batons, knives, axes and swords. Both sides are reported to be gathering fighters in the area following the clash.

Police beat and arrested a number of youths from El Hafab after they tried to change the flow of a nearby canal to prevent the flooding of their village. Police also fired tear gas. The village had its electricity cut and a curfew imposed following the raid.

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Young activists protested in front of the offices of the NISS over lack of basic services. Many were subsequently detained by the NISS.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: 4 South Sudanese traveling to Kosti and Rebak in Sudan were arrested and badly tortured by the NISS.
Local citizens organized protests demanding the release of young activists detained by the NISS.

2 groups of gunmen on horses and camels (40 total) raided the area near Labado in Yassin locality, stealing a large amount of livestock. A rescue team was formed, and in the ensuing fighting 2 people were killed and 2 more were injured.
Farmers in villages in the El Salam locality have complained of attacks by herdsmen and the release of livestock onto their farmlands, destroying their crops.

column6: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Recruitment: South Sudanese rebels have allegedly been engaging in forcible conscription of South Sudanese farmers working in the Blue Nile state, specifically around Tadamoun locality.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Rebels of the SLM-AW claimed to have killed 16 government troops in an attack on the military garrison of Guldo, and to have captured weapons, ammunition and supplies, before military troops torched the garrison and retreated to Nierteti town.

column9: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Prison Guards
column17: Gunmen driving a land cruiser attacked policemen guarding a convict from Kassala prison on his way to a hospital in Kassala. They then fled with the prisoner.
2 women on their way to Faluja village in East Jebel Marra were robbed, assaulted and raped by Janjaweed on camels, armed and wearing military uniforms.
A young farmer was seriously injured by armed herders in Nierteti locality. He was beaten and stabbed on his farmlands near Kebe.
Gunmen abducted 2 Sudanese engineers traveling from Ed Daein to Khartoum on the Abu Sufyan-El Fado road and seized their vehicle.
Residents of Abu Jubaiha organized a sit-in to demand the release of young activists detained by NISS agents last Thursday.

Police forces violently evicted about 70 female Darfuri students at 2:00am, detained dozens. The students had been demanding better/safer accommodations after being offered alternative housing at already over-crowded boarding houses. They were assaulted, and allegedly targeted for being from Darfur.
2 women from Erli, near Kas, were assaulted and raped by armed Janjaweed who arrived on camel/horeseback. They were later taken to hospital in serious condition.
2 Rizeigat were killed outside the Labado camp for the displaced, leading to deployment of police to catch the killers and prevent revenge attacks.
Clashes broke out between Rizeigat and a Maaaliya livestock rescue team

Unidentified gunmen stormed the office of the medical director of the Bindisi camp hospital and demanded medicines. They then locked the director in a hospital room and started shooting into the air, causing staff to evacuate the hospital.
A young women was raped by militiamen near Wadi Ayour in Zalingei locality.
Militiamen riding on motorcycles kidnapped a person in El Safa neighbourhood, and then fired into the air as they drove away, panicking residents.
Pro-government militia elements stabbed a policeman with a knife before shooting and killing him. They then robbed him.
In the area of Kalajo, a local rescue team clashed with a group of gunmen that stole a herd of camels. 2 people were killed and 7 others injured.
1 man was stabbed to death and another seriously wounded in a fight with Sudanese armed forces.

Militias stopped and searched a train which was rumoured to be transporting large quantities of arms and ammunition for Maaliya tribesmen in Ed Daein. While it was stooped the militiamen beat the commander of the second garrison of El Daein and his bodyguards when they tried to stop them from boarding the train. The armed men also looted several shops in the area.

column9: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
column17: Reporting suggests several are dead and about two dozen wounded after Rizeigat tribesmen attacked a camp of South Sudanese said to be loyal to Riek Machar in East Darfur, in the Bagaya area of Bahr al-Arab locality.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS agents detained a resident of Northern Nierteti camp and proceeded to beat and torture him, accusing him of being affiliated with ""the rebel movement"". He was seriously injured and taken to hospital for treatment.
5 people were killed and 7 wounded when unidentified militiamen attacked a commercial convoy using Dushka machine guns mounted on land crusiers near Mellit.
An army officer was assaulted by an angry crowd after he tried to convince them to allow the departure of a train that they had blocked at the station.
""Hundreds of people fled their homes in Abu Dungul, when the village was attacked after a clash between Rizeigat and Maaliya tribesmen."" The village was plundered and burnt.
Unidentified gunmen killed 4 Sudanese soldiers and wounded 7 others. A Lt. Col. was among those killed.
""A tribesman was killed, and others injured in a fierce clash between Rizeigat and Maaliya in the area of Abu Dungul in Sheiria locality""

Unidentified gunmen attacked a farmer near Nyala, injuring him, then proceeded to beat him up and kill his donkey. Nearby farmers rushed to his help, clashing with the assailants, and killing one of the gunmen. Another was wounded and taken to Nyala hospital.
About 13 pro-government militia in a land cruiser attacked Hassahissa camp resident and leader Saeed Yagoub Abdelshafi, seized him at gunpoint, and took him in the direction of Jebel Bum.
Sudanese army soldiers shot a woman dead after she resisted their attempts to rape her.
3 Janjaweed on camels assaulted and raped a young woman from Kalma camp in Nyala locality, seriously injuring her.
Dozens of Sudanese journalists took part in a demonstration in front of the National Council for Press and Publications to protest the indefinite suspension of al-Saiha daily newspaper.
7 government-backed militia shot a farmer while he was working. They then took his money and belongings and left.
An allegedly drunken army soldier fired at the El Riyadh camp, seriously injuring a man and a woman, who were transferred to El Geneina hospital for treatment.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: 8 government and militia troops were killed and several wounded in an attack by SLM-AW rebels on the military area of El Zubeir near Nierteti. Weapons, ammunition and other supplies were seized. 3 rebel fighters were killed and 6 wounded.
5 children were killed and 2 injured when an Antonov dropped 3 bombs on a crowded market and another about 200 feet away, hitting a nearby home.
7 Janjaweed on camels wearing military uniforms assaulted and raped 3 women of the ""Rwanda camp"" while they were tending to their farmland west of Tawila.
A coalition of Sudanese activists protested at the Sudanese Human Rights Commission in Khartoum to demand the release of 30 Darfuri students detained after a raid on a female dormitory in September.
Strike:Medical staff in the Lagawa locality have gone on strike over low wages and worsening health conditions of local residents.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Rebel forces claim to have killed 21 government troops and pro-government militia and wounded a number of others, during an attack east of Rokoro. 3 rebels were killed and 3 others wounded.

column6: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: 3 Ethiopian UNAMID peacekeepers were killed and 4 others abducted in the Korma locality near the Shoba Basic School. 2 were shot and killed instantly, 1 was wounded and died later, and the vehicle along with 4 other peacekeepers were seized during the attack.

column16: Sudan Tribune; Sudan News Agency; Radio Tamazuj
column17: On 16 October 2014, an unknown armed group abducted a Chinese oil engineer in the vicinty of Baleela oil field, and killed a Sudanese engineer (West Kordofan state).

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Following the killing of a paramilitary Border Guard member under unreported circumstances in Dereig camp, members of the Border Guards came to the camp and threatened to torch it if they weren't paid blood money. The resolution of the situation was not reported.
The Sudanese Air Force bombed the area around Rokoro, killing 2 women and destroying 3 wells.
The Sudanese Air Force dropped 12 bombs on Burgo and Karko in East Jebel Marra, killing more than 27 animals.

Elements of a pro-government militia opened fire on a mother and her sons, killing the mother and one of her sons instantly. The 2nd son managed to seize the gun of an assailant and bring him to the police with the help of others.

When residents of the Deleig camp for IDPs heard a man who had murdered an IDP woman and her son earlier was going to be released, they stormed the police station and killed the gunman, and wounded a police officer. An IDP woman was wounded as well.

A man was killed during heavy aerial bombardment of the areas of Orschi and Ebeiha in Umm Baru locality. Orschi was hit by 7 bombs, the neighbouring village of Ini hit by 4 bombs, Hamra village by 2, and Dar Darkoi village by 7. The well in Ebeiha was destroyed by a bomb.
A Sudanese oil engineer was killed and his driver wounded near Zarda Hadid oil field when unidentified armed men shot at them and stole their car.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Heavily armed military and security forces surrounding the Border Guards paramilitary group in El Ziyadiya district of Al Fasher. Residents were terrified, but a committee of Ziyadiya tribal leaders intervened to defuse the situation. As the Border Guards were leaving, they were attacked by government forces. Both sides used heavy artillery during the fighting. Casualties were not reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Military Intelligence Service
column17: A shop owner in Nierteti was beaten and arrested by agents of the Military Intelligence Service.
2 young women were assaulted and raped by gunmen in the area of Bala near Nierteti.

More than 22 women of the Garsila camp sustained various injuries, some serious, when a group of Janjaweed on camels, horses and motorcycles attacked them. They used whips and rifle butts to beat them.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: 2 government soldiers were killed and 2 wounded in an attack on the military area of Um Maraheik by the Border Guards paramilitary force. The group was expelled from El Ziyadiya district of Al Fasher after a confrontation with the military on Monday.

The Sudanese air force bombed the area of Anka for six hours, focusing particularly on Hillet Nurein, Hilet Hamed Deli, and Amar Jadid. Hundreds of villagers were forced to flee, large numbers of livestock were killed, and large areas of farmland/pastures burned. Casualties were not reported ""as people fled in all directions.""
A farmer was killed by ""militant herders"" on his farmland near El Zubeir, east of Nierteti.
A displaced man was shot dead and 2 others injured in an attack by pro-government militia on their farmlands close to Gireida.
Security forces have freed the Chinese oil worker taken hostage last week. In the same operations, they also captured the alleged killers of a Sudanese engineer killed last week near Balila.
Unidentified gunmen killed 1 and seriously injured another on an attack on a nomadic settlement in the are of Dalwa in East Jebbel Marra. The inhabitants fled and the gunmen stole 18 cows.

""Government-backed militiamen on camels ambushed a vehicle belonging to the National Electoral Commission that was on its way from Nyala to Buram."" The Janjaweed killed 3 people, two employed by the electoral commission and one soldier. Other passengers were wounded.
Militiamen attacked the police station to try and spring their comrades but were repelled by the police and the gunmen fled. No casualties were reported.
A displaced man from Ronga Tas camp for IDPs was abducted by 12 gunmen on motorcycles. They later demanded a ransom.
The SPLA-N has claimed that the Sudanese air force dropped 7 bombs on Karkarai village in the Um Dorain area, wounding 2 civilians and damaging properties and farms.
3 militiamen attacked and raped a girl while she was tending to her farmland in the area of Boruru, east of Nierteti.
About 100 Sudanese journalists protested in front of the National Press and Publications Council to show solidarity with a journalist detained by security officers last week.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Border Guards fighters took revenge for an attack the day before by attacking government forces. They killed an agent of the security service and wounded 2 policemen.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire on two Kalma camp residents, injuring both seriously. A young woman was also beaten.
A group of Janjaweed assaulted more than 20 IDPs near their farms in the area of Liwi, east of Tawila.
Janjaweed gunmen seriously injured two men in Gurnei near Nierteti North camp.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Government forces tracked Border Guards members who had kidnapped a Salamat tribal leader. They then attacked them, killing 2, wounding 4 and seized their land cruiser.
A girl was killed when the Sudanese air force dropped bombs in the area of Wadi Murra. A large number of livestock were killed and farmlands/pastures destroyed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Border Guards members kidnapped a Salamat tribal leader at the Hamidiya bus station in Zalingei.
Dozens of Nubians gathered in front of the Ministry of Justice in Khartoum in protest against the detention of Nubian activist Rashed Sheikheldin.
A group of militiamen wearing military uniforms and riding on camels assaulted a group of elderly women and raped a younger girl accompanying them.
3 Sudanese soldiers raped 2 women, leaving them seriously injured.
A villager was founded beheaded near Gereida. His donkey cart was also stolen.
The SAF dropped 8 bombs, killing 1 elderly woman and destroying farms.
Arrests: The government has been accused of carrying out a campaign of mass arrests of Communist party members in Damazin, following the arrest of 2 senior members last week.
1 farmer was killed and other injured in a bombardment of the villages of Khor Mali and Mashrou Abu Zeid in East Jebel marra. Large tracts of farmlands were also destroyed.

column6: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: 4 landcruisers full of pro-government militia attacked a UNAMID force protecting a water tanker. 2 South African UNAMID members (peacekeeper/driver) were seriously injured. The militiamen also injured a young boy with a stray bullet as they left.
Around 5:30pm, a fighter jet raided the areas west of Dolma and west of Sabi in East Jebbel Marra. One bomb hit the settlement of Dolma, killing 5 people from the same family.

""A demonstration carried out by the unions of health and medical professions at the Khartoum Teaching Hospital was violently dispersed by the police"" using batons and tear gas. About 12 of the demonstrators at the sit-in were injured.
Pro-government militia killed a 19-year old displaced woman in Birsal in the Sirba area after they tried to rape her and she defend herself.
Around 7-8am, a Sukhoi jet dropped 27 bombs on the area of Bir Sauda, west of Dolma, and the area of Khor Mali in East Jebbel Marra. 75 livestock were killed and large tracts of farmlands destroyed.

On October 30 and November 1st, Sudanese troops carried out house-to-house searches of Tabit. During these searches they separated the men of the village from the women and children. They beat, some severely, and humiliated the men and raped many women and girls, at least 200 in total, while also looting property. A Sudanese army commander admitted his troops engaged in the abuses, and Huamn Rights Watch released a report detailing the incident. Some residents of the town also participated in the abuses alongside the soldiers.
Strike: South Darfur doctors in Nyala have gone on strike to protest the deteriorating security situation and lack of protection for the hospital.
Government forces shelled the town of Deribat, killing 3 women and injuring 2 babies.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SPLM-N (Abdel Wahid) forces claimed to have killed 37 government forces and militia during an attack on the Moro military base near Deribat. 2 rebel troops were killed and 5 injured. They also claim to have seized the base, as well as the weapons, ammunitions and other supplies there.

Over the course of 36 hours (night of Oct.30 to morning of Nov.1), Sudanese troops carried out house-to-house searches of Tabit either to look for a soldier they believed had been abducted or because they had been given information about rebel supporters in the town. During these searches they separated the men of the village from the women and children. They beat, some severely, and humiliated the men and raped many women and girls, at least 200 in total, while also looting property. A Sudanese army commander admitted his troops engaged in the abuses, and human rights watch released a report detailing the incident. Some residents of the town also participated in the abuses alongside the soldiers.

On October 30 and November 1st, Sudanese troops carried out house-to-house searches of Tabit. During these searches they separated the men of the village from the women and children. They beat, some severely, and humiliated the men and raped many women and girls, at least 200 in total, while also looting property. A Sudanese army commander admitted his troops engaged in the abuses, and Huamn Rights Watch released a report detailing the incident. Some residents of the town also participated in the abuses alongside the soldiers.

column7: SAMA: Sudanese American Medical Association; Health Workers (Sudan)
column17: Strike:Health workers of the SAMA in Zalingei have declared a 3 day strike to protest against low salaries.
The SAF dropped 7 bombs near Valuga in East Jebel Marra, killing many livestock and causing residents to flee to the mountains and neighbouring valleys.
Unidentified gunmen killed 1 engineer and seriously injured 2 others working on constructing villages for the displaced during an attack near Gokar, south of El Geneina.
The opposition parties of the NCF boycotted the dialogue meeting which occurred on Sunday, and have announced they will boycott next years elections if the political climate does not improve.
2 young women from Nierteti were seized by a group of 4 militiamen and raped.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: 5 members of the RSF beat a bus driver until he lost consciousness in Yathrib district when he refused to transport them if they would not pay the price.

At least 7 civilians were injured during a heavy artillery bombardment of the area of Deribat in East Jebel Marra, northwest of Nyala by government forces which lasted from Oct.4-5. Markets and a school were destroyed, along with farmlands.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: A spokesman of the SPLA-Wahid faction said that after the bombardment of Deribat, Krow had come under the control of his faction.

At least 7 civilians were injured during a heavy artillery bombardment of the area of Deribat in East Jebel Marra, northwest of Nyala by government forces which lasted from Oct.4-5. Markets and a school were destroyed, along with farmlands.
Medical staff at the Kadugli Hospital have resigned en masse in protest against non-payment of arrears.
A young displaced woman was abducted by pro-government militiamen, taken to the Arafa area and raped. She was later found and taken to hospital.
3 farmers were killed by militant herders.
A sword-wielding man attacked two guards at the Sudanese presidential palace. He stabbed one guard, took his gun, and shot him and another before being shot and killed by other guards.
A mother was shot dead when she tried to prevent cattle from grazing on her farm. Her son was also injured in the attack. A young boy was also shot by militant herders.

Heavily armed security forces beat a number of people with ""crutches"" and electric batons, used tear gas, and shot at least one person while removing people from their houses in the Soba district. 38 people were also arrested.
3 people were killed and a number injured during a bombing raid by Antonov planes in Blue Nile state.
4 civilians were abducted in Tawila market by Rizaygat militiamen. Government troops attempted to pursue the militiamen but were not able to catch them.
The SAF allegedly conducted bombing raids on various areas in the locality of Heiban between Nov.11-13. 1 woman was killed and another injured. Farmlands and houses were also destroyed.
Strike:Darfuri students at the University of Bahri have gone on strike to protest against not being exempt from paying tuition fees.

Sudanese security forces arrested 26 men in Tabit to try to discover who informed Radio Dabanga and Al Arabiya TV about the alleged rape of 200 women in the village. The men were beaten and whipped while detained.
Dozens of Nubian protesters gathered in front of the Sudanese parliament buildings to demand the release of the chairman of the Nubian Youth Comittee.

""Two UN-contracted drivers (including seven loaders) were kidnapped while transporting food and relief items; the two trucks were also taken. UPDATE: The seven loaders were released the next day, the two drivers were released on 18 November 2014, and the trucks have been recoverd.""
The SAF allegedly conducted bombing raids on various areas in the locality of Heiban between Nov.11-13. 1 woman was killed and another injured. Farmlands and houses were also destroyed.

column6: JEM-Sudan: Justice and Equality Movement (Sudan Faction)
column7: JEM-PF: Justice and Equality Movement (Peace Faction); SLM/A-MWF: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Mother Wing Faction); SLM/A-Terab: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Mustafa Terab Faction)
column8: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
column17: Agreement: 500 ex-combatants from JEM-Sudan, SLA-Mustafa Terab, SLA-Mother Wing, and JEM-Peace Wing have officially begun the demobilization process with the Sudan Disarmament, Demobilisation and Reintegration Commission (SDDRC).
""Pro-government militiamen shot dead two people in Nierteti locality, Central Darfur"" and 7 people were abducted. One woman was released after militiamen raped her.
Youth in El Meram in West Kordofan have protested for 2 consecutive days to demand an end to the ban on motorcycles in te city.
The SAF allegedly conducted bombing raids on various areas in the locality of Heiban between Nov.11-13. 1 woman was killed and another injured. Farmlands and houses were also destroyed.
The recent killing of 2 farmers and the abduction of 7 more led to protests by residents of Nierteti.

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week
Youth in El Meram in West Kordofan have protested for 2 consecutive days to demand an end to the ban on motorcycles in te city.
""A 45-year-old farmer in East Jebel Marra was slain by gunmen""
Arrests: Sudanese security agents have conducted mass arrests of traditional leaders after they complained about land sales in the area
19 Ethopian women detained and beaten by an unknown human trafficking group in Khartoum in November 2014. All released in April 2015.

A group of 24 women from Kalma camp were accosted by militiamen who assaulted and raped 4 of them. They also stole mobile phones and 4 donkeys from the group, and beat at least 10 of them before chasing them back to their camp.

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week
Ethnic militia killed 15 and wounded 11 in Menawashi area in Hamada in November 2014.

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week
2 people were injured during intensive bombing raids by the SAF on Karnoi locality, hitting the villages of Habila, Jeritawa and Andom. A water source at Dwanky was also destroyed.
The SAF dropped 3 bombs on the Deribat area, destroying farms and starting fires south of the city.
Security forces arrested 8 displaced people in the area of Saboun El Fagur east of Kass and allegedly whipped and tortured them.
Residents of Lagawa have begun a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services.
Pro-government militiamen shot and killed a young herder, then proceeded to rob him before fleeing the scene.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: More than 100 students were detained after a raid on the University of Bahri. NISS agents accompanied by NCP members attacked a group of students standing in solidarity with striking Darfuri students using sticks and metal bars, causing varous injuries. Most were released later, but 2 have continued to be held.

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week
SPLM-N forces attacked SAFs garrison in the town of Bok in central Blue Nile state and destroyed a four-wheel army vehicle
A bombing raid by the SAF on the Umm Baru locality destroyed a school, water sources, killed dozens of cattle, and hit pastures and farmlands.
On 19 November 2014, a ""local rescue team"" from Saiyah near Mellit tracked down PDF militants who had hijacked a vehicle. 3 PDF members were killed during the fight that followed.

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week
Displaced people living in the camps in Sirba locality have declared a boycott of Sudans national elections.
Pro-government militiamen burned the villages of Chawa and Tebeldiyat Timan on Friday. 2 seriously injured in the attacks.

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week

Residents of Tabit, alongside a number of officials of the Transitional Darfur Regional Authority, local officials and tribal leaders, engaged in a demonstration to condem the ""lies and deliberate distortion of women's honor"" in relation to Radio Dabangas reporting on the alleged rape of 200 women from the village.

A woman was killed by shelling in Tagali and Magali area, north of Shangil Tobaya, in East Jebel Marra on Saturday. When pro-govt troops did not find anyone in the areas and villages, they fired their heavy weapons towards the farms, killing Fatima Omar.

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week
One man was killed & 4 injured when pro-government militiamen attacked Bartokolo village south of the Nyala railway in South Darfur on Saturday

On Saturday, a group of herders burned Chawa village, a couple of kilometres east of Labado in East Darfur. The incident occurred in the backdrop of a conflict between pastoralists and farmers and has created tension in the area.
SPLM-N forces attacked SAFs garrison lying 30 km south of the state capital Damazin killing 4 soldiers
Unidentified gunmen shoot former commissioner Hussein Daoud Idriss inside his farm in the morning, accusing him of killing 280 people while he was commissioner.

column6: SLMJ-TH: Sudan Liberation Movement for Justice (Taher Hajar Faction)
column17: The Sudan Liberation Movement for Justice, led by Taher Hajar (LJM-TH) attacked the military base of Khazan Tunjur today (Sunday), killing 18 Sudanese forces. A local reported that the clash resulted in the deaths of 2 children.
Security forces reportedly detained Dardama (a health assistant at Sirba Hospital), beat and tortured him for about 7 hours before releasing him.

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week
In addition to the attack on El Kurmuk, the Sudanese Air Force also dropped bombs on Miyak (coded as Ad Damazin, capital of Blue Nile
In addition to the attack on El Kurmuk, the Sudanese Air Force also dropped bombs on Yabus
One child was killed, and three other children were injured when the Sudanese Air Force dropped 4 bombs in El Kurmuk locality, Blue Nile state, on Sunday.
In addition to the attack on El Kurmuk, the Sudanese Air Force also dropped bombs on Aura

156 people have been killed in several days of fighting between two clans in Sudans oil-rich West Kordofan region. The clashes started on Sunday over a land dispute between two sub-groups of the powerful Misseriya tribe in Al-Quwik area, and were still continuing on Friday. Earlier reports reported 133 fatalities; an updated Radio Tamazuj reports 156 fatalities - 129 occurring on Monday; rest split btwn remaining days.
In addition to the attack on El Kurmuk, the Sudanese Air Force also dropped bombs on Mofa
Pro-government militiamen shot and killed farmer Musa Adam Omar at Fasa area west of Abta in Central Darfur on Monday morning.
Two militiamen wearing military uniforms opened fire on a merchant as he was closing his shopat the extension of the Employees district of Zalingei, capital of Central Darfur.

156 people have been killed in several days of fighting between two clans in Sudans oil-rich West Kordofan region. The clashes started on Sunday over a land dispute between two sub-groups of the powerful Misseriya tribe in Al-Quwik area, and were still continuing on Friday. Earlier reports reported 133 fatalities; an updated Radio Tamazuj reports 156 fatalities - 129 occurring on Monday; rest split btwn remaining days.

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week

column16: Radio Dabanga; Sudan Tribune; South Sudan News Agency; AFP
column17: Gunmen on camels have killed 15 civilians and wounded 10 others in an attack in btwn the Hammadeh area and Manawashi, 80 kilometres (50 miles) north of the state capital Nyala. Survivors identified several attackers, pointing they belong to a rival tribe. No one has claimed responsibility. Most of the victims were imams and scholars.

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week

The clashes started on Sunday over a land dispute between two sub-groups of the powerful Misseriya tribe in Al-Quwik area, and were still continuing on Friday. Earlier reports reported 133 fatalities; an updated Radio Tamazuj reports 156 fatalities - 129 occurring on Monday; rest split btwn remaining days.
Strike: Doctors and workers at Sirba hospital in West Darfur have gone on strike in protest against the arrest and beating of health assistant Adam Ishag Dardama on Sunday
Thousands protest the killing of 15 civilians by unidentified ethnic militia on Nov 25 in Munwashi; specific date of protest not reported.

Residents of Lagawa continue a sit-in at Freedom Square to demand improvements to basic services. On Nov 21, Radio Tamazuj reported that the protest was entering its second week. According to Radio Tamazuj, the protest was still continuing on Friday Nov 28, entering its third week
12 bombs were dropped by an aircraft of the Sudanese Air Force around the villages of Dubbo al Madrassa and Turbo in East Jebel Marra on Wednesday
A pro-government militiamen shot dead an IDP in the Kass locality after a dispute over payment of fees.
A young student was abducted and 2 displaced women severely beaten by militiamen near Kutum.

156 people have been killed in several days of fighting between two clans in Sudans oil-rich West Kordofan region. The clashes started on Sunday over a land dispute between two sub-groups of the powerful Misseriya tribe in Al-Quwik area, and were still continuing on Friday. Earlier reports reported 133 fatalities; an updated Radio Tamazuj reports 156 fatalities - 129 occurring on Monday; rest split btwn remaining days.

The clashes started on Sunday over a land dispute between two sub-groups of the powerful Misseriya tribe in Al-Quwik area, and were still continuing on Friday. Earlier reports reported 133 fatalities; an updated Radio Tamazuj reports 156 fatalities - 129 occurring on Monday; rest split btwn remaining days.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Dozens were killed and wounded in clashes at the ""military camp"" of JEM-Sudan. Border Guards and Central Reserve Police troops led by Abu Tira stormed the camp. However, a JEM spokesman denies that their forces took part in the battle, stating their base is located elsewhere.
Large areas of farmland were destroyed in Dalami county, either deliberately burned by SAF personnel or as the result of aerial bombardment.

156 people have been killed in several days of fighting between two clans in Sudans oil-rich West Kordofan region. The clashes started on Sunday over a land dispute between two sub-groups of the powerful Misseriya tribe in Al-Quwik area, and were still continuing on Friday. Earlier reports reported 133 fatalities; an updated Radio Tamazuj reports 156 fatalities - 129 occurring on Monday; rest split btwn remaining days.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: 2 women were raped and 20 people sustained injuries (8 seriously) after an attack by around 50 RSF fighters on displaced people living on the outskirts of Omdurman.
3 militiamen assaulted and raped a displaced woman in the area of Kubri Wahid, south of Nierteti.
Non-violent activity: Pro-government militiamen fired bullets into the air for two continuous hours outside of the Hamidiya camp for IDPs.
Clashes reportedly took place between the SAF and SPLM-N in Kadugli and Buram localities. 1 SPLM-N soldier was killed and 22 others were injured.

A group of farmers attempted to stop herders animals from grazing on their farmlands. The herders then beat the farmers, about 8 women and their children, until a man tried to intervene and was shot dead.

Clashes reportedly took place between the SAF and SPLM-N in Kadugli and Buram localities. 1 SAF soldier was killed, and 22 others were injured in the fighting. Both sides blame the other for starting the violence.
The SAF bombed agricultural areas northeast of Jebel Marra causing no casualties. The aircraft were believed to be providing cover for a military convoy.
38 Christians were arrested during a vigil to prevent the seizure of their churches land.

An SAF spokesman said that their forces had repulsed an attack by the SPLM-N near Balanja and Atmur villages near Umm Durin and that around 50 SPLM-N soldiers were killed and a large quantity of equipment and vehicles seized. 4 SAF soldiers were also killed.
Pro-government militiamen raided Hamidiya, injuring two men.
A member of the national parliament representing Lagawa has joined the sit-in by local youths demanding better basic services.

Pro-government militiamen on camels attacked a group of displaced on their way back to Ronga Tas camp in Azum locality. They beat them and attacked them with whips, then robbed them at gunpoint. Militiamen also raided a displaced mans house nearby and shot him.
3 SAF soldiers were killed in a shootout with an unnamed group while patrolling around Kadugli.
2 people were killed and another 4 wounded when SAF soldiers allegedly opened fire on a public taxi in the Abassiya locality.

Militant herders armed by the government have attacked villages, including burning houses and stealing thousands of head of livestock, in the localities of Geneina and Kereinik between Dec.3-5. This is related to a dispute in which 2 herders were killed on Dec.3

At least 5 were killed (2 herders and 3 villager) and 5 injured during clashes between herders armed by the government and farmers. More than 20 houses were also burned and dozens of livestock stolen.

Militant herders armed by the government have attacked villages, including burning houses and stealing thousands of head of livestock, in the localities of Geneina and Kereinik between Dec.3-5. This is related to a dispute in which 2 herders were killed on Dec.3
Militiamen intercepted 7 women on their way to collect straw near Kabkabiya. They beat them with batons and whips, seriously injuring at least 3. Another woman in the same area was also assaulted.

Militant herders armed by the government have attacked villages, including burning houses and stealing thousands of head of livestock, in the localities of Geneina and Kereinik between Dec.3-5. This is related to a dispute in which 2 herders were killed on Dec.3
Government-backed militiamen shot dead a secondary schools student in the area of Jebel Amer.

Militant herders armed by the government have attacked villages, including burning houses and stealing thousands of head of livestock, in the localities of Geneina and Kereinik between Dec.3-5. This is related to a dispute in which 2 herders were killed on Dec.3

Militant herders armed by the government have attacked villages, including burning houses and stealing thousands of head of livestock, in the localities of Geneina and Kereinik between Dec.3-5. This is related to a dispute in which 2 herders were killed on Dec.3
Pro-government militia men raided Hamidiya, killing 2 and injuring at least 4 others in the market. They beat people and robbed them, and raided at least 10 houses. 2 men were also ""arrested"".

Militant herders armed by the government have attacked villages, including burning houses and stealing thousands of head of livestock, in the localities of Geneina and Kereinik between Dec.3-5. This is related to a dispute in which 2 herders were killed on Dec.3
A hospital guard was shot by militiamen at Nierteti hospital.
3 militiamen part of a group of militant herders armed by the government entered Hamidiya camp and shot at one of the IDPs there, injuring him severely.

Arrests: Farouq Abu Elsa (Head of National Consensus Forces), Dr Amin Mekki Madani (chairman of the Civil Society Initiative) and Farah El Agar (National Congress Party) were arrested after returning from Addis Ababa, where they signed the Sudan Appeal with the Sudan Revolutionary Front.
""Hasna Haroun Mohamed was seriously injured, when gunmen beat her excessively with their whips.""
""A passenger was shot dead and four others were wounded... in an attack by gunmen on a commercial vehicle""
3 women and a man were assaulted by Janjaweed on camels. One of the women managed to escape, while the man was severely beaten, and the two women were raped.

A group of gunmen assaulted a man and woman, seriously injuring the man with whips, before raping the woman who was several months pregnant. Both were taken to a hospital where it was found the foetus had died.
Two unidentified armed men raped a woman near Um Tirab village, west of El Geneina. She was later taken to hospital.

Property destruction: ""The market of Abu Hamra village burned to ashes... Ten militiamen, some of them wearing military uniforms, entered the Sunday market to shop. Angry farmers approached them, accusing them of releasing their livestock on their farmlands. The Janjaweed left the market around sunset, but returned in the evening, setting the entire market on fire.""
Militiamen shot one woman on her farmland, and shot a second woman after she resisted their attempts to rape her, near Nierteti. Both were seriously injured.

The SAF has announced that it repulsed attacks by the SPLM-N at a checkpoint west of Kadugli and near Balinja, southwest of Kadugli, however the SPLM-N accuses the government of attacking them at Balinja and Lofo in the same area. Both sides claim the other took huge losses (with the rebels claiming they captured vehicles and weapons). Fatalities were coded as a total of 20.
A child was killed by a stray bullet fired by militiamen near Nierteti town.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: The SLM-AW announced it has killed 23 soldiers and militiamen in an attack on a military convoy west of Rokoro. 8 rebel fighters were also killed.
The SPLM-N has shelled the outskirts of Kadugli, killing an elderly woman and wounding two others. Several houses were also burned down.

The SPLM-N captured a military outpost at Jebel Laku, capturing a guard and raising their flag. There was also reportedly significant fighting around Kadugli, with residents reporting machine gun fire, ""warplanes and sounds of explosions"".

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: SPLM-N fighters attacked a military convoy on the Kadugli-Delling road, killing 4 government troops and 1 RSF fighter.

Student activists campaigning for their elections were attacked by security forces who raided the Kassala University campus. They beat the student with batons, injuring a number of them. At least 5 were seriously injured.
Pro-government militiamen attacked and robbed the villages of Konjara, Um Burma and Kaima. They beat the villagers and robbed them of their livestock. Many have fled the villages.
Pro-government militiamen attacked and robbed the villages of Konjara, Um Burma and Kaima. They beat the villagers and robbed them of their livestock. Many have fled the villages.
Pro-government militiamen attacked and robbed the villages of Konjara, Um Burma and Kaima. They beat the villagers and robbed them of their livestock. Many have fled the villages.

SPLM-N fighters took control of the Daldako and Roseiris military garrisons located 12 km northeast of Kadugli, seizing a T-55 tank and a cannon, another T-55 was destroyed. In a simultaneous attack, they also seized the Jebel Nimir garrison 7 km west of Kadugli, seizing cannons and a variety of weapons.

Demonstrators protesting against the sale of land in El Shajara clashed with police after blocking the main street with burning tires. The police used tear gas and batons to disperse the protesters, leading to injuries on both sides

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: The SLM-AW announced it has killed 32 soldiers and allied militiamen in attacks on government forces in the Rokoro area. They also claim to have captured six vehicles and large amounts of weapons and ammunition, while destroying 5 others.

""Two Sudanese army troops from Golo military garrison raided the house of merchant Yousef Abakar... They told him to give them his money. When he refused, they shot him dead"" and fled with his money.
A militiaman attempted to rape a woman from Kolkul village in Zalingei locality, but her husband intervened and stopped him.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: An unidentified armed group ambushed two military vehicles belonging to UNAMID in the Ghrabshi area of the county of Nateega in South Darfur and stole their vehicles and weapons. No injuries were reported but gunfire did occur.

A new rebel group drawn from elements of the Sudan Liberation Movement called the Sudan Peoples Liberation Front (SPLF) announced they clashed with government soldiers, killing 6, while losing 3 of their own.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Continued fighting was reported near where the SLM-AW and SAF clashed the day before.

After an earlier battle with the SLM-AW, the SAF dropped bombs 17 bombs near the villages of Salo, Rawanga and Hillet Fabul, killing a large amount of livestock and destroying large areas of farmland. No casualties were reported.
Militiamen killed a displaced man in Kas locality. On the same day, a girl and her mother were also assaulted by militiamen in the same area.

100 militiamen on camels and horses attacked a village in the Abu Jadra area in the Gireida locality. 9 villagers were killed and the village was burnt down. At least 6 were wounded, while about 500 families took refuge in the Babausa camp in the Gireida locality and another 200 reportedly fled into the desert.
A group of militiamen on camels and horses attacked Kolkul in the Zalingei locality, raiding houses and kidnapping 9 people. 3 were later released after a ransom was paid.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: The SLM-AW announced it has killed 15 SAF soldiers, including 3 officers, near Tura, west of Rokoro in an attack on a military convoy. They also seized 7 jeeps, 3 larger vehicles, and a large amount of guns and ammunition.
A number of gold diggers were beaten with whips and batons and robbed by militiamen in the area of Jebel Amer.
Government-backed militiamen stormed Dalal Mustariha village, beating and whipping the residents before stealing their property/livestock and burning down more than 20 houses.
SAF bombed the Elbaro area of Umm Dorain in South Kordofan in December 2014, killing a child and injuring another three.

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS agents intercepted a planned protest in front of the Ministry of Justice by supporters of the NCF and other opposition movements. After a verbal confrontation with opposition leaders the protesters were dispersed peacefully.
Strike:Labour Union members went on strike to protest against the non-payment of their November salaries.
The SAF bombed the area northeast of Golo in the Rokerro locality, targetting the villages of Kormuk, Debbat Naira and Salo, and lemon plantations in the same area. Many houses were also destroyed.
In December, unidentified armed militiamen abducted 5 high school students in Nierteti locality in Central Darfur. The abductees were released for ransom on Jan. 12, 2015.
Hamar and Maaliya tribes clashed in Um Dibo area in Al-Garor locality in West Kordofan (coordinates for capital Al-Fulah used) in December 2014. Dozens killed, 27 injured.
Civil society organisations staged several protests for the release of political prisoners arrested on Dec. 6, after signing the Sudan Appeal in Addis Ababa.
2 IDPs were seriously injured in an attack by government-backed militiamen as they were looking for firewood.

""A group of Janjaweed on camels and horses, firing into the air, attacked the police post of Luwei village, north of Habila... They beat and whipped the policemen and people present... The head of the post, Hamza Adam, was seriously injured, and had to be taken to El Geneina Hospital for treatment.""
The SAF bombed the area above El Aradeib El Ashara, east of Funga in East Jebbel Marra, killing a number of livestock and starting fires.
A group of herders armed by the government killed a man who tried to stop them from grazing their animals on his farmlands. 2 others were seriously injured.

A group of militiamen attacked the Disa garrison in Kutum, killing a SAF soldier standing guard and seriously injuring another. The attack is believed to be in connection with the death of a herder weeks ago who was shot by a soldier.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: A member of the Central Reserve Forces (Abu Tira) was killed during a robber by ""pro-government militiamen"" during a robbery of commercial vehicles between Um Dukhun and Garsila.
An herder armed by the government killed a student when he attempted to stop the herder from allowing his animals to graze on farmland.
A young shepherd was killed by unexploded ordinance, allegedly left by a bombing run by the SAF the day before in the area of East Jebbel Marra.
2 children were killed by militiamen who stormed their families house at Kalam Basna village near Nierteti.
Students from the College of Engineering in Blue Nile University protested in the university plaza against the dismissal of three students from the college dormintory.
4 men sustained serious injuries during a road robbery by pro-government militiamen while they were on their way back to Nierteti from Marwa.
Students protested against a teachers strike that started a few days prior in the schools of Kendebe camp after militants attacked the teachers.
Militiamen assaulted and raped two young women in the Kereinik locality. They were seriously injured and taken to hospital.
The SPLA-N say they defeated an attack by the government near Daloka. 6 soldiers were allegedly killed and a tank was destroyed.
The SPLA-N and SAF clashed near Doluka, a town 8-km away from Kadugli.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Large numbers of RSF fighters and militiamen on camel-back have concentrated south of Tabit, leading to extensive displacement as people flee the area. They have also been assaulting and robbing people.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Members of the RSF attacked two villages near Tabit, wounding a number of people and then robbing them.
The SAF bombed Dadei village in East Jebel Marra, killing a number of livestock and burning farmlands and pastures.
The SAF bombed villages, killing 2 children and wounding at least 21 others.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: 3 Pakistani UNAMID peacekeepers were wounded in an attack by unidentified armed men. They attempted to steal the peacekeepers vehicle but were repulsed.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Non-violent activity: Members of the NISS raided the premises of the Sudanese Human Rights Monitor, seizing computers and documents. 1 journalist was also detained.
Strike:Doctor and medics in El Fasher have started a strike to protest against assaults by patients.
A group of 5 government-backed militiamen murdered a farmer in his farmland.
Militant herders shot dead a farmer in the area of Jedid El Seil, north of El Fasher.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Non-violent activity: The RSF have imposed a blockade on the region around East Jebbel Marra using more than 200 vehicles in order to stop residents from escaping to the Shadad and Naivasha camps for the displaced.
Militiamen on camel-back kidnapped 2 young shepherds and stole 200 sheep near Arasho in the East Jebbel Marra area. They also beat up and robbed a number of villagers in the area.
Agreement: 2,800 ex-rebels of the Liberation and Justice Movement have been integrated into the regular armed forces.
7 farmers were killed and 5 others wounded by militant herders near Jedid El Seil, north of El Fasher.
Lawyers held a sit-in in front of the Khartoum District Court. Police dispersed the protest, beating the lawyers and detaining 5 people.
Groups of militiamen assaulted and injured a number of residents of El Salam camp. Some residents were severely beaten when they attempted to gather firewood.

Security forces detained more than 30 students at Bahri University after dispersing a political gathering arranged by the Darfur Students Association, using batons, metal bars and tear gas. A number of students were injured. A large security presence remained at the university.
Militiamen attacked a commercial vehicle but the passengers fought back. 4 people were injured during the fight, and 3 of the militiamen were handed over to the police.
A large number of people protested in Al Fasher over the killings of farmers by militant herders in the surrounding communities.

On Dec 22, 2014, Sudanese lawyers organised a sit-in at Khartoums main court to protest the arrest of National Consensus Forces (NCF) leader Farouk Abu Issa, NCF dissident Farah Agar, and human rights defender Amin Mekki Madani, who were arrested on Dec. 6 for signing the Sudan Call in Addis Ababa. Anti-riot police unsuccessfully attempted to disperse the sit-in. 3 laywers arrested.

The SPLM-N says they have killed 25 SAF soldiers, including a first-lieutenant officer, and seized light and heavy weaponry, during an attack on Dalouka near Kadugli, and that the SAF has fled its camp in Tourlake, west of Kadugli.
Militia allied to the SAF opened fire on civilians in Abu-Jabiha, and continued on to Talodi. 1 person was killed and 4 students were injured.
Government-backed militia attacked a man and two women in the Tagali area near Shangil Tobaya. They assaulted the three and raped the two women. All three were taken to hospital in serious condition.
Hundreds of primary and secondary school students marched in solidarity with Lagawa residents protesting over lack of basic services.
2 young women from Kereinding camp were assaulted by militiamen. They managed to fight them off and escape with minor injuries.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: A number of villages in Tawila locality were ""pillaged and torched"" by the RSF, together with militiamen on camel-back. These include: Arasho, Sharafa, Tangarar, Abed, Wad Ali, Golma, Hillet, Massalit, and Jawa. Specific casualties were not reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: A number of villages in Tawila locality were ""pillaged and torched"" by the RSF, together with militiamen on camel-back. These include: Arasho, Sharafa, Tangarar, Abed, Wad Ali, Golma, Hillet, Massalit, and Jawa. Specific casualties were not reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: A number of villages in Tawila locality were ""pillaged and torched"" by the RSF, together with militiamen on camel-back. These include: Arasho, Sharafa, Tangarar, Abed, Wad Ali, Golma, Hillet, Massalit, and Jawa. Specific casualties were not reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Movement of forces: A large force of paramilitary RSF arrived in Kutum town
3 government-backed militiamen assaulted displaced workers with batons, causing minor injuries, near the water station of Zamzam camp.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Clashes between Sudanese army recruits believed to be affiliated with the RSF and residents of a village north of Khartoum have occurred between Dec.25-27. The Sudanese army announced one of its recruits had died on Friday.
3 displaced girls from Deleig camp were assaulted by government-backed militiamen. 2 escaped but one was captured and raped.
On 25 December 2014, a local rescue team made up of Zamzam camp residents and police chased down militiamen who had assaulted displaced workers, and captured two.
5 militiamen in a land cruiser stormed a bakery and beat a man working there, seriously injuring him.

Government forces raided Bahri University, supported by militant student members of the NCP. They ransacked a number of buildings and torched others, including the deans office, the library, secretariat of academic affairs and students offices, as well as four vehicles. They also beat students present.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Clashes between Sudanese army recruits believed to be affiliated with the RSF and residents of a village north of Khartoum have occurred between Dec.25-27. The Sudanese army announced one of its recruits had died on Friday.
Government-backed militiamen shot dead a villager and robbed a group of people in the same area.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF members assaulted and robbed two young men.
""A Misseriya member was killed in Abu Udam area, west of El Meram in West Kordofan.""

Dozens of students were injured and more than 100 detained during security raids on student dormitories on Dec.26 and 27. Darfuri students were reportedly targeted. The police beat people and burned down dormitories, returning the second night for those who stayed. Some were seriously injured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Clashes between Sudanese army recruits believed to be affiliated with the RSF and residents of a village north of Khartoum have occurred between Dec.25-27. The Sudanese army announced one of its recruits had died on Friday.
The recent killing of a Misseriya member in El Meram led to clashes in Abu Jabra during which 4 people were killed and 6 others injured.

Dozens of students were injured and more than 100 detained during security raids on student dormitories on Dec.26 and 27. Darfuri students were reportedly targeted. The police beat people and burned down dormitories, returning the second night for those who stayed. Some were seriously injured.
An SAF soldier was kidnapped from his house and killed by unidentified gunmen.
The SAF dropped 12 bombs near the village of Khor Mali, west of Tabit. No casualties were reported but fires were ignited in the area.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: The RSF ambushed a commercial convoy of three trucks in the Tawila locality, seizing 2 vehicles and kidnapping 60 passengers.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Agreement: 700 soldiers who defected from the Border Guards in October, along with their leader Lieutenant Musab, have returned to the government following an agreement to put aside their dispute.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: The SPLM-N and government forces, including the RSF, clashed near Dalouka, al-Atmoor and al Ruseiris.
The SAF bombed the areas near the villages of Dady, Khor Mali, Sabi and Fanaga in Tawila locality, killing 40 cows and igniting a number of fires.
Herders shot dead 2 farmers and wounded another person after the farmers tried to chase animals grazing on their farmlands away.
A women was killed and her daughter wounded when militiamen stormed their house and beat them after an attempted rape in Nierteti town.
Residents of the al-Geer neighborhood in Nyala protested the killing of 2 students by unidentified armed men.
2 students were killed in the al-Geer neighborhood of Nyala by unidentified gunmen after they robbed the students.

In two separate protests, hundreds of trained doctors staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Health in Khartoum, while employees of the Civil Aviation Authority staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Labour. Both were protesting against lack of pay.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Radio Dabanga reported that the RSF began their offensive in the Tawila locality, ""popularly known as East Jebel Marra"". They assaulted and beat villagers with batons and whips and pillaged the villages of Sharafa, Um Beji, Dolma, Diwa, Koto, Daly and Nemra, forcing people to flee and taking everything with them.
2 children were killed during a bombardment of Tabit locality by SAF Antonov bombers in the morning between 8am-12am.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Radio Dabanga has reported that the RSF, backed by militiamen on camels and the Sudanese Air Force, have begun ""cleansing"" villages and water resources in Tawila locality (East Jebel Marra), attempting to remove the population and implement a ""scorched earth policy"". Many of those displaced have also reported been beaten, assaulted and raped. These operations have centred on the Tawila locality but have extended to parts of Kutum, Hiller Hager, Massala, Kabkabiya, Funga Suk, and Saraf Umra localities. In Massala, Funga Suk, Golo and Bardani, the victims claimed the attackers were of ""Arab"" origin.

column16: Radio Dabanga; Sudan News Agency; AFP
column17: Government forces gained control over the area of Fanga, near Shangil Tobaya. A government spokesman said at least 50 rebels were killed and 50 vehicles were destroyed. The rebel Sudan Liberation Movement Minnawi denied that it had retreated however. The airforce was involved in bombing during the fighting.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Radio Dabanga has reported that the RSF, backed by militiamen on camels and the Sudanese Air Force, have begun ""cleansing"" villages and water resources in Tawila locality (East Jebel Marra), attempting to remove the population and implement a ""scorched earth policy"". Many of those displaced have also reported been beaten, assaulted and raped. These operations have centred on the Tawila locality but have extended to parts of Kutum, Hiller Hager, Massala, Kabkabiya, Funga Suk, and Saraf Umra localities. In Massala, Funga Suk, Golo and Bardani, the victims claimed the attackers were of ""Arab"" origin.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Radio Dabanga has reported that the RSF, backed by militiamen on camels and the Sudanese Air Force, have begun ""cleansing"" villages and water resources in Tawila locality (East Jebel Marra), attempting to remove the population and implement a ""scorched earth policy"". Many of those displaced have also reported been beaten, assaulted and raped. These operations have centred on the Tawila locality but have extended to parts of Kutum, Hiller Hager, Massala, Kabkabiya, Funga Suk, and Saraf Umra localities. In Massala, Funga Suk, Golo and Bardani, the victims claimed the attackers were of ""Arab"" origin.
Unidentified actors attack the civilian population in Sambat. Casualties, motivation not known.
A number of IDPs were wounded, 4 seriously, by government-back militiamen who beat them with their whips and rifle butts.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Radio Dabanga has reported that the RSF, backed by militiamen on camels and the Sudanese Air Force, have begun ""cleansing"" villages and water resources in Tawila locality (East Jebel Marra), attempting to remove the population and implement a ""scorched earth policy"". Many of those displaced have also reported been beaten, assaulted and raped. These operations have centred on the Tawila locality but have extended to parts of Kutum, Hiller Hager, Massala, Kabkabiya, Funga Suk, and Saraf Umra localities. In Massala, Funga Suk, Golo and Bardani, the victims claimed the attackers were of ""Arab"" origin.
The SAF bombed Tawila locality during an ongoing clash between rebels and RSF militiamen, killing at least 7 villagers and wounding others. Dozens of livestock were killed and wells were destroyed.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Fierce clashes were reported between ""joint rebel forces"" and the RSF in Tawila locality. Dozens (coded as 12) militiamen were reported dead and a number of vehicles were destroyed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Rapid Support Forces plunder farms in Dobo, South Darfur State kill four.
