9 women were killed by militiamen after they attempted to stop the militiamen from stealing the villages cows.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Radio Dabanga reports that RSF militiamen ""ravaged and pillaged"" villages in the area of Abu Zerega, south of El Fasher, between Jan.2-3. 11 herders and 5 women were reported missing and 3,700 villagers have fled towards Zamzam camp for IDPs. Several civilians killed over 2 days (5 coded for Jan 2, and 5 for Jan 3).
Government forces attack SLA forces in Fanga Suk. No fatalities or causalities.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF forces clash with SLA forces in Funga Suk, North Jabel Marra. No reported deaths, injury not known.
""A group of militiamen raided the market of Tawila"", but were prevented from ""plundering the market"" by army forces. 10,000 people fled the town and sought refuge at a nearby UNAMID base.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Radio Dabanga reports that RSF militiamen ""ravaged and pillaged"" villages in the area of Abu Zerega, south of El Fasher, between Jan.2-3. 11 herders and 5 women were reported missing and 3,700 villagers have fled towards Zamzam camp for IDPs. Several civilians killed over 2 days (5 coded for Jan 2, and 5 for Jan 3). UPDATED coordinates and fatalities, and separated dated.
SLA-MM forces attack a government position in Fanga Suk. No reported causalities.
A displaced man was killed and 2 others were injured when ""militia elements"" opened fire on a commercial vehicle in Wadi Tebreida, near Korma.
A farmer was killed and a herdsman wounded in a dispute over farmland.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF abducted a man from Kaila village near Doba El Omda, Jebel Marra. Reports that RSF raped 3 women at the Gando well in Doba El Omda, Jebel Marra.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Unidentified gunmen launched an attack on UNAMID peacekeepers at Habila. No reported causalities.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: The SAF, assisted by the RSF, shelled Angartu, near Kadugli, between Jan.6-8.
""Five armed men attacked a team of 8 UN contractors that were working on a demining project and hijacked their vehicle. The driver was kidnapped and found unharmed on 8th January.""

column9: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
column17: A Sudanese driver working for the UNISFA was kidnapped by unidentified armed men.
Government-backed militiamen stormed the village of Shagar Gei in Kutum locality, killing 6 people.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: 12 RSF militiamen assaulted and raped 4 women over two days, leaving them seriously injured.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Unidentified gunmen launched two attacks on UNAMID peacekeepers near their base at Khor Abeche. There were 15 attackers, 2 of whom were killed, while no peacekeepers were wounded. The attackers seized a water tanker and a vehicle.
The SAF launched new air raids on East Jebel Marra, dropping 7 bombs on the area north of Fanga, igniting several fires but causing no casualties.
Several SAF soldiers and 2 civilians were killed in an attack by the SPLM/N on SAF forces near a gold-mining camp close to Kadugli. 3 other civilians were also wounded.

3 guards were injured, one seriously, in a fight which erupted between the personal guards of the governor of West Darfur state. It was believed to be caused by difference of opinion over the implementation of the security arrangements of the Doha Document for Peace in Darfur (DDPD).
An unidentified armed group attacks civilians in Al Kuraynik, two injuries reported.
Sukhoi fighter jet bombs village of Abu Leila. One boy killed, two others injured.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: The SAF, assisted by the RSF, shelled Angartu, near Kadugli, between Jan.6-8.
10 people were killed and other injured in an attack by a large group of government militiamen in more than 60 vehicles and on camelback on Birdik, in Kutum locality. They then pillaged the village.
Cooking gas distributors protested over the launch of direct sales centres of cooking gas in the town.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: 12 RSF militiamen assaulted and raped 4 women over two days, leaving them seriously injured.
Government militiamen beat and robbed civilians in the area of Kutum.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: The SAF, assisted by the RSF, shelled Angartu, near Kadugli, between Jan.6-8.
Government militiamen surrounded the village of Haskanita, forced the men inside the town mosque, and assaulted and raped 6 girls. They then pillaged the town.

An unspecified number of people (coded as 1) were killed and injured on bombing raids targeting villages in the locality of Umm Baru. 3 villages were destroyed by the bombing and consequent fires, specifically in the area of Abu Leha.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Non-violent activity: RSF attack a civilian village at Pious, East Darfur. No causalities reported.

column16: Radio Tamazuj; Radio Dabanga; NMIA; Sudan Tribune
column17: An SPLM-N spokesman said that they killed 33 SAF soldiers and lost 2 SPLM-N fighters in clashes with government troops and RSF militiamen in Dalouka, El Geneziya, near Umm Durin, and Angarto, near Kadugli. 9 other SPLM-N fighters sustained injuries. They also allegedly seized large quantities of light and heavy weapons, including a T-72 tank and other vehicles and repulsed the attacks on El Geneziya and Dalouka. Additionally, The SPLM-N claims they destroyed a large convoy of paramilitary RSF forces at Angarto. Contradictory reports stated this happened either Jan.9 or Jan.10.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column16: Sudan Tribune; Radio Dabanga; NMIA; Radio Tamazuj
column17: An SPLM-N spokesman said that they killed 33 SAF soldiers and lost 2 SPLM-N fighters in clashes with government troops and RSF militiamen in Dalouka, El Geneziya, near Umm Durin, and Angarto, near Kadugli. 9 other SPLM-N fighters sustained injuries. They also allegedly seized large quantities of light and heavy weapons, including a T-72 tank and other vehicles and repulsed the attacks on El Geneziya and Dalouka. Additionally, The SPLM-N claims they destroyed a large convoy of paramilitary RSF forces at Angarto. Contradictory reports stated this happened either Jan.9 or Jan.10.

4 government forces were killed, including the contingents commander, during a clash in Khor Demer near El Damazin. 1 rebel fighter was injured. Rebels also captured large quantities of guns and ammunition, including heavy weapons.
SAF bomb Mendi near Kauda. 1 killed.
3 people were killed when unexploded ordinance detonated in East Jebel Marra (Tawila).
4 people were killed and thousands of cattle stolen by government militiamen.

column16: Radio Dabanga; NMIA; Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune
column17: An SPLM-N spokesman said that they killed 33 SAF soldiers and lost 2 SPLM-N fighters in clashes with government troops and RSF militiamen in Dalouka, El Geneziya, near Umm Durin, and Angarto, near Kadugli. 9 other SPLM-N fighters sustained injuries. They also allegedly seized large quantities of light and heavy weapons, including a T-72 tank and other vehicles and repulsed the attacks on El Geneziya and Dalouka. Additionally, The SPLM-N claims they destroyed a large convoy of paramilitary RSF forces at Angarto. Contradictory reports stated this happened either Jan.9 or Jan.10.
A young man was shot by SAF soldiers who stormed the shelter of his family in Deleig camp. He later died of his wounds.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF forces attack Dillow village, one civilian death.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Umgozeen, North Darfur. One death, two injury.

The SPLM-N has claimed the SAF bombed the area southwest of Kurmuk, killing 2 civilians and wounding 4 others, two seriously, between Jan.12-13. On Jan.13, the Shali area of Kurmuk was bombed specifically.

The SAF announced it had defeated SPM-Mannawi rebels in the Umm Baru and Karnoi localities, although this was strongly denied by the SLM-Mannawi, who stated they have no military presence, just small police posts, in the area and the announcement was made to boost SAF morale.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: The SAF claims they killed between 41-100 rebel fighters (coded as 41) and took control of Angartu, near Kadugli, during fighting over the weekend, with assistance from the RSF.
Several villagers in Konjara, in Tawila locality, were wounded by militiamen who beat them with whips.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: The RSF and other government militias stormed villages in the area north of Tabit. At least 1 person was killed and all the belonging of the villagers were stolen.

The SAF announced it had defeated SPM-Mannawi rebels in the Umm Baru and Karnoi localities, although this was strongly denied by the SLM-Mannawi, who stated they have no military presence, just small police posts, in the area and the announcement was made to boost SAF morale.

The SPLM-N has claimed the SAF bombed the area southwest of Kurmuk, killing 2 civilians and wounding 4 others, two seriously, between Jan.12-13. On Jan.13, the Shali area of Kurmuk was bombed specifically.

31 SLM-MM fighters, including the groups general commander of operations Mohamed Hari, were killed in an ambush by SAF soldiers in the Orshy area (coordinates unavailable) of North Darfur state. Armed Forces spokesman later confirmed that SAF had captured Orshy as SLM-MM withdrew from Abu Liha and Abu Gamra areas. UNAMID reports 39 deaths.

5 people from the Misseriya tribe were killed and 3 others injured in clashes with the Rizeigat tribe between Jan.13-14 in El Jaraf area, southwest of El Meiram town. The fighting was the continuation of a feud begun last week between the two tribes.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF troops in 7 land cruisers attacked Zamzam camp and pillaged it. They also attacked villages nearby the camp, killing 2 people and stealing livestock and the belongings of the villagers.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: 3 villagers were killed in attacks on villages near Al Fasher by RSF militiamen. A number of people were wounded, 10 were abducted, and large numbers of livestock were also stolen.
6 people were injured, 2 seriously, in a clash between gunmen who stole livestock and herders who attempted to retrieve them.

5 people from the Misseriya tribe were killed and 3 others injured in clashes with the Rizeigat tribe between Jan.13-14 in El Jaraf area, southwest of El Meiram town. The fighting was the continuation of a feud begun last week between the two tribes.
Unidentified gunmen abducted a man from his house in the village of Dignij west of Kas in South Darfur on Jan. 14.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF militiamen, supported by local militiamen on camels and horses, plundered the villages of Konjara North, Konjara South, Karfola and Jabayin, northeast of Tabit attacking villagers and forcing them to flee.
Pro-government militiamen attacked newly displaced people at the Argo camp for IDPs, and stole their livestock at gunpoint.

Assistant director of World Vision International was abducted from his home in Nyala on Jan. 14. Four gunmen in a Land Cruiser intercepted the assistant directors car at El Tadamon district, north of El Malaga Market, and seized him at gunpoint. He was released on Feb 5.
SPLM-N attacked government forces and took control of El Geneziya, near Umm Durin. Reported 100 soldiers and 15 rebels dead. 1500 soldiers retreated to Daldoka,.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF militiamen carried out raids on villages in the Umm Baru locality, forcing villagers to flee into the wilderness.
Recruitment: In January and February (dates not known) JEM forcefully recruited 55 children between 14 and 17 years of age. Location not known.
Janjaweed on camels assaulted Girgera village, at 7km west of Zamzam camp, where they killed two civilians and looted 30 camels, 240 sheep, 93 goats, 36 donkeys, and 4 horses.

column9: Health Workers (Sudan); MSF: Doctors Without Borders
column17: SAF bomb MSF hospital in Frandala. Several injured.
Misseriya and Rizaygat clash in Abu Zabra, East Darfur. Four deaths, two injured.
A displaced man was abducted by Janjaweed on camels at his farmland in Naivasha camp in Shangil Tobaya on Jan. 15.
One boy injured by playing with an unexploded ordance.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: 3 villagers were ""executed by a firing squad"" of RSF militiamen in East Jebel Marra (Tawila). Thousands of displaced were also recorded leaving the area.
A three-year old was taken by gunmen from his home in El Salam district in Nyala on Jan. 15.
SAF bomb Karkaia. 1 killed.
Janjaweed attacked Donkey Sharafah village, 20km west of El Fasher.
Police blocked protesters organized by religious groups who attempted to march on the French embassy to demand an apology for the Charlie Hebdo cartoon featuring the Prophet Mohammad.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Recruitment: Over the past two weeks, ""border guards"" have come through the villages around Zalingei, recruiting ""civilians"" and especially the sons of nomadic shepherds, to fight against rebels in East Jebel Marra.

The SPLM-N has claimed they have taken control of Ankarto, near Kadugli, and Um Turq-Turq, north of Talodi. They also claim to have caused casualties (coded as 3 across the two locations) and seized large quantities of weapons.

The SPLM-N has claimed they have taken control of Ankarto, near Kadugli, and Um Turq-Turq, north of Talodi. They also claim to have caused casualties (coded as 3 across the two locations) and seized large quantities of weapons.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: 7 herders and 15 RSF members were killed in a gunfight following an RSF cattle theft. 5 herders also sustained injuries. Reinforcements came for the RSF, which then repulsed the herders and forced them to leave the livestock behind.
Militiamen raped three women in Dubo El Omda, East Jebel Marra. One later bled to death.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Sasusa, North Darfur. One death, 10 injuries.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF shotand killed a man in El Shaabi market in Nyala.
Militiamen in a Land Cruiser, mounted with a Dushka machine gun, abducted a merchant in Kutum.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF and pro-government militiamen on camels and horses raided villages north of Tabit on Jan. 18 and Jan. 19, including Karkar, Sajali, Siwsiwa, Hillet Mandi, Hillet Faki Abakar, and Donki Shata. 2 herders abducted.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF on camels and horses severely beat and whipped protesters that had gathered near Al Geneina secondary school to welcome a visit by President al-Bashir. Several were trampled. 2 died.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Al Salam, West Darfur. Two injuries reported.
Internal clash among Habbaniyah militia. One dead, one injured.

A driver was shot dead when he refused to pay supposed toll fees at a checkpoint set up by militiamen on the Zalingei-Nyala road between Zalingei and Kass. An argument arose as to the amount the driver had to pay, and when the driver grabbed his gun, militiamen shot him.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Protests sparked by RSF killing a man in El Saabi market earlier in the day. RSF fired tear gas and shots in the air to force disperse protesters that were marching toward the state governors residence. Protests occurred again on Jan. 20. Military reinforcements have been sent to the city.

Government-backed militiamen raided, pillaged, and attacked civilians in Birkat Seira in Saraf Umra locality on Jan. 19. Several injuries reported. 1 person abducted. The abductee escaped on March 8 in Saraf Umra.
Traders and shopkeepers in Kutum protested against the increasing number of armed robberies and abductions of merchants.
A group of camel herders in Kubri valley in Umm Baru area were ambushed by gunmen. The attackers killed two shepherds and looted 200 head of camels.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: At least 7 villagers in Nierteti locality sustained serious injuries when they were beat and whipped by RSF troops and other government militiamen.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Hamidiya. One death reported.

Army forces stationed at Khazan Tunjur responded to an attack on civilians in by Abala tribesmen in Taradona village, 20km south of Tawila. Government forces killed one of the tribesmen and arrested 7 others.

column8: NLJM: National Liberation and Justice Movement
column17: Change to armed group: The Liberation and Justice Movement has confirmed its split into two politically recognized factions: the Liberation and Justice Movement (LJM) led by Bahar Idriss Abu Garda and the National Liberation and Justice Movement (NLJM) led by Tijani al-Sissi.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF and pro-government militiamen on camels and horses raided and pillaged villages north of Tabit on Jan. 18 and Jan. 19, including Karkar, Sajali, Siwsiwa, Hillet Mandi, Hillet Faki Abakar, Um Haraz, and Donki Shata.
A child was wounded and three houses destroyed by 24 bombs dropped on Nagra village in Kadugli.

column9: Health Workers (Sudan); MSF: Doctors Without Borders
column17: An MSF hospital located in Frandala in the Nuba Mountains was targeted in an aerial bombing on January 20. 2 injuries reported. 13 bombs were dropped, 2 of which landed inside the hospital compound.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards; Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces; Militia (Pro-Government)
column17: Army, RSF, government-backed militia and Border Guards in 200 heavily armored vehicles and on camels and horses assaulted and robbed people in Khor Ramla and in Fendo in Nieterti locality.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: In the area south of Al Fasher, RSF troops in more than 20 vehicles and others riding camels and horses raided the villages of Abu Zerega, Um Gaygo, Um Liyuna, Zagalona, Hillet Yagoub Khater Arabi, Tamat Diheish, and Deim Silik. 1 dead.
A resident of El Salam sustained burns when government-backed militiamen set and her donkey cart on fire.

A White Nile lawyer was attacked by masked men at the market in Kosti. The attackers smashed the window and attempted to pick him out of the car using sticks and knives. The lawyer drove to the safety of a security building.

11 people injured - 5 seriously injured and taken to hospital - in Nyala during protests on Jan. 20. Protests sparked by RSF shooting a civilian in El Shaabi market on Jan. 19. Police shut down Mecca bridge leading to the house of the governor and used tear gas and bullets to disperse the crowd. Military reinforcements have been sent to the city.
SPLM-N claimed they captured Talodi-Alnuba (west of Talodi) from the government forces.
Misseriya militia clash with an unidentified actor in Sheria. One fatality reported.
Sudanese air forces dropped bombs on areas of Kadugli.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: RSF with 200 vehicles heavily shooting and shelling areas as they moved towards Deribat.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Um Baru. Two deaths reported.
2 shot dead and 2 wounded in an attack by Abala tribesmen in Taradona village, 20km south of Tawila.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Girgera, near Zamzam camp. Two deaths reported.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: 12 killed in Sudanese Air Force bombings of villages of Katur, Dubo El Madrasa, Barara, Wadi Lei Gina, Usajanga, Deribat and Fanga, in East Jebel Marra.
Military forces bomb Katur using an unknown method. Radio Dabanga reports 12 killed throughout the area.
Unknown gunmen beat and whipped cattle owners in a grazing area 15km north of Tukumari, North Darfur.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: 4 civilians and 6 soldiers killed in an attack by RSF, Border Guards, and government militias on Golo in Jebel Marra. HRW later reported that RSF committed mass rapes during the attack. Soldiers had attempted to protect civilians from RSF, but were not a target of the attack.
Sudanese Air Force dropped bombs on Tablo village, Dalami locality. 3 civilians killed on Jan 24.
Militiamen stabbed and beat 2 herders in Sirba locality, West Darfur.
Unknown gunmen shot dead a displaced man from Dankoj camp and wounded 3 others in an armed robbery in Saraf Umra, North Darfur.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Korma.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLM/A-Nur battled government forces at Sur Reng near Golo on Jan 24 and 25. Rebels claim to have killed 72 government and militia troops on Jan 24, destroyed four vehicles and seized weapons and ammunition.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in ten Land Cruisersattack and pillaged Kobos village, 10 km west of Katur.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Government forces shelled villages west of Sur Reng rebel base near Golo on Jan 24. Nouni, Tari, Tagana, Delgo, Tariya burned to the ground. Reconnaissance units combing the area west of Sur Reng found the body of Lt. Hanafi Hassan El Tileib, an officer of the paramilitary Border Guards stationed at El Geneina.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Following their attack on Golo, RSF forces moved to Koron and engaged with SLA forces. The RSF suffered heavy losses.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudanese Air Force targeted areas in the northern part of East Jebel Marra, including Fanga, on Jan 24 and 25. Explosions killed a number of livestock, and set fire to some farmlands and orchards. No casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Bardani. At least 8 killed. Women raped.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudanese Air Force drops bombs on rebel base in Sur Reng and nearby villages. 7 civilians injured over 2 days of bombing.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Terow.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Aradeiba.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Kara.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Takaro.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF forces clash with SLA forces in Sarrong, four injuries reported.
Sudanese Air Force dropped bombs on Tablo village, Dalami locality. 3 civilians killed on Jan 25.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLM/A-Nur battled government forces at Sur Reng near Golo for the second day in a row. On Jan 25, rebels claimed to have killed 23 government and militia troops and had 3 rebels killed. 11 rebels wounded. Military withdrew to Golo.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Non-violent activity: UNAMID, Government of Sudan, Darfur Regional Authority, and Darfur civil society organizations launched the Darfur Internal Dialogue and Consulation process in Al Fasher.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacked two men in Kutum on Jan 25, shooting one man dead.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack civilians in Golo.
3 pro-government militia on camels killed a man in Taigi, an area southwest of Kafod, El Fasher locality.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Government and paramilitary forces attacked Golo on Jan 25.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF forces sexually assault four men in Bardani. Eight women were assaulted the previous day.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudanese Air Force targeted areas in the northern part of East Jebel Marra, including Fanga, on Jan 24 and 25. Explosions killed a number of livestock, and set fire to some farmlands and orchards. No casualties reported.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Sudanese Air Force drops bombs on rebel base in Sur Reng and nearby villages. 7 civilians injured over 2 days of bombing.
Sudanese air forces bomb Tala village. Unknown fatalities, injures.

Pro-government militia in a Land Cruiser intercepted a commercial vehicle at gunpoint and beat the passengers with rifle butts. Event occurred in the Jebel Amer gold mining area in El Sareif Beni Hussein locality, as car was on its way to Saraf Umra. One passenger seriously injured and taken to hospital.
Agreement:The Governor of Sudan's South Kordofan state Adam Al Fekki said that over 200 SPLA-North rebels have surrendered in the state.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Army and RSF clash near Tabit. 2 militiamen and one army soldier killed.
Pro-government militia attacked Argo camp in Tawila, opening fire and stealing 200 sheep. No casualties reported.
Sudanese air forces bomb Kirro village. Unknown fatalities, injures.
Sudanese air forces bomb Koron village. Unknown fatalities, injures.
4 children and 1 woman from the Ngok Dinka tribe were killed and another reported missing in an attack on Bonj village south of Abyei.

column9: WFP: World Food Programme; UN: United Nations; Aid Workers (Bulgaria)
column17: UN helicopter forced by SPLM-N fighters to land in the Nuba Mountains east of Kadugli. Helicopter was flying from Rumbek to El Obeid. 6 World Food Program staff from Bulgaira on board released by SPLM-N on Jan 31.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF that arrived in Kadugli at the end of January are alleged to have committed at least eight cases of rape within four days.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Reports of sexual assault in by RSF forces in the days following a military attack on Golo.
Clashes between the Rizaygat and Misseriya tribesmen near El Meram in West Kordofan. 7 killed.
Sudanese air forces bomb Bar Arie village. Unknown fatalities, injures.
Sudanese air forces bomb Noni and Dorsa villages, Central Darfur. Unknown fatalities, injures.
Sudanese Air Force bombed farmlands near Golo. Houses in Dorsa village burned. No casualties reported.
A boy was killed when the Sudanese Air Force MiG jet dropped a bomb on farmlands near Khazan Tunjur.
Sudanese Air Force bombarded the area south and west of Deribat. No casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Reports of sexual assault in by RSF forces in the days following a military attack on Golo.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF troops in dozens of heavily armed vehicles raided Um Mahareik, Khazan Ambar, Mandar, Donki Jibril, and Goz Tahir in Umm Baru locality. 1 merchant shot dead. Thousands of camels and sheep stolen.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Change to armed group: RSF stationed at Talodi have reportedly mutinied against the Sudanese army following recent defeats to SPLM-N. Reports made by SPLM-N Secretary-General Yasir Arman on Jan. 28.
Sudanese Air Force bombed Turdi village and southern Jebel Marra. No casualties reported.
Unknown militia beat and abducted a man in Al Dabkar village in Al Sonut locality.

column9: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: 2 Russian pilots working as UNAMID contractors in Sudan were kidnapped on Jan 29 when six armed gunmen in cars blocked a UNAMID minibus in Zalingei and took the passengers in an unknown direction. They were freed in Khartoum on June 6.
Sudanese Air Force bombed north, west, and south of Deribat. No casualties reported.
Hundreds of Maaliya tribesmen rioted in Adila against the appointment of Maaliya commissioners, parliamentarians and ministers in East Darfur. The rioters blocked state government institutions.
Janjaweed attacked the village of Kort and killed 2 men. They also looted the villages of Torongo and Mermanga.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack Um Meineilkhir, Hashaba, Um Sidir, Basheen and Mellit one civilian dead in Um Meineilkhir.
Al-Falata and Salamat militia clash in Al Nadif, South Darfur. 19 dead, 15 injured.
A secondary school student was killed and 5 sustained bullet wounds in an attack by militiamen in Rahad Idrisa, Gireida locality.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Army and RSF clashes in Katur, Tawila locality, when soldiers opposed an attempt by RSF to rob fleeing villagers. 3 militiamen and 2 soldiers killed.
SAF bombed villages of Toro, Dalgo, and Tarma.
Janjaweed attacked Tor area, raped a woman and killed 2 men.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Rapid Support Forces attack Um Meineilkhir, Hashaba, Um Sidir, Basheen and Mellit one civilian dead in Um Meineilkhir.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Rapid Support Forces attack Um Meineilkhir, Hashaba, Um Sidir, Basheen and Mellit one civilian dead in Um Meineilkhir.

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Student members of Sudanese Congress Party (SCP) staged a sit-in at the University of El Geneina. NISS then raided the SCP premises in El Geneina and detained a number of students.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Malagat. One death, one injury.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Saadoun, near Tullus. Four injuries reported.
Militiamen attacked military police barracks at the market at Kabkabiya and freed a colleague who was in custody. Military policemen beaten. Two bystanders injured.
Gunmen with batons assaulted a man in Sibak Al Khel camp, northwest of Kebkabiya.
Janjaweed killed a man as he was collecting firewood near Hashaba village.
Janjaweed abducted a child in Gereida. The child was found later in the day with its feet tied.

Maaliya tribesmen rioted in Adila, against the appointment of Maaliya commissioners, parliamentarians and ministers in East Darfur. The rioters blocked access to Adila market and governmental institutions. Similar riots occurred Jan 29.
Sudanese Air Force dropped 11 bombs on Golo. No casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: At least 5 killed and 4 injured in attack by RSF in areas of El Gerid and Birdik in Kutum.
Janjaweed attacked a group travelling from Korma to Al Fasher, killing 1 woman and injuring 2 men.
Ethnic clash at Forika and Donkey Abiad, South Darfur. 7 dead, 17 injured.

At least 15 killed and 7 injured in clashes between Fellata and Salamat tribesmen in Al-Nadhif in Buram. Fighting broke out after two Salamat abducted a Fellata woman. The woman's husband was shot and the incident escalated when relatives of the husband arrived.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Abuteriza. One death reported.
Government-backed militiamen killed 4 and injured others in an attack on Abyad camp on outskirts of Gereida.
Antonov bomb in Regife injures several children.

Maaliya tribesmen rioted in Adila against the appointment of Maaliya commissioners, parliamentarians and ministers in East Darfur. The rioters blocked access to governmental institutions. Similar riots occurred on Jan. 29 and 31.
Sudanese air forces bomb Sarrong village. One fatality reported.
Protests against government seizure and selling of public space in Khartoums neighbourhoods. One woman beaten with a rifle butt by police later died on Feb 23, sparking further protests and riots.

column8: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
column17: Misseriya tribesmen with machine guns attacked UNISFA forces in Mayankor area, 10km from Abyei. 11 arrested.
A woman was shot and killed when Janjaweed opened fire on a commercial Land Cruiser on El Fasher-Kutum road, near a militia toll gate.
Unknown group hijacked two lorries and abducted eight people. Exact location unreported. Abductees were recovered by army forces the following week in Rahad al Bardi locality.
Clashes between Al-Falata and Masalit groups and government-backed militia in El Shati, El Rahman, and Abyad camp in Gereidam, 80km south of Nyala. 9 killed and 21 injured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF forces attack Tima, no reported dead.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: 10 dead, 17 wounded after an attack by RSF on the market of Baashim, northeast of Kutum. Hillet Mandi and Hawariya also raided. 5 also dead from attacks in Ed El Garad and Tema.
Bomb hit a foxhole in Umm Dorian. 3 killed.
Pro-government militia raped a woman in Wadi Sharafa north of Shangil Tobaya.
Militiamen on camels raided the villages of Hijier Tunjo, Magharba 1, Hillet El Doma, Mursal, and Um Gabo, 15km north of Tabit. 4 wounded. 1 burned to death inside of his house in Hijeir Tunjo.

Hundreds of people displaced by the construction of Merowe Dam seven years ago protested in Makaberab (coordinates unavailable) demanding compensation for their loss and provisions for clean dirinking water. Most protesters are Al-Manasir tribesmen. Reports that protests were violently suppressed.

Student members of the National Congress Party set fire to the headquarters of the Sibdu Students Association at Ahlia University in Omdurman, following an argument after a football game. Several students injured.
Government militiamen attacked a number of displaced collecting firewood in Kamanga and Doli areas of Kebkabiya. 1 seriously wounded.
Residents of Lagawa protested on the streets against the transfer of 8 teachers and a doctor from Lagawa to El Fula.
Gunmen shot at a passenger vehicle in front of Um Hashaba gate near Zamzam camp.
Mahariya and Awlad Najaa militias clash in Korti. Two deaths, fourteen injuries.
Ethnic clash at Gemesa (Qurayah), South Darfur. 7 dead, 17 injured.
Property destruction: Militiamen on camels torched houses in Um Siyala, 5km east of Tabit.
SAF bomb Andona. No injuries reported.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Khor Tawani, South Darfur. One death reported.
SAF bomb Tunguli, Dalami County. At least 2 killed.
Government militia troops in 80 vehicles attacked the area of the Jumat Allah Tahir well in Umm Baru. 7 people, including 5 children, were shot dead. Thousands of camels, cows, and sheep stolen.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF ambushed a convoy of 5 Nissan lorries in Mashrou Abu Zeid near Tabit, and robbed passengers. Another lorry in the same area was overturned when being chased by RSF militiamen. Passengers were seriously injured.
Unknown group ambushed four men in Gardud village in Heiban. 2 killed.
3 herders killed when a piece of unexploded ordnance detonated in Saouda, East Jebel Marra.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF forces cash with SLA forces in Korny village, Central Darfur. Two deaths reported.
Strike:Drivers and owners of lorries in Bindisi and Mukjar went on strike to protest recent hijiacking by armed groups and to demand security along the Nyala-Foro Baranga route.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Sudan)
column17: 3 Sudanese Red Cross workers were killed in attack by an unidentified armed group in Blue Nile state. Workers were returning to Ad-Damazin from Kurmuk.
Strike:Drivers and owners of lorries in Bindisi and Mukjar went on strike to protest recent hijiacking by armed groups and to demand security along the Nyala-Foro Baranga route.
Gunmen hijacked a driver and took his vehicle in Kabkabiya.
Sufis protested in Nyala, calling for a boycott of French and Danish goods because of cartoons depicting the Prophet Muhammad published in Charlie Hebdo magazine.
SPLM-N forces attacked army forces in Angasana Hills. 4 soldiers were killed, 5 taken hostage.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Dhaka, South Darfur. Four injuries reported.
Gunmen fired bullets at a car in Khor Tawamis, 5kms south of Kas. A woman in the car was severely wounded.
Unidentified gunmen attacked the police station in Mellit, killing 1 officer, injuring 3 others, and stealing 2 police vehicles.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Clashes between army and RSF troops in Khazan Tunjur. 7 militiamen and 2 soldiers killed, at least 15 injured. 3 RSF vehicles destroyed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF militiamen beat and severely injured a man with their rifles when the man attempted to prevent them from taking his sheep in Nierteti.

SPLM-N forces attacked army forces in the area between Sira Kilo and Sali north of Kurmuk, along the road linking Kurmuk to Ad-Damazi. 4 soldiers killed. SPLM-N destroyed three vehicles and seized a vehicle, 10 Kalashnikovs, a Dushka cannon and one PKM machine gun.
Sudanese air forces attack Dursa, casualties not known.
Clashes between Misseriya and Nuer militia in Al-Dihin area, east of Abyei, after a group of Nuer tribesmen stole Misseriya cattle. 13 killed.
Janjaweed on camels attacked the villages of Kalo and Doudi, south of Atabra in Tawila locality. In defense, villagers killed at least 2 of the militiamen and injured others.
Looting: Militia troops pillaged Bakouri, east of Dor, in Kutum locality, robbing shops, houses and livestock.
Five killed, five wounded at a water point in Um Haraz. Perpetrators unidentified.
Unidentified group attack government forces in Mellit. One injury reported.
Militiamen opened fire on a Nissan lorry in Khartoum Jadeed near Kabkabiyah. Several taken to hospital.

Residents of Halfaya protested against the sale of their lands to investors. Riot police fired tear gas and rubber bullets, and beat protesters with batons. Some protesters wounded. No reports of serious injuries.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Dabaneira. One death reported.
Military bomb Daya in February 2015.
SAF bombed Ragafi and four other villages in Umm Durein county in late February 2015.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack civilians in Daya in February 2015.
In one incident in February, six boys were killed and five maimed by SPLA during an attack on a Misseryia group in Nabag, Abyei Area.
Recruitment: In January and February (dates not known) JEM forcefully recruited 55 children between 14 and 17 years of age.
Hundreds of Sudanese police retirees protested in front of the presidential palace demanding their family allowance.
Sudanese Air Force drop three bombs in Rokoro locality. 1 man killed.
Sudanese Air Force drops bombs on Sorenq area west of Jabal Marra. Several homes bured and livestock killed. No casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: In February, 150 RSF and PDF troops in Land Cruisers attacked the village of Kadeer, 22km northwest of Al Abbasiya in the Nuba Mountains. 600 homes torched and several civilians wounded. Attacks launched because villagers did not retrieve their youth who allegedly joined the SPLM-N.
SAF bomb Heiban Rural Hospital. 1 killed.
On Feb 16 and 17, dozens of journalists in Khartoum protested against government seizure of 14 newspapers.
Residents of Halfayat Almolook in Khartoum North demonstrated against government sale of land.

column8: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Military forces clash with SLM/A-Nur near Golo.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF assaulted and injured a man during robbings in Nemra, Hillet Massalit and Dalma villages in East Jebel Marra.
Security forces attack civilians in Kanzanjadeed, reasons unknown. Two dead, two injured.
SAF bombed villages of Mayak, Yabus and Wadaka on Feb 17, 18 and 19. 1 civilian killed (coded as 1 fatality on Feb 17) and 1 wounded.

Police shot 1 man dead and wounded two others in El Hawira area, 7km northwest of Dabab (Dabbat) locality. Incident began when youth seized two water tanks belonging to a Chinese oil company and demanded that the company employ local youth.
SAF bombed villages of Mayak, Yabus and Wadaka on Feb 17, 18 and 19. 1 civilian killed (coded as 1 fatality on Feb 17) and 1 wounded.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SRF forces of Nur faction claim to have killed 14 government soldiers and militiamen during clashes in Karmel area between Golo and Sorenq in West Jebel Marra on Feb 18.

column7: CSCSO: Confederation of Sudanese Civil Society Organzations
column17: Confederation of Sudanese Civil Society Organzations (CSCSO) held a sit-in to protest against government crackdown on civil society groups and activists, and to protest the imprisonment of CSCSO president Amin Mekki Madani, who was arrested Dec. 6, 2014 after signing the ""Sudan Call"".
Strike:Doctors and interns of Wadi Medani hospital in Khartoum went on strike in protest of non-payment of incentives for January.
Dozens injured at the University of El Damazin when NCP students members attacked female students with firearms, knives, machetes, metal bars, and sticks. 5 arrested.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Um Thojak. One injury reported.
Sudanese Air Force drops bombs on Sorenq area west of Jabal Marra. Three wells destroyed and eight shops burned. 2 killed.
SAF bombed villages of Mayak, Yabus and Wadaka on Feb 17, 18 and 19. 1 civilian killed (coded as 1 fatality on Feb 17) and 1 wounded.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Rebel forces killed 9 government troops west of Golo. On Feb 19.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Girfa, East Darfur. Three dead, four injured.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLA-AW and government forces clash in Maila, East Darfur. Eleven fatalities.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLA-AW and government forces clash in Golo. No reported fatalities.
8 gunmen on camels attacked a wedding party in El Garef, Adila locality. 3 killed, 4 wounded. Attack allegedly related to intermittent clashes between Hamar and Maaliya tribes.
Sudanese air forces bomb Tora village. Two reported dead.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLA-AW and government forces clash in Golo for the second day. Eleven injures reported.
Ethnic militias clash in Al Qirfa, East Darfur. Three dead, four injured.
Clash between army and PDF in the market of Jad El Seed, 40km north of Abu Karinka. A PDF commander and a soldier were killed.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: A trader was abducted in Sirba on Feb 22 and tortured, beaten and burned by security agents. He was released on Feb. 26.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF Land Cruiser ran over and killed a man while tending his farm in area near Shingil Tobaya.
Militiamen attacked the area of Abu Selala, Tullus locality. 2 shot dead.
A resident of Naivasha camp was abducted by 7 militiamen on camels in the area of Numeira, west of Tabit.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF shot and injured three soldiers who refused to let RSF take women from the hospital. Several women raped.
Protests in Al Sajara district of El Hamadab neighbourhood in Khartoum. Police and security forces fired shots and tear gas to disperse the crowd. 6 injured and several sent to hospital. 9 detained.

El Samani Mahmoud Omar Amara, member of the National Congress Partys Shura Council in Kassala state and manager of the states Youth Stabilisation Projects, was stabbed to death by an unknown group. His body was found in a street near Kassala airport, with 24 stab wounds and a skull fracture.

Hundreds of protesters gathered near the courthouse in Khartoum, calling for the release of Farouk Abu Issa, head of the National Consensus Forces and Amin Mekki Madani, chairman of the Civil Society Initiative, as a lorry took Issa and Madani from Kober prison to the courthouse for a hearing in their terrorism trial.

Riots sparked by the death of protester Samia Mohamed Bushra, who died on Feb 23 from wounds sustained during a demonstration three weeks earlier. Several hundred Al Shajara residents blocked the roads and set fire to tires. Police fired tear gas.
SPLM-N claims to have seized the Kahliat garrison, 5km west of Kadugli on Feb 24. 10 soldiers killed, 2 SPLM-N injured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attack and rape civilians in Golo. At least 14 killed.
Clash between army and militia members at the crops market in Kabkabiya on Feb. 24.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLA-AW attack government forces at Guldo. No fatalities reported.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF seized a man and set him on fire in the public square in Fanga.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF attacks Abu Salalah, two civilians dead.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Oyur, Central Darfur. Two deaths and one injury reported.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Kuma. One death and one injury reported.
Militiamen on camels and horses attacked a group of displaced from the Hamadiya camp in Zalingei, as they were collecting firewood at Wadi Oyur. 2 dead. 1 seriously injured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Military Intelligence Service
column17: Members of Military Intelligence beat a man in Ailliet Jarelnabi.
2 children killed in the area of Khazan Tunjur when an unexploded ordance detonated.
Clash between Misseriya and Dinka Ngok militia in Al-Shegag village, Abyei.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira; Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Ziyadiyah militia - allied with Border Guards and Central Reserve Police (Abu Tira) - attacked Maksi village in Mellit locality, on Feb 27. 4 killed, 4 injured. 10 villagers were seized and tortured for being suspected rebels.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Military Intelligence Service
column17: Government-backed militia lashed 2 men at the Thur market in Nierteti. The men were transported to the military garrison and tortured by military intelligence agents.
Misseriya leadership claims that clashes occurred between Misseriya militia and South Sudan military in Hafira area, 50km east of Abyei. 4 killed and 6 wounded.
SPLM-N and military clash in Jam and Soda, Bau locality on Feb 28. SPLM-N claim to have liberated both towns and captured four government soldiers.
2 militiamen attacked and raped a woman about 10km south of Dubo El Madrasa, near the village of Faluja in East Jebel Marra.

Unknown men with batons and knives attacked a group of herdsmen in Sari area in El Kuma locality of North Darfur (capital Al Fasher coordinates used). 6 herders killed, 1 injured. The dead bodies were torched.
Ziyadiyah and Berti militias clash militia in Markisi, North Darfur. Four dead, three injured.
Police raided the office of the National Umma Party prior to the start of an anti-election campaign in Dongola. Police injured two people using batons, electric sticks and tear gas.
SAF dropped 4 bombs on area of Kaja, south of Dolma in East Jebel Marra. No casualties reported.
3 militiamen fired at a resident of Hamidiya camp while he was between El Jasaayir and Hamidiya districts in Zalingei. He was taken to the hospital.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF and SLA forces clash in Khor Almalih, North Darfur, 18 dead. Additionally, 23 arrested and six vehicles captured by RSF.
Sudanese air forces bomb Abu Zerega village. No reported fatalities.

Politicians, lawyers and civil society activists gathered in front of the Khartoum North criminal court in support of Mr. Farouk Abu Issa and Amin Madani, on trial for signing the Sudan Appeal in December 2014.
Clash between army and militia forces in Garsila-Foro Baranga road. 3 killed and 7 wounded.
3 military commanders of JEM were detained in Al Fasher by a group of fellow commanders.

column6: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
column17: UN forces battled Misseriya militia near the village of Shegag, after Misseriya earlier attacked the Ngor Dinka village of Marialachak. 3 Misseriya killed. 4 children abducted, released on April 9 in Aweil following mediation between UNISFA and Misseriya.

100 armed Misseriya tribesmen attacked the majority Ngok Dinka village of Marialachak on March 2. 5 killed (reported by Radio Tamazuj), 3 wounded, 8 abducted, and 24 houses burned. It is alleged that Popular Defence Forces were behind the attacks. UN forces were deployed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF stationed at Fanga abducted 7 boys as they walked in a group from the area southwest of Fanga to the camps of Tawila and Zamzam.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF and army troops looted and torched villages and Birdani, Kara, Korma, Loni and Tiro. In Loni, 3 woman were raped.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF and army troops looted and torched villages and Birdani, Kara, Korma, Loni and Tiro. In Loni, 3 woman were raped.
Dozens of former employees of the Sudanese Civil Aviation Authority staged a sit-in in front of the Council of Ministers in Khartoum, protesting against the non-payment of dues.
Missile launched by SAF from Damazin Airport reportedly fallen into Hai Affendi neighborhood. No casualties reported.
Hundreds of people in El Bowga, River Nile State protested against the use of toxic substances by gold mining companies in the area.
Military shelled SPLA-N controlled areas east of Kadugli.
Habbaniya gunmen attacked a Rizeigat village in El Firdous locality in East Darfur. 3 killed.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: A member of the Central Reserve Police (Abu Tira) shot a man dead in Ed Daein.
A soldier opened fire and killed a policeman in Garsila.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira; Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards; Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces; Militia (Pro-Government)
column17: Government troops attacked students as they walked from Golo to Nierteti. 2 girls raped, 8 others missing. 5 boys and 2 girls were found in the area of Dogi Ja, west of Golo. Troops, including RSF, Border Guards and Central Reserve Police and other militiamen also raided houses in the area.
Militiamen in Land Cruisers attacked a police station in Kireinek, West Darfur. 4 police officers wounded, two seriously wounded.
Military of South Sudan forces attacked Misseriya herders in an area south of Heglig in Sudans West Kurdufan State. 5 herders killed and six wounded.
2 pro-government militia beat civilians in Um Khair in Wadi Saleh, 32km west of Garsila in Central Darfur. Police took gunmen into custody.

Armed relatives of militiamen that beat civilians earlier in the day in Um Khair came on camels, horses and motorcycles to attack police. They fired shots in the air in an attempt to force police to release the militiamen in custody. Residents confronted the militiamen, who then opened fire on villagers. 1 killed and 4 injured. A military force from Garsila was sent to Um Khair.
SAF bombed Taguli village, Dalami county.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Clashes between Central Reserve Police (Abu Tira) and militiamen at Abu Shouk camp market near Al Fasher. 2 displaced killed, several injured.
Seven gunmen on camels attacked a convoy of three passenger lorries on the way to Sawani market in East Jebel Marra. One woman injured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF and SRF forces clashed in Tim Sahah, South Darfur. No fatalities reported.

Pro-opposition and pro-NCP students at Babanusa Peace University set fire to a building in the National Fund compound to protest against poor services at the university and dormitories. Police fired shots in the area to disperse the rioters.

Dozens of students at University of Dongola staged a sit-in in protest of the eviction of five students. The university had prohibited organization of any cultural, political, or university activity due to tensions between independent students and students of the Popular Congress Party.
Unknown group stopped lorries at gunpoint in Khor Kalash as they were on the way from Foro Baranga to Nyala. The gunmen abducted one man.
Militiamen attacked a group of farmers in Garsila.
A group of militiamen ambushed a water tanker on its way to Kutum, and stabbed the driver and another passenger.
Three militiamen attacked 2 men returning from Azirni market in Kireinek locality near El Geneina. 1 man killed with a spear, the other man seriously injured.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Clashes between SLM/A-Nur Facton and government troops in Tiro, west of Golo. 9 government troops killed. Army forces also pillaged and torched the village of Birdani upon retreat.
Government militia killed a farmer and his son in Mershing locality north of Nyala.

JEM fighters in Land Cruisers mounted with Duschka machine guns attacked the house of a JEM field commander in El Fashers Sawra district. The house burned down. Exchange of fire ensued. The field commander sustained leg wounds. Police arrived but did not intervene. Attack comes against the backdrop of the appointment of 32 JEM leaders - all relatives of the movements leader Bakhit Abdelkarim - as officers in the Sudanese army. Also, JEM detained three fellow commanders on March 2.
Unidentified group attack civilians in Zalingei. One injury reported.
SAF aid raids on members of the Qadiriya Sufi Order as they were returning from their visit to the tomb of El Sheik Abdelbagi in Tageli in the Nuba Mountains.

Students and teachers of secondary schools in Ed Daein protested the poor supply of electrical power and lack of fuel disrupting their lessons. Protesters demonstrated in multiple locations in the city and converged on the headquarters of Commission of Electricity.
Internal clash among JEM forces. Causalities not known.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Joint UNAMID and WFP convoy of 30 vehicles en route from Kutum to Al Fasher attacked by militiamen, 36km south of Kutum. UNAMID exchanged fire with the unidentified group. 1 injured.
Unidentified persons attacks market in Abu Shouk, El Fasher. One dead, three injured.
Three militiamen shot a soldier dead in Dlaba market in Ed Daein.

Riots ensued at the University of Bakht El Rida in Ed Dueim, after student members of the NCP won the student union elections but were accused of rigging the polls. Campus buildings were set on fire. Security detained 11 students.
Civilians attacked in Zalingei. One injury reported.
SAF bombed Tanase village in Tabo County, Buram locality. 1 girl injured.

SPLM-N attacked army forces in Kalogi and Tozi (Tusi) in Gadir locality. Attacks are part of a boycott of Aprils elections. 60 reported killed between clashes in Kalogi and similar clashes in El Rahmania that occurred the same day (30 fatalities coded for each).

SPLM-N attacked army forces in El Rahmania, 25 km southwest of Abu Jubaiya, en route to attacking Kalogi the same day. Rebels apparently seized control of the headquarters of security services, army, UPDF and Abu Tira for two and a half hours before leaving the area. Attacks are part of a boycott of Aprils elections. 60 reported killed between clashes in El Rahmania and in Kalogi (30 fatalities coded for each).
Three soldiers raped a woman and shot her husband dead in Vanaga village in East Jebel Marra.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLM/A-Nur claimed to have captured Rokerro, destroying the SAF garrison in the area and killing 68 soldiers.

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: In El Obeid, NISS carried out mass arrests at a scheduled event for the ""Leave"" campaign, which asks voters to boycott elections. NISS prevented the event from taking place, taking into custody the National Umma Party Secretary General Sarah Nugdalla, Union Movement figure Mohammad Yacoub Shadad and 34 other opposition figures before releasing them later in the day. NISS and police then dispersed growing crowds surrounding NUP headquarters, firing tear gas canisters and rubber bullets.

column9: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: Prisoners in Rokerro base detained after battle and tortured, 2 died.
Militiamen on camels beat a group of villagers from Tiro, near Golo, and abducted one man.

Militiamen beat guards and staff members of El Fasher Teaching Hospital after an injured militiaman was brought to the hospital for treatment. Militiamen wanted doctors to stop their work and treat the injured militiaman first.
Civilians attacked in Dankuj, Central Darfur. One injury reported.
7 security guards abducted by SPLM-N in March 2015 while working on Chinese oil fields in Al Dabker. Freed in Apr 2016.
SAF bomb Eral village in Heiban County. 6 injured.
Clashes between security forces and militiamen following a car hijacking in downtown Al Fasher. One militiamen killed, one wounded and taken to El Fasher Teaching Hopsital.
In March, unknown militia killed 6 people in Sari area near Mellit.
In March, unknown militia killed 9 people on their farm near Mellit.
Government militiamen shot one man dead in Duma, north of Nyala.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: Clashes between RSF and unknown group on motorcycles during a bus robbery on the road from Nyala to Kass. One armed gunmen and the bus driver were killed.
Farmer shot dead by militiamen at his farmland in Dankoj, east of Zalingei.
Residents of El Salam camp in Kabkabiya protested against the reduction of humanitarian assistance.
Clash between security guards and militiamen attempting to hijack a car of the Central Darfur State Minister of Education in El Wihda district of Zalingei. 2 militiamen wounded.
A driver was killed when a gunmen opened fire on a lorry on the Nyala-Zalingei road in the area of Korlei.
Army and militia troops assaulted civilians near Golo. One man reported missing.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira; Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Clashes between Ziyadiya militia - allied with Border Guards and Central Reserve Police (Abu Tira) - and Berti militia in Maksi village near Mellit locality. Attacks triggered when Berti militia allegedly breached a truce. 13 Berti militiamen and villagers killed, 2 Ziyadiya tribesmen killed. 2 wounded. UNAMID reports 22 fatalities.
Militiamen shot a villager dead in Balwa, south of Kabkabiya.
Clashes between Ziyadiyah and Berti militia in Mellit. Two injuries reported.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: 5 RSF militiamen killed when their vehicle hit a landmine near Mashou Abu Zeid, East Jebel Marra.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF severely beat civilians in the vicinity of Mashrou Abu Zeid.
Clashes between Ziyadiyah and Berti militia in Maksi village near Mellit. Berti attacked Ziyadiyah areas mounted on Land Cruisers. At least 20 killed on Mar. 19. UNAMID reports 28 dead, 10+ injured.
Unknown militia ambushed Ziyadiyah militia on the road linking Al Fasher and Mellit, 5km from Mellit. 6 militia and civilians killed, 4 injured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF in armed Land Cruisers attacked Wadi Ashara, north of Mashrou Abu Zeid in East Jebel Marra. 4 women and a boy shot dead.
Clashes between Ziyadiyah and unknown militias on the afternoon of Mar. 20, near Mellit. 5 killed, 5 wounded.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: An unidentified group fires mortar rounds from 400m at UNAMID forces. No reported causalities.
Clashes between Ziyadiyah and Berti militia in Maksi village near Mellit for the second day of fighting. At least 30 killed on Mar. 20. Military reinforcements arrived in Mellit.

Militiamen severely beat 12 women collecting firewood near Kassab camp in Kutum. Some sustained serious injuries. Militiamen then entered the camp and abducted two butchers. One butcher released soon after.
SPLM-N attacked army garrison of El Gabanit, 45km southwest of Ad-Damazin. 8 soldiers reportedly killed. 4 SPLM-N combatants killed. Sudanese army denies reports of any casualties.

column9: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: 300 militiamen on camels and Land Cruisers stormd the Tawila market. One gunmen was shot by a member of the Popular Defence Forces. The unknown armed group then shot the PDF member dead. Army and Abu Tira troops intervene.

Clashes in Ed Saadoun in Tullus locality, between Falata and Salamat militia after some Salamat stole cows from Fellata herders. 37 killed, 25 wounded, over two days of fighting (19 fatalities coded for Mar. 21, 18 coded for Mar. 22).
Displaced in Abu Suruj camp in Sirba locality rioted against the launch of the electoral campaign by members of NCP by throwing stones at officials.
Unidentified persons attacks market in Kamfa, North Darfur. One injury reported.
Government-backed militia raped a girl near Tendelti camp in El Geneina.
Unidentified persons attacks market in Kebkabiya, North Darfur. One injury reported.
Ziyadiyah clashed with Berti militia in Banama area of Mellit.
Clashes between Falata and Salamat militia in Buram locality following the theft of cows in Rajaj area. 9 killed, 25 injured. Fighting coincided with the visit of President al-Bashir.
SAF dropped four bombs on the area of Debbat Naira in East Jebel Marra.
Government-backed militia raped a 14-year-old girl in Birdani northwest of Golo.

Second day of clashes in Ed Saadoun in Tullus locality, between Falata and Salamat militia after some Salamat stole cows from Fellata herders. 37 killed, 25 wounded, over two days of fighting (19 fatalities coded for Mar. 21, 18 coded for Mar. 22).
Janjaweed gunmen abducted two farmers near Dubo El Omda.

Clashes between Falata and Salamat militia in Dimsu and El Ferdou localities (coordinates for South Darfur capital Nyala used). 40 killed over two days of fighting (20 fatalities coded per day). 61 wounded. South Darfur authorities sent troops to the area.
Militiamen abducted sheikhs of Waro, Deidama, and Gio villages east of Deleig and held them ransom for money for the killing of a militiaman near Nyala on Apr. 21.
Clashes between Awlad Omran and Al Ziyud militia at Kilo 13 area in West Kurdufan. 1 dead, 8 wounded. RSF intervened.
1 child killed, 3 injured when a hand grenade detonated in Habaniya village in El Salam locality.

Agreement: Ziyadiah and Berti leaders signed a cessation of hostilities in Al Fasher. SIgned by Yasir Hussein Ahmadai, King of the Berti, and Abdallah Adam Jizo, Nazir of the Ziyadiya, under auspices of Osman Kibir, Governor of North Darfur. The accord included an immediate ceasefire, a ban on the gathering of militants, the opening of all the roads, and a prohibition of negative media reporting to prevent further attacks.

Clashes between Falata and Salamat militia in Dimsu and El Ferdou localities (coordinates for South Darfur capital Nyala used). 40 killed over two days of fighting (20 fatalities coded per day). 61 wounded. South Darfur authorities sent troops to the area.

column6: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
column17: SLA-AW clash with government forces at Kora. Five dead, seven injured.

Clashes between Habbainyah and Rizaygat militia in Sunta in South Darfur. 9 Habbainiyah killed, 3 wounded. Clashes triggered when a Rizaygat trader was killed by Habbaniyah militia on the El-Sunta-El Ferdous road. UNAMID reports 14 fatalities, 22 injured.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira; Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Ziyadiyah force of Border Guards and Abu Tira troops raided the area of Um Seleilo, southeast of Mellit. 4 Berti tribesmen and 1 Ziyadiyah militiamen killed. The clash came soon after a cessation of hostilities was signed between Ziyadiah and Berti leaders in Al Fasher on Mar. 23.
Two children were seriously wounded when they threw a stone at an unexploded bomb causing it to explode; in Angartu, near Kadugli in the Nuba Mountains.

Clashes between Falata and Salamat militia in Dimsu and El Ferdou localities (coordinates for South Darfur capital Nyala used). 40 killed over two days of fighting (20 fatalities coded per day). 61 wounded. South Darfur authorities sent troops to the area.

Clashes between Falata and Salamat militia in Dimsu and El Ferdou localities (coordinates for South Darfur capital Nyala used). 40 killed over two days of fighting (20 fatalities coded per day). 61 wounded. South Darfur authorities sent troops to the area.

Clashes between 8 militants on camels and horses and a group of herders at Jebel Kosa, 20km from Tawila. Milititants killed 6 herders. In retaliation, the herders then killed the leader of the militants.
Ziyadiyah militia attacked Tofaya village, west of Kuma, killing 2 Berti villagers.

column8: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers fire three shot at UNAMID personnel in Tullus. No reported causalities.
Unidentified persons attacks market in Jebel Kosa, North Darfur. Six dead, two injured.
Unidentified persons attacks market in Biljango, North Darfur. One death reported.

Clashes between SPLM-N and military forces in Habila garrison on Mar. 28. 54 soldiers killed. 21 civilians killed. SPLM-N claims to have captured Habila, but military states that it remains in control of the area. A school was burnt down, a hospital damaged and supplies looted in the town.

Militiamen in government uniforms abducted a resident of El Salam camp at gunpoint in Kabkabiyah. In nearby Wadi Berananjo, militiamen on donkeys assaulted four women and their children, shooting one child in the leg.

column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira; Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Ziyadiyah members of the Border Guards and Central Reserve Police (Abu Tira) attacked Berti villages near Mellit. At least 48 killed.

SPLM-N attacked military in Alfarishaiya, 25km northwest of Dilling, taking control of the area for two hours before withdrawing. 28 soldiers killed. Rebels seized seven anti-tank launchers and 5 heavy machine guns.

Government militia attacked the villages of Jambo, Ghireiban and Turra, near Kutum. 41 killed, 7 injured,and 4 abducted over 3 days of attacks (14 fatalities coded for March 30, 14 for fatalities for March 31, and 13 fatalities for Apr. 1).
A leader of Otash camp for the displaced, east of Nyala, was killed by militiamen.
Residents of Es Sururab in west Omdurman clashed over a land dispute. 10 people injured, some taken to hospital. Police broke up the fighting.
Unknown gunmen attempted to steal the vehicle of a Popular Police Forces coordinator. When he protested, the gunmen shot him dead.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military forces in Rashad.
Unidentified persons attacks market in Ottash IDP, South Darfur. One death reported.
Hundreds of medical staff staged a sit-in at the Ministry of Health in Nyala in protest of the delay of February salaries.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: National Intelligence and Security Service (NISS) assaulted a number of lawyers protesting in front of the Khartoum North Criminal Court, during a trial session of opposition leaders Faroug Abu Eisa and Dr Amin Mekki Madani. The lawyers were severely beaten, taken to another location and further beaten, before being released 9 hours later.
Soldier raped 13-year-old girl in Tabit.
7,000 displaced in Murnei camp assembled at Freedom Square near camp, protesting against the upcoming election and the governments demand for UNAMIDs departure.

Government militia attacked the villages of Jambo, Ghireiban and Turra, near Kutum. 41 killed, 7 injured,and 4 abducted over 3 days of attacks (14 fatalities coded for March 30, 14 for fatalities for March 31, and 13 fatalities for Apr. 1).
Gunmen on camels shot and killed a man who tried to intervene when they assaulted two young women in Sani Efendo area of Yassin locality.
150 women in Ed Daein protested against the Zakat Chamber, an Islamic alms institution, over accusations of corruption and nepotism.
A group of militiamen on motorcycles stormed Abyad camp in Gereida and shot one man, who was taken to the hospital.
Clashes between police and unknown militia in Abyad camp in Gereida after police intrvened to stop an attack on camp residents. One policeman wounded.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military in rebel-controlled area of Jebel Ubsim, 25kms southwest of Al Abbasiyya. 8 killed.
SAF dropped 10 bombs on Rowata. 14 civilians killed, 18 wounded. According to a second UN report, 15 women and children died and at least 17 women and children suffered burns.
On 1 April 2015, clashes between vigilante militia and unknown group attempting to steal livestock in Yassin locality. A man was shot dead and another seriously injured.
SAF dropped 19 bombs on Rofita area of Rokerro. 5 villagers killed. 19 houses set on fire.
An air to ground missile is fired on Saraf Omra. No reported casualties.

Government militia attacked the villages of Jambo, Ghireiban and Turra, near Kutum. 41 killed, 7 injured,and 4 abducted over 3 days of attacks (14 fatalities coded for March 30, 14 for fatalities for March 31, and 13 fatalities for Apr. 1).
Clashes between Maaliya and Rizaygat militias in Sabah El Nima area in Abu Karinka. At least 20 killed or injured. Army forces intervened.
Unknown armed group abducted a man collecting firewood in Tarni.
Unknown gunmen killed three civilians in El Meriam, West Korofan.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column17: RSF beat a number of people in El Meiram while robbing them of their vehicles and money. Some civilians detained.
SAF dropped 17 bombs on Burgo area of Fanga in East Jebel Marra. One child killed.
Two pro-government militiamen on camels wearing military uniforms attacked Bakin area in Kas. Shot one men dead.
Pro-government militiamen shot two villagers dead in Malawiya near Mellit.

Clashes between Misseriya and Rizaygat militia at Duraba on the border between East Darfur and West Kordofan states (coordinates for East Darfur capital Ed Daien used). 2 Rizaygat and 3 Misseriya killed on Apr 3.
Inter-tribal clash among Misseriya clans causes one death, nine injuries.
SAF bombed Kroongo village in Miri Payam. 20 homes burnes, 500 households displaced.
SAF bombed Taguli. 7 killed, 4 injured.

Second day of clashes between Misseriya and Rizaygat militia at Duraba on the border between East Darfur and West Kordofan states (coordinates for East Darfur capital Ed Daien used). 1 Rizaygat and 4 Misseriya killed on Apr 4.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military and militias in Kanga village west of Kadugli in South Kordofan. Rebels pursued military to the outskirts of Kelak town.

A group of militiamen on camels beat three young women with whips and and raped a 15-year-old girl of Kassab camp while the girls were collecting firewood 5km north of the camp. Other Kassab camp residents were beat by militiamen the same day while collecting firewood southeast of the camp.

A group of former rebel combatants severely beat the South Darfur Humanitarian Aid Commissioner at the Disarmament, Demobilisation, and Reintegration Commission in Nyala, where the rioters had gathered to demand entitlements.
Third day of clashes between Misseriya and Rizaygat militia at Duraba on the border between East Darfur and West Kordofan states (coordinates for East Darfur capital Ed Daien used).
Mortar shell from military garrison in Deribat killed a mother and child in East Jebel Marra.
SAF dropped 5 bombs on Rowata as UN verification patrol was in the area to confirm an aerial bombardment that occurred Apr. 1.
SAF dropped cluster bombs on Dalami and Umm Durein counties in the first week of April.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column7: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Border Guards supported by Abu Tira shot two men dead in Tofai village, 7km from El Kuma. 2 others were abducted.
Three Janjaweed raped two women at gunpoint in Riheid See Sawa area, 20 km south of Tawila.
SAF bombed Al Kuk village, 9 killed.
SPLM-N ambush SAF troops in Al Abbasiya-Taqali town.
Misseriya militia from Sudan and SAF attacked Dinka Ngok village of Kuoldet, 1km from Abyei. 6 killed.
Civilians attacked by an unknown actor in Sheq Joreb, East Darfur. Five dead, seven injured.
Gunmen on motorcycles ambushed a passenger lorry in Abu Sufyan in Ailliet locality. 10 killed, 8 wounded.
SAF bombed Tunguli, Dalami county. 7 killed.

Anti-election protests by UPF students in Khartoum, moved from El Neelain University and passed Suq el Arabi into downtown Khartoum. Part of the Leave Campaign. Police used tear gas, batons and rubber bullets to disperse protesters. Three students detained. No serious injuries reported.
SPLM-N and army clash in Gissan, south of Ad-Damazin. 9 soldiers killed, including Lt. Ahmed Awad Yassin.
Civilians attacked by an unknown actor in Hillat Ali. Five dead, nine injured.
SPLM-N claim to destroy a military camp in El Dabkar. 4 soldiers killed.
Anti-election protests by students in Amri, Northern State. More than 80 students detained. No injuries reported.
2 killed when an unexploded grenade deonated south of Fanga, East Jebel Marra.
Clashes between unknown gunmen and private security patrol in Al-Wihad neighborhood of Nyala. One civilian killed by a stray bullet.
Arab Baath Socialist Party members protested upcoming elections in Khartoum. 2 members detained.
Clashes between security patrol forces and militiamen during an attempted robbery in Nyalas El Wihda district. One civilian killed by a stray bullet.
SPLM-N in Land Cruisers attacked Debkar village in West Kordofan. 2 killed, several wounded. Rebels looted and burned the local market.
SPLM-N shot down an SAF drone in Um Sardabah in the Nuba Mountains.
Government-backed militia shot and killed a man on a motorcycle in Tunde area, east of Foro Burunga.

column9: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Three militiamen intercepted a UNAMID vehicle in Nyala, ordered the passengers to disembark at gunpoint, and abducted the driver. He was released later that day.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
column7: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Clashes between RSF and unidentified armed group in Ab Kadma in al-Dambaloya area, West Kurdufan. 5 killed.
Residents of Hamidiya camp protested against presidential elections and the reelection of al-Bashir.
National Umma Party staged an anti-election sit-in at its headquarters in Omdurman.
Janjaweed raped a woman from Fallujah village in East Jebel Marra as she was collecting firewood.
Residents of Murnei camp protested against presidential elections and the reelction of al-Bashir.

Several hundred students from Red Sea University in Port Sudan protested in the town center against presidential elections and demanding the arrest of al-Bashir. Police used batons to disperse protesters. No reports of serious injuries.
Residents of Kalma camp protested against presidential elections and the reelection of al-Bashir.
SPLA-N shelled the village of Al Madina. 7 civilians killed.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS detained Nuba ethnic individual on suspicion of being SPLM-N-affiliated. They were held for three days, beaten with water pipes, and released on the street blindfolded.

column9: SPLM-Peace: Sudan People's Liberation Movement (Peace Faction)
column17: SPLM Peace Wing activist abducted from his home in El Roseires by unidentified group.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column9: NUP: National Umma Party; SLM/A: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army; Women (Sudan)
column17: Umma Party activist was forcibly taken from her car by suspected NISS agents in Omdurman. Farouk was released on April 15, after having been severely beaten while in detention. NISS also abducted another SLM member from her home in Omdurman.
Residents of ten camps near Kabkabiya in North Darfur protested against presidential elections and the reelection of al-Bashir.
Anti-election protests in front of Al Neelain University in Khartoum. Several students arrested.
Residents of seven camps near Zalingei in Central Darfur - including Hassa Hissa and Khamsa Dagiag camps - protested against presidential elections and the reelction of al-Bashir.
