SPLM-N attacked polling stations in Habila. Attacks repelled by military. No casualties reported. Polling stations closed.
Anti-election protests in Bindisi camp.
For second day, residents of seven camps near Zalingei in Central Darfur - including Hassa Hissa and Khamsa Dagiag camps - protested against presidential elections and the reelection of al-Bashir.
SPLM-N attacked polling stations in Abbasiya. Attacks repelled by military.
Thousands of displaced from Murnei camp protested elections in Freedom Square at the center of Murnei. Police and militia in vehicles injured 5 protesters with bullet wounds.
SPLM-N shelled El Rahmania on the first day of presidential elections.
SPLM-N reported to have kidnapped civilians in South Kordofan the week of presidential elections.
For a second day, residents of Hamidiya camp protested against presidential elections and the reelction of al-Bashir.
SPLM-N shelled Tumat on the first day of presidential elections. Two babies injured.
Janjaweed attacked the market of El Salam camp, east of Kabkabia. They beat and whipped merchants and fired bullets at passing vehicles.
Anti-election protests in Ronga Tas camp in Azum locality.
Continuing clashes between SPLM-N and military in Al Abbasiya.
Anti-election protests in Ronga Tas camp in Azum locality.
A group of women abducted a man securing a polling station in Dabri.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Prison Guards
column17: Clashes between prison guards and escaping prisoners in Zalingei. Prisoners seized Dushka machine guns and fled to the forest north of Zalingei, where clashes continued. Unknown number of inmates, policemen and civilians killed and wounded.
SPLM-N fired 3 missiles at Delling town, injuring two children.
Two herders lost their legs stepping on a hand grenade in Umm Dukhun.
Anti-election protests in Kabkabiya camps.
SPLM-N fired 4 missiles at polling stations in Kadugli. 2 women killed.

Anti-election demonstration on at campus at El Fasher University. Police and NCP student members used batons, tear gas and live bullets to stop 200 student protesters from entering the city center. 2 women students wounded and 12 detained and taken to an unknown location.
Anti-election protests in Kalma camp.
A landmine exploded along Dilling-Kadugli road, killing at least 3 people and wounding 3 others.
SPLM-N launched missile attacks on Kadugli and Delling, killing 4 civilians and injuring 9 others (2 fatalities coded for Kadugli, 2 fatalities for Delling).
SAF bomb Fanga. No casualties reported.
SAF bomb Tujur in mid-April. No injuries.

column8: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Dozens of activists gathered in front of the Human Rights Commission demanding the release of Sandra Farouk Kadouda, an activist detained since April 12 by suspected NISS agents. NISS forces got into fist-fights with protesters. No reports of serious injuries.
Anti-election protests at the University of El Fasher for second day in a row. Police dispersed crowds with tear gas.
Militiamen raped a woman near Sese camp in Kereinik locality.

column9: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Prison Guards
column17: Student protests when Red Sea state transported policemen, fire fighters, and prison guards to cast ballots in Deim Arab. Protesters tried to prevent police from entering the district, on the grounds that their names were not listed in the election records, but the forces cordoned off the streets and used tear gas to reach the polling centre.
Military shelled SPLM-N in Chururu, 5km from Kadugli. 3 civilians killed, 5 injured.

Suspected SRF members attacked a police station in Defra oil field near Heglig in west Kordofan in April 2015, killing 2 police officers. Police later seized an SRF vehicle, killed three attackers and captured another six while investigating the incident. Two gunmen were sentenced to death two years later, on 23 April 2017.

On 15 April 2015, following a rape of a Sese camp resident, a group of camp residents stabbed two militiamen responsible for the rape. The militiamen burned two houses in the camp later that evening. Militiamen returned to the camp the following day to demand compensation for the injuries.
SPLM-N launched missile attacks on Kadugli and Delling, killing 4 civilians and injuring 9 others (2 fatalities coded for Kadugli, 2 fatalities for Delling).
Pro-government militia abduct a man in Kutum.
Property destruction: Two polling stations in Al-Sheriff were under fire by an armed group. No casualties reported.
3 SAF soldiers killed in SPLM-N bombing of an unidentified camp in South Kordofan.
SAF bomb Korongo. 1 injured.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Military Intelligence Service
column17: Military intelligence detained a displaced man at Sirba bus station and beat him severely, shaving his head with glass shards.
SAF warplane bombed rebel-held Tanpona areas in Kurmuk county. 1 civilian killed, 5 wounded. SPLM-N forces responded by targeting NCP forces and miitia positions.
SAF internal clash for unknown reason. No reported fatalities.
Clashes between gunmen and police in al-Jeer neighborhood of Nyala. 1 civilian hit and killed by a stray bullet.
SAF bomb Eral village in Heiban County. At least 1 killed.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Sudanese Popular Liberation Front attacked Abu Tira in Dafra oil field near Heglig. 31 policeman reportedly killed. One gunmen killed. Two policeman captured.
Recruitment: SAF recruits child soldiers in Balulah.
Pro-government militia attacked 13 displaced women 10km north of Kabkabia, lashing and beating them with whips. One women is in a coma.
Recruitment: SAF recruits child soldiers in Altadon.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS and pro-government students abducted and beat a Khartoum University student leader at NISS offices near the Shendi bus station in Khartoum.
Recruitment: SAF recruits child soldiers in Zarafa
Recruitment: SAF recruits child soldiers in Wakara.
Three government-backed militia opened fire and injured on students near El Salam camp.
Militiamen rape a girl near Katur village in Tawila locality.

column6: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: NISS allegedly beat up a student in Omdurmans Wad Nubawi district.

Armed group opened fire on a vehicle belonging to the Ministry of Health in Bergi area, along Deleig-Zalingei road. 3 passengers seriously wounded. Vehicle guards exchanged fire with the attackers and killed one of the gunmen.
Pro-government militia shot and wounded a displaced man near Kendebe, near Sirba camps in West Darfur
Unknown group killed an IDP as he was collecting firewood 7km west of Gereida.
A number of displaced of Shangil Tobaya camp were beaten, whipped and robbed by armed herders and other gunmen.
Pro-government militia opened fire on an emergency night patrol in Nyala, wounding one passenger.
Bomb explosion kills one boy in Nuba Mountains, Southern Kurudfan.
Unknown gunmen shot and killed the Minister of Finance in Nyala.

column9: NCP: National Congress Party; Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
column17: Dozens of students wounded and detained by police, security agents, and NCP student members, in Khartoum when they staged a demonstration against alleged NISS torture of a fellow student. Protesters were beat with batons and hoses. Tear gas used to disperse the crowd.
Hundreds protested in Lagawa against the detention of three members of the Youth for Lagawa.
SPLM-N ambushed a military convoy between Madiem and Maqanza, killing 3 soldiers.
Militiamen shot and injured a man in El Safa district in Kabkabia.

column9: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: UNAMID worker from Ethiopia injured and killed in Mujkar, West Darfur.

column8: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Abu Tira
column17: Militiamen stabbed an Abu Tira soldier to death in El Fasher.
Committee of Solidarity held a sit-in at the National Human Rights Commission in Khartoum, demanding the release of 42 political detainees.

column6: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Border Guards
column17: Joint Sudanese-Chadian border forces stationed at Bir Saliba detain and torture 5 residents of the Sirba camps for 3 days.

column6: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Clashes between UNAMID troops and 40 Zaghawa militia attempting to steal cattle and vehicles on the road between Kass and Shangita, 86km west of Nyala. 5 killed.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military in Kalgo, Bau county, Blue Nile State. 18 soldiers killed, 1 rebel killed.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military in Kalgi, 35kms southwest of Ed Damazin.

column6: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: Protests at UNAMID base in Kass, protesting against clashes between UNAMID and Zaghawa militia occurring earlier in the day. Foreign Ministry claims UNAMID fired on the protesters, killing one.
Movement of forces: JEM forces enter Darfur with a large cache of weapons, violating the terms of an embargo agreement.

column6: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
column17: UNAMID patrol travelling from Nyala attacked by gunmen near Kas. 4 peacekeepers injured.
